src_text: Issues in the environment.
tgt_text: Merero ye Bohlokwa Seemong sa Bjale.

src_text: Disaster management after the floods.
tgt_text: Taolo ya Masetlapelo Morago ga Mafula.

src_text: Cabinet expressed condolences to all people who have lost their loved ones in the recent devastating floods that hit several parts of our country, particularly KwaZulu-Natal..
tgt_text: Kabinete lebišitše mahloko yona go batho ka moka bao ba lobilego bao ba phelago le bona mo mafuleng go setla pelo malobanyana ao wetšego dikarolo tša naga ya gaborena, kudukudu KwaZulu-Natal..     Tsebagatšo ya Maemo Masetlapelo Bosetšhaba gotee le magato kimollo ya ikonomi maphelong batho ao tsebagaditšwego ke Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa malobanyana mo be nepile go netefatša kgato ye nago le mohola le ya go rulaganywa ka tsela ye maleba go potologa didiko ka moka ka mmušo, ka Senthara ya Bosetšhaba ya Taolo ya Masetlapelo..     R1 bilione ya go tlišwa ke mmušo gare šomišwa go thekga maitekelo kimollo le go boetša seemo sekeng, go bušetša ditirelo tša motheo sekeng le go fana ka thušo ya botho ka sebopego sa dijo, madulo, tlhwekišo le diaparo..     Tshepedišo ya go agaleswa mafelo ao amilwego ke mafula šetše thomile ka ge batho ba naga ya gaborena ba ipopa ngatana ye tee ka maikemišetšo go thuša bao ba lobilego magae le dithoto tša bona.

src_text: The declaration of National State of Disaster and socio-economic relief interventions recently announced by President Cyril Ramaphosa, sought to ensure an effective and coordinated response across all spheres of government, through the National Disaster Management Centre..
tgt_text: Tsebišo ya Seemo sa Bolwetši bja Coronavirus (COVID-19).

src_text: The R1 billion made available by the government is being used to support relief and recovery efforts, restore basic services and provide humanitarian assistance in the form of food, water, shelter, sanitation and clothing..
tgt_text: Kabinete hlobaetšwa ke tlhatlogo ya bjale ya diphetelo tša COVID-19 dikarolong tše dingwe tša naga ya gaborena ebile hlohleleditše batho ka moka go latela magato go ihlokomela gore ba itšhireletše kgahlanong le baerase ye ya go iša batho ga maotwanahunyela, kudukudu ka nako ye ya marega.

src_text: The process to rebuild affected areas has already started as the people of our country unite in their determination to assist those who have lost their homes and possessions.
tgt_text: Baerase ye santše le tlhobaboroko yeo tšwelago pele ebile meento sale sebetša sa go ba le mohola kudu sa go itšhireletša.

src_text: Update on the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19).
tgt_text: Kabinete thabišwa ke gore batho ba bantši ba tšea sephetho sa go hlaba meento bjalo ka mekgwa ya bona ya mathomo ya go itšhireletša kgahlanong le COVID-19 morago ga gore dipalopalo tša moragorago di laetše gore re fihleletše phenyo ya go feta seripa sa meento bathong ba bagolo diprofenseng tše tlhano..     Kabinete dira boipiletšo go bao ba sa kago ba hlaba meento go dira bjalo gore ba itšhireletše le go šireletša bao ba phelago le bona.

src_text: Cabinet noted with concern the recent spike in COVID-19 infections in some parts of the country and urged all people to take precautionary measures to protect themselves against the deadly virus, especially during winter.
tgt_text: Re swanetše go tšwelapele go obamela magato ka moka thibelo ya COVID-19, go akaretšwa le go apara maseke wa go pipetša nko le molomo, go hlapa matsogo ka meetse le ka sesepe goba ka go šomiša sanithaesa sa diatla sa go tswakwa ka alekhohole ya go feta 70%, le go šielana sekgala sa go bolokega se ka bago mithara tee..     Thušo ya Tšhelete ya Kimollo ya Masetlapelo Leago (SRD).

src_text: The virus is still constant threat and vaccination remains the most effective weapon to protect ourselves.
tgt_text: Kabinete hlohleleditše badudi bao ba amogelago Thušo ya tšhelete ya SRD ya R350 go dira dikgopelo gape morago ga gore go tsebagatšwe melao ye meswa ya go laola dikgopelo le maswanedi go hwetša thušo ye ya tšhelete.

src_text: The cabinet is pleased that more people continue to choose vaccination as their first line of defence against COVID-19 after recent statistics showed that we have reached the milestone of over 50 per cent of adult vaccinations in five provinces.
tgt_text: Dikgopelo di ka dirwa wepsaeteng ya Etšensi ya Afrika Borwa ya Tšhireletšego ya Leago (SASSA) mo go https://srd.sassa.gov.za/.

Peakanyo ya dikgopelo butšwe ka la 23 Moranang 2022 ebile ke tshepedišo yeo dirwago ka mokgwa wa titšithale ka moka ga yona go kgontšha gore dikgopelo di dirwe ka bonako..     Thušo ye ya tšhelete ya kimollo ke boikokotlelo bja go bolokega go malapa go ihlokela bao ge nkabe se ka yona ba ka be ba amilwe gampe ke lemena la bohloki le tlhokego ya mešomo.

src_text: Cabinet calls on those who have not yet been vaccinated to do so to protect themselves and their loved ones.
tgt_text: Mmušo ikgafetše go fana ka thušo ya leago go bao ba lego kotsing gore le bona ba kgone go fihlelela dinyakwa tša motheo.

src_text: We should also all continue to adhere to all COVID-19 prevention protocols, including the wearing of mask that covers both the nose and mouth, washing hands with water and soap, or using 70% alcohol-based hand sanitiser, and keeping safe social distance of at least one metre..   Social Relief of Distress (SRD) Grant.
tgt_text: Polokego le Tšhireletšego.

src_text: Cabinet encouraged citizens receiving the R350 SRD Grant to reapply, following the introduction of new regulations governing applications and eligibility for the grant.
tgt_text: Kabinete tšwelapele go sola ka bogale dipolao tša go setla pelo tša basadi ebile amogetše magato bonako ka bahlankedi ba phethagatšo ya molao ge ba kgonne go golega bagononelwa ba go amana le lehu la Mohumagatšana Hillary Gardee (28), wa kua Kamagugu gola Mpumalanga.

src_text: Applications can be lodged on the South African Social Security Agency (SASSA)  website: https://srd.sassa.gov.za/.
tgt_text: Kabinete sotše gape le polao ya batho ba tshela kua Khayelitsha, Motsekapa.

src_text: The application system opened on 23 April 2022 and is fully digital process to enable quick turnaround times..
tgt_text: Dipolao tše tša go setla pelo ke segopotšo go rena sa gore re swanetše go dira tšohle bjalo ka setšhaba go fediša dikgaruru ka kakaretšo le dikgaruru tša go ikala ka bong le polao ya basadi (GBVF)..     Kabinete hlohleleditše batho ka moka ka mo nageng go šomišana le mmušo go lwantšha bosenyi le GBVF.

src_text: The relief grant is an important safety net for needy families who would otherwise be devastated by the scourge of poverty and unemployment.
tgt_text: Re le mmogo re ka netefatša gore setšhaba sa gaborena le mebila bolokegile bathong ka moka, go akaretšwa batšofadi, basadi le bana.

src_text: Government is committed to providing social assistance to the most vulnerable so that they can meet their basic needs.
tgt_text: Ikonomi.

src_text: Safety and security.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše pulo ya semmušo ya fabriki ya go foroma ditena ya Corobrik Kwastina gola Driefontein profenseng ya Gauteng ka Mopresidente Ramaphosa ka Laboraro, 4 Mopitlo.

src_text: Cabinet continues to condemn the senseless killing of women and has welcomed the swift response by law-enforcement officers in arresting suspects in connection with the death of Ms Hillary Gardee (28), of Kamagugu in Mpumalanga.
tgt_text: Faporiki ye ye tšwago pele ka theknolotši ya sebjalebjale bopa karolo ya dipeeletšo tša R800 milione, tša go gata ka mošito tee le dipeeletšo tše dingwe gape tša go lekana R200 milione tšeo go lebeletšwego gore di tla oketša mešomo ya tšweletšo ya lekgwara ka Corobrik gola KwaZulu-Natal.

src_text: Cabinet further condemned the killing of six people in Khayelitsha, Cape Town.
tgt_text: Corobrik ke ye nngwe ya dikgwebo tše mmalwa tšeo di phethagaditšego kgoeletšo ya Mopresidente Ramaphosa dikgwebong tša Afrika Borwa le tša boditšhabatšhaba go beeletša ikonoming ye.

src_text: These senseless murders are reminder that we must do more as society to end violence and gender-based violence and femicide (GBVF)..
tgt_text: Kabinete lemogile gore ikonomi ye fokolago ya haedrotšene tsošološitšwe ge Anglo American tsebagatša lori ya go sepela ka haedrotšene.

src_text: Cabinet urged all people in the country to work with the government in the fight against crime and GBVF.
tgt_text: Lori ye yeo go dirilwego diphetogo go yona gore sepele ka haedrotšene go tšwa go disele, le go sepela gape ka dipeteri tša mohuta wa lithium-ion ke ya mathomothomo lefaseng.

src_text: Together we can ensure that our communities and streets are safer for all people, including the elderly, women and children..  Economy.
tgt_text: Ikonomi ya haedrotšene hlaotšwe bjalo ka yeo tlago pele ga tšohle godimo ga ikonomi ya naga ya borena ya go ikala ka tlhago, le go sepetša kgolo ya ikonomi le tlhomo ya mešomo..     Kabinete amogetše dipeeletšo tše dingwe ka gare ga ikonomi ya gaborena ka khamphani ya dijo ya Ireland ya go bitšwa The Kerry Group, yeo butšego polante ye mpsha ya go bitša R650 milione kua Hammarsdale, KwaZulu-Natal yeo nepilego go tšweletša dijo tša go swarelela nako ye telele kontinenteng.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the official opening of Corobrik’s Kwastina brick manufacturing factory at Driefontein in Gauteng by President Ramaphosa on Wednesday, 4 May.
tgt_text: Polante ye ke ya moswananoši ka baka la gore thekga mekgwa ye mmalwa ya go swarelela lebaka le le telele go akaretšwa didirišwa tša tšhomišo ya fase ya enetši, go fehlwa ga mohlagase ka seetša sa letšatši go fokotša tirišo ya mohlagase go tšwa go tšweletšo ya mohlagase ya ka mo nageng, tšhomišo ya phišo ge go fišwa dilahlwa go fehla mohlagase, le mekgwa ya go šoma gabotse ya go ageletša meetse, go šomiša seswa le go fokotša tšhomišo ya ona.

src_text: The state-of-the-art factory forms part of an R800 million investment, which goes hand in hand with further R200 million earmarked to expand Corobrik’s concrete operations in KwaZulu-Natal.
tgt_text: Khamphani ye ya Kerry Group fihlile ka mo Afrika Borwa ka 2011, le gona dipeeletšo tša yona tšeo di tšwelago pele ke sešupo sa gore Afrika Borwa santše le naga ya boikgethelo dipeeletšong.

src_text: Corobrik is one of several local businesses that have responded to President Ramaphosa’s call on South African and international enterprises to invest in this economy.
tgt_text: Dipeeletšo tše di gata mohlaleng wa tsebagatšo ya bene yeo dirilwego ka mo nageng ya Isuzu D-Max gola Gqeberha kua Kapa Bohlabela kgwedi ya go feta.

src_text: Cabinet noted that the fledgling hydrogen economy has been given boost with the launch of hydrogen-powered truck by Anglo American.
tgt_text: Mohuta wo moswa wa D-MAX ke seka sa go rweša kgare maikgafo Isuzu ka mo Afrika Borwa ebile ke ye nngwe ya dikatlego tšeo di fihleletšwego ka fase ga Lenaneotlhabollo la Tšweletšo ya Difatanaga (APDP).

src_text: The truck – which was converted from diesel to hydrogen, and is powered in part by lithium-ion batteries – is world first.
tgt_text: Lenaneo la APDP ke setlamo sa tlhohleletšo ya botšweletši intastering ya dikoloi leo nepokgolo ya lona lego go hlohleletša palo ya godimo ya dikoloi tšeo di tšweletšwago mo intastering ya difatanaga yeo go boletšwego ka yona, go tlhohleletša boleng bja tlaleletšo lefapheng la intasteri ya dikoloi gore go hlongwe mešomo go potologa makala le dikgwebokamano ka moka tša difatanaga.

src_text: The hydrogen economy has been identified as strategic priority for our country’s green economy, and to drive economic growth and employment..
tgt_text: Go tla dirwa tšhelete ya go balelwa R2,8 bilione go Makala le dikgwebokamano tša tšweletšo ya ka mo nageng ka magatotatelano APDP.

src_text: Cabinet also welcomed further investment into our economy by an Irish food company, The Kerry Group, which has opened new R650-million plant in Hammarsdale, KwaZulu-Natal aimed at producing sustainable food for the continent.
tgt_text: Dipeeletšo tše di tla hloma mešomo ya thwi ya go feta ye 1 000 polanteng le go thwala ka tsela ya go rarela batho ba go lekana 24 000 gomme se se tla thuša kudu go kaonafatša setšhaba mo seleteng se..     Indaba ya tša Meepo.

src_text: The plant is unique as it boasts numerous sustainability features including low energy usage equipment, solar power generation to reduce consumption from the local grid, waste heat capture, and efficient water capture, reuse and reduction.
tgt_text: Tiragalo ya Indaba ya Meepo ya Afrika ya 2022 yeo bego swaretšwe kua Sentharengkgoparara ya Boditšhabatšhaba gola Motsekapa go thoma ka la 9 go fihla ka la 12 Mopitlo 2022 ke ye nngwe ya difala tše kgolokgolo tša dikopano le tša kgwerano magareng ga bakgathatema ka moka intastering ya meepo.

src_text: The Kerry Group has had presence in South Africa since 2011, and their further investment is sign that South Africa remains an investment destination of choice.
tgt_text: Morero wa tiragalo ye ke wo: “Mpshafatšo ya Meepo ka mo Afrika: Go Beeletša ka gare ga Diphetogo tša Enetši, ESG, le Diikonomi”.

src_text: These investments follow in the footsteps of the launch of the locally manufactured Isuzu D-Max bakkie in Gqeberha in the Eastern Cape last month.
tgt_text: Kabinete nale tshepho ya gore Indaba ye ya Meepo tla thuša go laetša le go hlohleletša Afrika Borwa go ba naga ya boikgethelo dipeeletšong.

src_text: The new generation D-MAX crowns Isuzu’s commitment to South Africa and is one of the successes achieved under the Automotive Production Development Programme (APDP).
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa amogela dipeeletšo tšeo di dirilwego ka mo nageng ya gaborena ebile ikgafetše go hlola maemo go kgontšha phethagalo ya kgolo ye akaretšago ya ikonomi le diphetogo ikonoming.

src_text: The APDP is production incentive scheme for the motor industry aimed at promoting production volumes in the specified motor vehicle industry, promoting added value in the automotive component industry thus creating employment across the automotive value chain.
tgt_text: Dikamano tša Boditšhabtšhaba le tša Dilete.

src_text: Approximately R2,8 billion will be generated in local content production value through the lifecycle of the APDP.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše Kopano ya malobanyana mo ya Mopresidente Ramaphosa ge be kopana le Mopresidente Joe Biden wa Amerika, Mopresidente Emmanuel Macron wa Fora le Mopresidente Hakainde Hichilema wa Zambia difaleng tša go fapafapana.

src_text: The investment will secure more than 1 000 direct jobs at the plant and indirectly employ 24 000 people, contributing significantly to community upliftment in the region..  Mining Indaba.
tgt_text: Dikopano tše di kgontšhitše Mopresidente go matlafatša dikamano tša magareng ga dinaga magareng ga Afrika Borwa le mebušo ya dinaga tšeo gweranego le tšona mererong ye bohlokwa ya dilete le ya boditšhabatšhaba, go karetšwa le go tla ka tharollo ya go rena moya wa khutšo dithulanong tša Ukraine     Diphetho tša Kabinete.

src_text: The Investing in African Mining Indaba 2022 held at the Cape Town International Convention Centre from 9 to 12 May 2022, is one of the biggest platforms for engagement and collaboration between all stakeholders in the mining industry.
tgt_text: Diboutu tša Tekanyetšokabo.

src_text: The theme of the event was: “Evolution of African Mining: Investing in the Energy Transition, ESG, and the Economies”.
tgt_text: Kabinete dira boipiletšo go badudi ka moka go šala morago Diboutu tša go fapafapana tša Tekanyetšokabo tša go tla ka dikgoro tša mmušo tša bosetšhaba le ka Kantoro ya Mopresidente gore ba tle ba kgone go netefatša gore mmušo wa ikarabela diphethong tša ona..     Ka nako ya Diboutu tša Tekanyetšokabo, dikgoro ka moka di fana ka tlhalošo ye tseneletšego ya dithulaganyo tša ona le ka mananeo ao beilwego pele ngwaga.

src_text: Cabinet is confident that the Mining Indaba will assist in showcasing and promoting South Africa as an investment destination of choice.
tgt_text: Diboutu tša Tekanyetšokabo di nepile go netefatša gore dikhwama tša mmušo di šomišwa ka pabalelo gore di tle di kgone go fihlelela dinyakwa tša batho setšhabeng..     Diboutu tše tša Tekanyetšokabo di fana gape le ka monyetla wo mobotse go Ditona gore ba kgone go hlatholla goya pele mošomo wa mmušo, go akaretšwa le dikatlego le ditlhotlo..     Phethagatšo ya Leanopeakanyo la Gase ya Petroleamo yeo Fetošeditšwego Diela (LPG).

src_text: South Africa welcomes investments into our country and is committed to creating favourable conditions for inclusive growth and transformation of the economy.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go hlongwa ga Phethagatšo ya Leanopeakanyo la LPG, leo le phatlaladitšwego ka Hlakola.

src_text: International and regional relations.
tgt_text: Leanopeakanyo le le nepile go oketša intasteri ya LPG ka mo nageng.

src_text: Cabinet also welcomed President Ramaphosa’s recent interactions with President Joe Biden of the United States, President Emmanuel Macron of France and President Hakainde Hichilema of Zambia on different platforms.
tgt_text: LPG tla ba le mohola wo mogolo go fetošafetoša methopo ya enetši..     Leanopeakanyo le, magareng ga magatotharollo mangwe, le tla laola go bewa ga ditheko magatong dikgwebokamano le go thekga bohlami bja disilintere tša LPG ka mo nageng.

src_text: These engagements allowed the President to strengthen bilateral relations and cooperation between South Africa and partner states on key regional and international issues, including finding peaceful solution to the conflict in Ukraine  Cabinet Decisions.
tgt_text: Le tla thuša gape go ruta batho setšhabeng ka mehola ya go šomiša LPG bjalo ka mokgwa wo mongwe wa enetši..     Leanopeakanyo le le tla thoma go hwetšagala morago ga ge le phatlaladitšwe ke Kgoro ya Methopo ya Diminirale le Enetši mo go www.dmr.gov.za.

src_text: Budget Votes.
tgt_text: Tlhako ye Logetšwego Maano ya Bosetšhaba ka Temošo ya Ditokelo tša bao ba Phelago ka Bogole – Kwalakwatšo ya Masolo Batho ba go Phela ka Bogole.

src_text: Cabinet calls on all citizens to follow the various Budget Votes by national government departments and The Presidency so that they can hold the government to account..  During Budget Votes, all departments give detailed account of their plans and priorities for the year.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše Tlhako ye Logetšwego Maano ya Bosetšhaba godimo ga Temošo ya Ditokelo tša Digole – Go Hloma Masolo Batho ba go Phela ka Bogole.

src_text: Budget Votes seek to ensure that public funds are spent efficiently in meeting the needs of the public..
tgt_text: Tlhako ye nepile go fa tlhahlo go bobedi mafapha praebete le setšhaba go netefatša gore ditokelo tša batho ba go phela ka bogole di šireletšwa, goya le ka fao di hlalošitšwego ka gare ga Molaotheo wa Rephabliki ya Afrika Borwa wa.

src_text: They also provide the ideal platform for Ministers to further unpack the work of government, including successes and challenges..  Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) Rollout Strategy.
Cabinet approved the LPG Rollout Strategy for implementation, which was published for public consultation in March.
tgt_text: Tlhako ye fana ka setlabakelo seo se tla thušago go fediša mapheko semorafe ge go tšewa diphetho, kudukudu diphetho tša go amana le batho ba go phela ka bogole thuša gape le ka go lemoša batho ba go phela ka bogole go tseba ditokelo tša bona goya le ka fao di šireleditšwego ke Molaotheo.

src_text: The strategy seeks to expand the LPG industry in the country.
tgt_text: Tlhako ye fana le ka tlhahlo, dipego tša babegaditaba le go lemoša batho setšhabeng ka ditokelo tša batho ba go phela ka bogole kgontšha Sengwalwa sa Makgoraditsela ka Ditokelo tša Batho ba go Phela ka bogole.

src_text: LPG will contribute meaningfully to the diversification of sources of energy..
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa ke ye nngwe ya dinaga tša go tsenela Kwanokgoparara ya Ditšhabakopano (UN) ka ditokelo tša Batho ba go Phela ka Bogole le Tshepedišo ya UN Kwanong ya Afrika ka Ditokelo tša Botho le Ditokelo tša Batho ba go Phela ka Bogole (Tshepedišo ya Afrika ya Ditokelo tša Digole).

src_text: The strategy will amongst other interventions, regulate the pricing in the value chain and support the manufacturing of LPG cylinders in the country.
tgt_text: Tlhako ye rerišanwe le bakgathatema ka moka, go akaretšwa le Khansele ya Bosetšhaba ya Bašomi le Tlhabollo ya Bosetšhaba.

src_text: It will also educate the public about the benefits of using LPG as an alternative form of energy..
tgt_text: Samiti ya Tsamaišo ya Naga le Pušetšo ya Naga Mafelong Dinagaborekwa.

src_text: It will be accessible after it has been published by the Department of Mineral Resources and Energy on www.dmr.gov.za.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go swarwa ga Samiti ya Tsamaišo ya Naga le Pušetšo ya Naga  Mafelong Dinagaborekwa ka Labohlano, 27 le ka Mokibelo, 28 Mopitlo 2022 gola Gauteng.

src_text: National Strategic Framework on Disability Rights Awareness-Raising Campaigns for Persons with Disabilities.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše Pego ya Maikemišetšo ka Tsamaišo ya Naga le Pušetšo ya Naga Mafelong Dinagaborekwa ka Hlakola.

src_text: Cabinet approved the National Strategic Framework on Disability Rights Awareness-Raising Campaigns for Persons with Disabilities.
tgt_text: Kabinete file tlhahlo ya gore ditherišano tša goya pele di swarwe gotee le bakgathatema ba maleba.

src_text: The framework seeks to guide both private and public sectors in ensuring the rights of persons with disabilities are protected, as enshrined in the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of.
tgt_text: Samiti ye tla ba tatelano le pheletšo ya mošomo wo dirilwego ngwageng wa go feta, fao dikgopolo tša bakgathatema ba go fapafapana di tla akaretšwago     Ditiragalo tšeo di Tlago.
Khonferense ya Bohlano ya Lefase ka Bophara ya Phedišo ya Tšhomišo ya Bana Bokgoba.

src_text: The framework provides toolkit that will assist in the removal of discriminatory barriers in decision-making, especially those related to persons with disabilities.
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa tla swara Khonferense ya Bohlano ya Lefase ka Bophara ya Phedišo ya Tšhomišo ya Bana Bokgoba kua Sentharengkgoparara ya Boditšhabatšhaba ya Durban gola KwaZulu-Natal go thoma ka Lamorena, 15 go fihla ka Labohlano, 20 Mopitlo.

src_text: It also conscientise persons with disabilities to know their rights as protected by the Constitution.
tgt_text: Ke lekga la mathomothomo Mokgatlo wa Boditšhabatšhaba wa Bašomi (ILO) swara khonferense ye ka mo Afrika..     Baetapele ba mebušo, ditona tše 120, baemedi ba seboka sa boraro ba dinaga tše 187 tše lego maloko ILO, dietšensi tša UN, ditheo tša thuto, mekgatlo yeo thomilwego setšhabeng, babegaditaba le mekgatlo setšhabeng go letetšwe gore be gona khonferenseng ye.

src_text: The framework also provides training, media reporting and awareness-raising within society on the rights of persons with disabilities.
tgt_text: Tiragalo ye tla fa Afrika Borwa monyetla wa go hlagiša Molaotheo wa naga ye ka ge šireletša ditokelo tša bana.

src_text: It gives effect to the White Paper on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities.
tgt_text: Naga ye tla kopana le dinaga tša go fapafapana tšeo di lego pejana ga rena go fedišwa tšhomišo ya bana bjalo ka makgoba le go ithuta go tšwa go bona..     Imbizo ya Mopresidente ya Mmotlolo wa Tlhabollo ya Dilete (DDM).

src_text: South Africa is signatory to the United Nations (UN) Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and the UN Protocol to the African Charter on Human and Peoples’ Rights on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (African Disability Rights Protocol).
tgt_text: Mopresidente Ramaphosa tla swara Imbizo ya Mopresidente ya DDM gola  Mpumalanga ka Labohlano, 20 Mopitlo 2022 ka fase ga morero wo: “Ga go tlogelwe motho morago”.

src_text: The framework was consulted with all relevant stakeholders, including the National Economic Development and Labour Council.
tgt_text: Bjalo ka sefala se bohlokwa sa kgathotema setšhabeng, Imbizo ye dumelela Mopresidente go kgokagana thwi le bakgathatema ba go fapafapana – kudukudu baduding ba dinagamagae – le go theeletša dillo le ditlhotlo tša bona ka nepo ya go di rarolla.

src_text: Land Administration and Land Tenure in Communal Areas Summit.
tgt_text: Imbizo ya Mopresidente ya DDM nepile gape le go tloša tseleng mapheko go šitiša kabo ya mohlakanelwa ya ditirelo le go hlohleletša kgathotema setšhabeng ka go tsamaišana le DDM.

src_text: Cabinet approved the hosting of the Land Administration and Land Tenure in Communal Areas Summit on Friday, 27 and Saturday, 28 May 2022 in Gauteng.
tgt_text: MaAfrika Borwa ba ka šala morago le go kgatha tema ditherišanong tša dikgokagano tša leago ka fase ga hashtag #PresidentialImbizo.

src_text: Cabinet adopted the Position Paper on Land Administration and Land Tenure in Communal Land Areas in March.
tgt_text: Kgwedi ya Afrika.

src_text: It directed that further consultation be undertaken will all relevant stakeholders.
tgt_text: Meketeko ya ngwaga ka ngwaga ya Kgwedi ya Afrika ka Laboraro, 25 Mopitlo gare ya ketekwa ka fase ga morero wo: “Ngwaga wa Phepho: Go tiišeletšwa phepho le tšhireletšego ya dijo kontinenteng ya Afrika”..     Bjalo ka karolo ya ponelopele ya lebaka le le telele yeo theilwego ka gare ga Lenaneothero la 2063 (leo lego seakanywa sa Afrika sa tlhabollo go fihlelela tlhabollo ye akaretšago le ya go tšea nako ye telele go hlabolla seemo sa ikonomi maphelong mo mengwageng ye 50 ye tlago), morero šeditše mabokgoni batho ba Afrika go lebeletšwe kudu basadi, batšwamahlalagading le bana.

src_text: The summit will be the culmination of the work that was done in the past year, which solicited inputs from various stakeholders  Upcoming Events.
tgt_text: Se se bohlokwa tlhabollong ka ge se tliša maphelo ao kaonafetšego go motho mang le mang, letseno leo le hlatlogetšego godimo le meputso yeo kaonafetšego ya dinaga.

src_text: Fifth Global Conference on the Eradication of Child Labour.
tgt_text: Tiragalo ya go itshwanetša le noši ya meketeko ya Kgwedi ya Afrika ke Beke ya Afrika ya Dikgokagano, yeo tlo swarelwago kua Constitutional Hill gola Johannesburg go thoma ka la 23 go fihla ka la 27 Mopitlo.

src_text: South Africa will host the Fifth Global Conference on the Eradication of Child Labour at the Durban International Convention Centre in KwaZulu-Natal from Sunday, 15 to Friday, 20 May.
It is the first time the International Labour Organisation (ILO) hosts this conference in Africa..
tgt_text: Kgwedi ya Afrika ke monyetla wa go hlohleletša botee bja Afrika le momaganyo ye tseneletšego ya dilete tša yona, le go ikgafa ka leswa katlegong ye swanago ya Afrika.

src_text: Heads of state, 120 ministers, tripartite constituents of 187 member countries of the ILO, UN agencies, academic institutions, civil society organisations, non-governmental organisations, media and civil society are expected to attend the conference.
tgt_text: Kabinete gopotša motho mang le mang gore kgahlego ya rena ya bosetšhaba ke monwana le lenala le tielelo ya Afrika, botee le katlego     Melaetša.

src_text: The event will also allow South Africa to bring to the fore the country’s Constitution as it protects the rights of children.
tgt_text: Mahloko     Kabinetee lebiša mahloko yona go malapa le bagwera ba: Mme Phindile Xaba (53), yo bilego le mošomo wo motelele wa go hlomphega intastering ya babegaditaba, ka mo Afrika Borwa le ka mošate šomile bošego le mosegare go kaonafatša naga ya gaborena.

src_text: The country will engage with different countries that are ahead of us in eliminating child labour and learn from them..  District Development Model (DDM) Presidential Imbizo.
tgt_text: Motseta Silumko Sokupa (74), yo hlanketšego Etšensi ya Tšhireletšego ya Mmušo maemong go fapafapana mo mošomong wa gagwe wa go tšea nako ye telele le wa go hlomphega Ditirelong tša Mmušo.Moprofesara Francis Wilson (83), raikonomi wa go tsebega kudu le mothomi wa Yuniti ya Bašomi ya Borwa bja Afrika le ya Tlhabollo ya Dinyakišišo     Bao ba Thwetšwego Mešomong Batho ka moka bao ba thwetšwego mešomong mangwalo bona dithuto tlo netefatšwa le go tiišeletšwa ka tsela ye maleba.

src_text: President Ramaphosa will hold DDM Presidential Imbizo in Mpumalanga on Friday, 20 May 2022 under the theme: “Leave no one behind”.
tgt_text: Ngaka Kesavan Naidoo bjalo ka Motlatša Molaodipharephare (DDG): Tlhabollo ya Setheo kua Kgorong ya Tirišano ya Makala Mmušo (DCoG).

src_text: As an important public participation platform, the Imbizo allows the President to directly engage various stakeholders – especially rural communities – and to listen to their issues and challenges with the aim to address them.
tgt_text: Ntate Siphosihle Emmanuel Hlomuka bjalo ka DDG: Thekgo ya Pušoselegae le Taolo ya Magato kua DCoG..     Ntate Risimati Patrick Mathye bjalo ka DDG: Taolo ya Ditirelo tša Meetse le Tlhwekišo kua Kgorong ya Meetse le Tlhwekišo (DWS)..     Ntate Collin Xolani Zwane bjalo ka DDG: Taolo, Kobamelo le Phethagatšo kua DWS.

src_text: The DDM Presidential Imbizo aims to unlock blockages to integrated service delivery and promote public participation in line with the DDM.
tgt_text: Ntate Melanchton Makobe bjalo ka DDG: Kgonthišišo ya Pušo ya SOC le Bodiragatši kua Kgorong ya Dikgwebo tša Mmušo     Kabinete dumelelane le Ditona ka dithwalo tšeo di latelago:.

src_text: South Africans can follow and participate in discussions on social media under the hashtag #PresidentialImbizo.
tgt_text: Ntate Bhekuyise Mathews Khenisa bjalo ka Mohlankediphethišimogolwane (CEO) wa Etšensi ya Tlhabollo ya Dintlo (HDA).

src_text: Africa Month.
tgt_text: Mme Joy Keledi Masemola bjalo ka Mohlankedimogolwane wa Ditšhelete (COO) wa HAD.

src_text: The commemoration of the annual Africa Month and Africa Day on Wednesday, 25 May is being celebrated under the theme: “The Year of Nutrition: Strengthening resilience in nutrition and food security on the African continent”..  As part of the long-term vision set out in Agenda 2063 (which is Africa's development blueprint to achieve inclusive and sustainable socio-economic development over 50 years), the theme focuses on the potential of the people of Africa with an emphasis on women, adolescents and children.
tgt_text: Ngaka Cornelius Ruiters bjalo ka CEO ya Lepelle Northern Water.

src_text: Issues in the environment.
tgt_text: Matsapa go Boetša Seemo Sekeng le go Aga ka Leswa Morago ga Mafula.

src_text: Recovery and rebuilding efforts after the floods.
tgt_text: Kabinete retile le go thabela batho ka moka le mekgatlo ge tsentšhitše letsogo mo matsapeng go boetša seemo sekeng le go aga ka leswa morago ga mafula moragorago go setla pelo dikarolong tše dingwe tša naga, kudukudu gola KwaZulu-Natal.

src_text: Cabinet expressed its praise and appreciation to all people and organisations involved in recovery and rebuilding efforts following the recent devastating floods in some parts of the country, especially in KwaZulu-Natal.
tgt_text: Kabinete lebogile gape le mekgatlo ye sego ya mmušo, mekgatlo ya sedumedi, setšhaba ka kakaretšo, bengdikgwebo le mekgatlo ya go imolla batho maima bona yeo abetšego batho dijo, diaparo, mapai, diphuthelwana tša mengatana ya lehlapo, diyunifomo tša dikolo go malapa ao wetšwego ke masetlapelo gore ba kgone go fihlelela dinyakwa tša bona tša motheo.

src_text: It thanked all non-governmental organisations, faith-based organisations, communities, business people and relief organisations that have provided food, clothes, blankets, dignity packs and school uniforms to vulnerable families to meet their basic needs..
tgt_text: Senthara ya Bosetšhaba ya Taolo ya Masetlapelo tla kopantšha didiko ka moka tša mmušo mo matsapeng yona go fana ka kimollo ya moya wa botho malapeng ka moka ao amilwego ke mafula.

src_text: The National Disaster Management Centre continues to coordinate all spheres of government in its efforts to provide humanitarian relief to all affected households.
tgt_text: Ditirelo tša go abela batho madulo di gare di abelwa batho ba go feta 7 000 mo dileteng tšeo di amilwego go se lekane le selo gola KwaZulu-Natal..     Mošomo šetše thomile go aga madulo lebakanyana malapa go angwa ke mafula mo nageng ye lego ya mmušo ye hlaotšwego gola KwaZulu-Natal ka kgonagalo ya gore malapa a ka šuthišetšwa fao.

src_text: Sheltering services are being provided to over 7 000 people in the four worst affected districts in KwaZulu-Natal..   Work has started on building temporary residences for affected families on state-owned land parcels that have been identified in KwaZulu-Natal for possible resettlement.
tgt_text: Kabinete tiišeleditše maikgafo mmušo go laola dikhwama tša kimollo ya masetlapelo ka šedi ye kgolo le ka go se fihle selo.

src_text: Cabinet affirmed government’s commitment to managing the flood relief funds prudently and transparently.
tgt_text: Mohlakišipharephare wa Afrika Borwa fana ka ditirelo tša tlaleletšo tša go bea seemo leihlo le go lebiša dikhwama dinyakweng tše dingwe ka go tsamaišana le peakanyo ya tekanyetšo ya mmušo.

src_text: The Auditor-General of South Africa is providing an additional monitoring service and the reprioritisation of funds is in line with the government’s budgeting system..   Update on the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19).
tgt_text: Tsebišo ya Seemo sa Bolwetši bja Coronavirus (COVID-19).

src_text: Cabinet urged all people in South Africa to take precautionary measures to prevent the spread of COVID-19 after latest statistics showed marked increase in the rate of infections and illnesses associated with the winter season in the country..
tgt_text: Kabinete hlohleleditše batho ka moka mo Afrika Afrika go tšea magato tlhokomelo go efoga go phatlalala ga COVID-19 morago ga gore dipalopalo tša moragorago di laetše tlhatlogo ye bonagalago ya kelo ya diphetelo le malwetši go amana le sehla sa marega ka mo nageng..     Kabinete re gopoditše ka moka ga rena go tšwelapele go ihlokomela le go hlokomela ba bangwe ka go hlapa matsogo rena goba go sanithaesa kgafetšakgafetša, go apara dimaseke ge re le ka gare ga meago, go šielana sekgala sa go bolokega, go bula mafastere gore go hlabele moya le go hlaba meento.

src_text: Cabinet reminded everyone to continue safeguarding ourselves and other people by washing or sanitising our hands regularly, wearing mask when indoors, maintaining safe social distance, opening windows for ventilation and vaccinating.
tgt_text: Meento santše le boiphemelo bjo bo kaonekaone kgahlanong le COVID-19 ka ge thibela malwetši šoro, go amogelwa maokelong le go efoga mahu go hlolwa ke COVID-.

src_text: Vaccination remains the best defence against COVID-19 as it prevents severe illness, hospitalisation and even death.
tgt_text: Ga go hlokege aterese ya mo dulago pele ka entelwa.

src_text: You do not need home address to vaccinate.
tgt_text: Motho mang le mang, wa go ba le pasa goba sena yona ka hlaba moento ntle le tefo mafelong bohle go hlaba meento go potologa naga ka bophara.

src_text: Any person, with or without an identity document, can get vaccinated for free at all public vaccination sites across the country.
tgt_text: Semorafe se fele!.

src_text: Stop racism!.
tgt_text: Kabinete sotše ka bogale ditiragalo ka moka tša semorafe ka mo nageng, go akaretšwa le ditiragalo tšeo di begilwego Sekolong seo se Phagamego sa Good Hope Seminary le Yunibesithing ya Stellenbosch gola Kapa Bodikela.

src_text: Cabinet strongly condemned all acts of racism in the country, including the reported incidents at the Good Hope Seminary High School and the University of Stellenbosch in the Western Cape.
tgt_text: Ditiragalo tše tša mahlabišadihlong di thulana le metheo ya Molaotheo yeo naga ya rena ya temokrasi ithekgilego ka yona, yeo akaretšago seriti sa botho, go se kgetholle ka semorafe, go se kgetholle ka bong, tekatekano le tlhomphano..     Molaotheo wa Rephabliki ya Afrika Borwa wa 1996 ke ona re hlahlago gore re fediše ditiragalo tšeo di tšwago kua morago tša go se hlamatsege tšeo di dirago gore re se be ngatana ye tee le tšeo di abelanago ka toka ka go se swane.

src_text: These deplorable acts go against the constitutional values on which our democratic country was founded, which include human dignity, non-racialism, non-sexism, social justice, equity and respect..
tgt_text: Batswadi ba hlohleletšwa go ruta bana go ganetša semorafe le go thabela ditšo tša go fapafapana, bjalo ka karolo ya lesolo la rena la mohlakanelwa la go hlohleletša kago ya setšhaba le phedišano setšhabeng re šomeng mmogo go bea nyanyeng semorafe nako le nako ge se se thoma go ba setlwaedi sa ka mehla le go romela molaetša wo bogale wa gore semorafe ga sena bodulo ka mo nageng ya gaborena ya temokrasi..     Dikamano tša Afrika Borwa le Germany.

src_text: The Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 is our guide towards eradicating the despicable divisions and injustices of the past.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše ketelo ye atlegilego ya semmušo ka Mokhanseliri wa Rephabliki ya Germany, Mohlomphegimogolo Olaf Scholz, go tla ka mo Afrika Borwa ka Labobedi, 24 Mopitlo.

src_text: Parents are urged to teach children to reject racism and embrace diversity, as part of our concerted drive to promote nation-building and social cohesion.
Let us work together to expose racism wherever it is treated as the norm and send clear message that there is no space for it in our democratic country..   South Africa – Germany relations.
tgt_text: Ketelo ye ya Semmušo ka Mokhanseliri Scholz ebile gona ka baka la taletšo ya go tšwa go Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa yo eteletšego pele seboka sa go kgontšha dikamano tše botse tša dilete le tša boditšhabatšhaba, gotee le go goka dipeeletšo tšeo di hlokagalago kudu.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the successful Official Visit by Chancellor of the Federal Republic of Germany, His Excellency Olaf Scholz, to South Africa on Tuesday, 24 May.
tgt_text: Baetapele ba bababedi ba boletše ka, magareng ga tše dingwe, mekgwa ya go thoma tirišano magorong go swana le enetši le phetogo ya klaemete, kgwebišano le dipeeletšo, le magato kgahlanong le COVID-19 le nyakego ya meento.

Baetapele ba ba ile ba lebeledišiša kgatelopele ye lego gona kontinenteng ya Afrika le maemong boditšhatšhaba, go akaretšwa le dithulano nageng ya Ukraine le ditlamorago tša gona go lebeletšwe ikonomi ya boditšhatšhaba le tšhireletšego ya dijo le ya enetši..     Germany se fela mogwebišani wa bobedi wo mogologolo wa Afrika Borwa, eupša ke gape mothopo wa boraro wo mogologolo wa baeti ba moše mmeeletši wo mogolo le mogwebišani go tša tlhabollo..     Khonferense ya Bohlano ya Lefase ka Bophara ka Phedišo ya Tšhomišo ya Bana Bokgoba.

src_text: Chancellor Scholz’s Official Visit was at the invitation of President Cyril Ramaphosa, who is leading the government crusade to foster good regional and international relations, as well as attract much-needed investments.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše thumo ye atlegilego ya Khonferense ya Bohlano ya Lefase ka Bophara ka Phedišo ya Tšhomišo ya Bana Bokgoba yeo bego swaretšwe gola Durban go thoma ka la 15 go fihla ka la 20 Mopitlo.

src_text: The two leaders discussed, among others, ways to enhance cooperation in areas such as energy and climate change, trade and investment, and responses to COVID-19 and vaccine demand.
tgt_text: Bakgathatema go tšwa lefaseng ka bophara ba bile gona khonferenseng ye, yeo bego swerwe ka tšhomišano le Mokgatlo wa Boditšhabatšhaba wa Bašomi..     Morago ga go rerišana ka ditlwaedi tše botse tše phethagaditšwego ke dinaga tša go fapafapana le go hlaola mabošaedi le magato ka pelapela ao nyakegago go akgofiša phedišo ya bobedi tšhomišo ya bana bokgoba le ya dikgoka, bakgathatema khonfereseng ye ba kwanetše morero wo ‘Boipiletšo bja Durban bja go Tšea Magato’ go swaragana le lemena la tšhomišo ya bana bokgoba.

src_text: They also reflected on developments on the African continent and internationally, including the conflict in Ukraine and its impact on the international economy and food and energy security..   Germany is not only South Africa’s second-largest trading partner, but it is also the third-largest source of overseas tourists major investor and development partner..  5th Global Conference on the Elimination of Child Labour.
tgt_text: Tšhomišo ya bana bokgoba ke ye nngwe ya go laetša bohlogo bjo bo ka dirwago ke setšhaba ebile išeletša bana maemong kotsi.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the successful conclusion of the 5th Global Conference on the Elimination of Child Labour held in Durban from 15 to 20 May.
tgt_text: Tšhomišo ya bana bokgoba ka boyona ke tlaišo ebile thibela bana go hwetša thuto ye maleba le menyetla ye mengwe ya go ba hlabolla.

src_text: Stakeholders from the around the world attended the conference, which was held in collaboration with the International Labour Organisation..   After discussing good practices implemented by the different countries and identifying gaps and urgent measures needed to accelerate the elimination of both child and forced labour, they adopted the ‘Durban Call to Action’ to deal with the scourge of child labour.
tgt_text: Ngwana wo mongwe le wo mongwe ka mo Afrika Borwa nale tokelo yeo ka se ganetšwego ke motho ya gore šireletšege kgahlanong le ditlwaedi tša go jabetša tša go šomišwa bokgoba.

src_text: Child labour represents the worst of society and exposes children to dangerous situations.
tgt_text: Tokelo ya go hwetša thuto ya motheo gona ka gare ga Molaotheo wa rena ebile goya le ka Molao wa Dikolo wa Afrika Borwa, 1996 (Molao 84 wa 1996), “motswadi mang le mang swanetše go gapeletša morutwana ofe goba ofe yo lego ka fase ga taolo ya gagwe go ya sekolong go tloga ka letšatši la mathomothomo la go bulwa ga dikolo ngwageng wo go fihlela ge morutwana wo fihlelela mengwaga ye šupa goba mphato wa bosenyane, goya le ka gore go tlile efe pele”..     Goya ka Molao wa Bana, 2005 (Molao 38 wa 2005), “ga gona motho yo dumeletšwego go šomiša, go bapatša, go nea goba go thwala ngwana goba go mo diriša mo mešomong bjalo ka mo mešomong ya tšhomišo ya bana bokgoba”     Diphetho tša Kabinete.

src_text: It constitutes abuse and prevents children from getting an education and other developmental opportunities.
tgt_text: Kwanelo ya Kwano ya Boditšhabatšhaba ka go Šireletšwa ga Batho ka Moka Kgahlanong le go Nyameletšwa ka Dikgoka ke Maphodisa (ICPPED).

src_text: Every child in South Africa has the inalienable right to be protected from exploitative labour practices.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše tlhagišo ya ICPPED Palamenteng go lebeledišišwa le go dumelelwa go šomišwa ga kwano ye ke Afrika Borwa.

Kwano ye ke tumelelano yeo tlemago gohlegohle ya Ditšhabakopano (UN) yeo swaraganego le go gatakwa ga ditokelo tša botho ka go nyameletšwa ga batho ka dikgoka ke maphodisa..     Kwano ye hlaloša go nyameletšwa ga batho ka dikgoka ke maphodisa go akaretša go tšhabišwa, go golegwa, go swarwa goba mokgwa ofe goba ofe wo pheletšo ya ona ka dirago gore mosolwa latole go dumela goba gona go uta fao motšwasehlabelo lego gona..     Ge šetše dumetše gore kwano ye tsenywe melaong ya rena ya ka mo nageng, Afrika Borwa go tla letelwa gore begele UN mengwaga ye mengwe le ye mengwe ye mebedi ka fao phethagatšago seo se dumeletšwego kwanong ye.

src_text: The right to basic education is enshrined in our Constitution and in terms of the South African Schools Act, 1996 (Act 84 of 1996), “every parent must cause every learner for whom he or she is responsible to attend school from the first school day of the year in which such learner reaches the age of seven years until the last school day of the year in which such learner reaches the age of 15 years or the ninth grade, whichever occurs first”..
tgt_text: Kwano ye fana ka magato thibelo ao dinaga tšeo di lego maloko kwano ye di swanetšego go hloma go efoga go nyameletšwa ga batho ka dikgoka ke maphodisa dinageng tša bona tša go fapafapana..     Pego ya Bone ya Naga ya Afrika Borwa ka Tšhireletšo le Tlhohleletšo ya Ditokelo tša Botho.

src_text: In terms of the Children’s Act, 2005 (Act 38 of 2005), “no person may use, procure, offer or employ child for child labour”   Cabinet decisions.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše tlhagišo ya Pego ya Bone ya Naga ye ka Tšhireletšo le Tlhohleletšo ya Ditokelo tša Botho go Khansele ya Ditokelo tša Botho ya Ditšhabakopano.

src_text: Accession to the International Convention for the Protection of all Persons from Enforced Disappearance (ICPPED) .
tgt_text: Bafetleki ba UN ba Gohlegohle le ba Kgafetšakgafetša ba tla fetleka pego ye ge ngwaga ela go fela.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the ICPPED to Parliament for consideration of South Africa acceding to the convention.
tgt_text: Go tloga mola bago naga ye kwanetšego ya Kwano ya UN ya Ditokelo tša Botho, Afrika Borwa sekasekilwe makga mararo, ebile tshekatsheko ya mafelelo dirilwe ka Lewedi..     Pego ye fana ka seemo sa ditšhišinyo tše 187 tše amogetšwego go tšwa tshepetšong ya diphetleko tša ngwaga wa.

src_text: The convention is universally binding treaty of the United Nations (UN) that deals with the violation of human rights through the enforced disappearance of people..
tgt_text: Dikgopolo di hweditšwe go tšwa go tshedimošo yeo kgonthišišitšwego, tshedimošo go tšwa go dikgoro tše maleba, Ditheo tša go Thekga Molaotheo le mekgatlo ye maleba ya go tšwa setšhabeng..     Kabinete thabišitšwe ke kgatelopele ye fihleletšwego phethagatšong ya ditšhišinyo tše le fao mošomo sa tšwelago pele gona.

src_text: The convention defines the enforced disappearance to include abduction, arrest, detention or any other forms which may result in the perpetrator’s refusal to acknowledge or even conceal the whereabouts of the victim..   Once acceded to be domesticated into our laws, South Africa will be expected to report every two years to the UN on how it is giving effect to the convention.
tgt_text: Pego ye tla dirwa phatlalatša morago ga ge hlagišeditšwe UN ka Phato.

src_text: The convention provides preventative measures the member countries need to put in place to prevent the enforced disappearance of persons in their respective countries..   South Africa’s fourth Country Report on the Protection and Promotion of Human Rights.
tgt_text: Pholisi ya  2022 ya Taolo ya Meetse Meepo.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the fourth Country Report on the Protection and Promotion of Human Rights to the United Nations Human Rights Council.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše Pholisi ya 2022 ya Taolo ya Meetse Meepo gore phethagatšwe.

src_text: The UN Universal Periodic Review will review the report later this year.
tgt_text: Pholisi ye fana ka mekgwa le magato go šireletša le go babalela tšhomišo ya meetse.

src_text: Since being signatory to the UN Human Rights Convention, South Africa has been reviewed three times, with the last review done in September..
tgt_text: Yona lekalekanya ditiragalo tša ikonomi tša meepo ka taelo ya go kgontšha tšhomišo ye swarelelago ya meetse ka mo nageng ya gaborena.

src_text: The report provides an update on the 187 accepted recommendations from the 2017 review process.
tgt_text: Godimo ga magato mangwe, pholisi ye hlatholla mehola le maikarabelo ka gare ga didiko tše tharo tša mmušo mabapi le merero ya go amana le meetse ka meepong.

src_text: Inputs were drawn from verified data, information from relevant departments, Chapter 9 institutions and relevant civil-society organisations..
tgt_text: Diphetogo tšeo di šišintšwego di tla rarolla ditlhotlo tša go thoma go hloma melao ya go iletša bao ba hlolago tšhilafalo le go dira gore go be moroba go gapeletša molawana wa gore mang le mang yo hlolago tšhilafalo rwešwe maikarabelo go phošolla goba go bušetša morago.

src_text: Cabinet is pleased with the progress made in implementing the recommendations and also with those areas that are still work in progress.
tgt_text: Pholisi ye hlamilwe ka go tsamaišana le Molao wa Bosetšhaba wa Meetse, 1998 (Molao 36 wa 1998).

src_text: The report will be made public once it has been tabled to the UN in August.
tgt_text: Pego ka Tlhako ya Thulaganyo ye Hlamilwego goya ka Bong, Bolekanyetši, Phetleko ya Mošomo le Botlhakiši.

src_text: Mine Water Management Policy of.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše pego ya mošomo wo dirilwego godimo ga phethagatšo ya Tlhako ya Thulaganyo ye Hlamilwego goya ka Bong, Bolekanyetši, Phetleko ya Mošomo le Botlhakiši.

src_text: Cabinet approved the Mine Water Management Policy of 2022 for implementation.
tgt_text: Kabinete thabetše kgatelopele ye kgolo ye fihleletšwego ke bontši bja dikgoro tša mmušo go hloma ditheong tša tšona tlhako ye yeo sale amogelwa ka 2019 gore phethagatšwe..     Ga sale go tloga fao, dikgoro tše ntši di thomile go hloma dinyakwa tše bohlokwa tša pholisi ye go hlahla mananeo thupetšo ao nepišitšwego basading, go baswa le bathong ba go phela ka bogolofadi.

src_text: The policy provides mechanisms to protect and conserve water usage.
tgt_text: Kabinete dirile gape le boipiletšo bja tekolo ya mošomo le dipego tše tiišeleditšwego letsogo, kudukudu go tše dingwe tša dikgoro tšeo go fihla gabjale di sa kago tša fa dipego.

src_text: It balances the mine economic activities with the mandate to provide sustainable water usage for the country.
tgt_text: Dipoledišano tša Baswa go Hlompha Nelson Mandela (NMYD).

src_text: Amongst other interventions, the policy clarifies the roles and responsibilities within the three spheres of government with regard to mine water issues.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše NMYD go kgatlampana ngwaga ka ngwaga go thoma ka.

src_text: The proposed changes will resolve the challenges of instituting sanctions on polluters and make it easy to invoke the polluter pays principle.
tgt_text: NMYD ya pulamadibogo tla swarwa go thoma ka la 7 go fihla ka la 20 Mosegamanye.

src_text: The policy is developed in line with the National Water Act, 1998 (Act 36 of 1998).
tgt_text: Le ke lesolo la Mopresidente go nea baswa ba Kontinente ye monyetla wa go tsenela dipoledišano tše di ba agago mererong ye ba amago kudu..     Dipoledišano tše, tšeo di tla bego di bolela ka senatla sa rena sa boditšhabatšhaba bago Mopresidente wa Maloba Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela – di tla thoma ka dipoledišano tše ka maikemišetšo go ruta batho ka go itlwaetša boetapele bja  potego mo Afrika.

src_text: Report on the Framework on Gender Responsive Planning, Budgeting, Monitoring Evaluation and Audit.
tgt_text: Dipoledišano tše di tla nea baswa monyetla wa go nyetlela ba bangwe ka bohwa bjo humilego bja ditšo tša bona.

src_text: Cabinet received the progress report on the implementation of the Framework on Gender Responsive Planning, Budgeting, Monitoring Evaluation and Audit.
tgt_text: Lesolo le le tla tiišeletša le dikamano tša magareng ga batho go lebeletšwe baswa ba kontinente ye.
Kgoro ya Basadi, Baswa le Batho ba go Phela ka Bogolofadi tla fana ka dintlha ka botlalo tša lenaneo le ditiragalo tšeo di tla bago gona ka moragonyana.

src_text: Cabinet appreciated the great progress made by number of government departments in institutionalising the framework that was adopted in 2019 for implementation.
tgt_text: Pego ya 2021/22 ya Ngwaga ka Ngwaga ya go Bewa Leihlo ga Bodiragatši ka Matlafatšo ya Basadi le Tekatekano ya Bong, Tlhabollo ya Baswa le Tlhohleletšo ya Ditokelo tša Batho ba go Phela ka Bogolofadi.
Kabinete amogetše pego ya ngwaga ka ngwaga ya go bewa leihlo ga bodiragatši go lebeletšwe pego ya 2021/22 ya go matlafatšwa ga basadi, baswa le batho ba go phela ka bogolofadi.

src_text: More departments have since put in place policy priorities to guide the mainstreaming programmes targeting women, youth and persons with disabilities.
tgt_text: Pego ye latišiša mohlala wa ditaetšo tše bohlokwa tša tlhohleletšo ya tekatekano, maemo mešomo, taolo le go kgatha tema ga dihlopha tše tša batho ka gare ga ditiragalo tša dikgoro le makalakgwebo go laolwa ke mmušo.

src_text: Cabinet has called for tighter monitoring and reporting, especially on some of the departments that have not yet reported.
tgt_text: Pego ye ngwadilwe ka go bapetšwa le tlhako ya bolekanyetši bjo bo hlamilwego goya ka bong, phetleko ya mošomo le botlhakiši yeo amogetšwego ke Kabinete ka     Melaokakanywa.

src_text: Nelson Mandela Youth Dialogue (NMYD).
tgt_text: Molaokakanywaphetošwa wa Maphelo le Polokego ya tša Meepo.

src_text: Cabinet endorsed the NMYD to take place annually starting in.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go phatlalatšwa ga Molaokakanywaphetošwa wa Maphelo le Polokego ya tša Maphelo gore setšhaba se fe ditshwayotshwayo.

src_text: The inaugural NMYD will take place from 7 to 20 July.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywa wo šetšane le go kaonafatša maphelo le polokego ya bašomedi ba meepo, go akaretšwa le tikologo yeo go yona ditiragalo tša meepo di phethagalago.

src_text: This is the Presidential initiative to afford the youth of the Continent platform to engage in constructive dialogues on matters that affect them.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywa wo fetoša Molao wa bjale wa Maphelo le Polokego ya tša Meepo, 1996 (Molao 29 wa 1996).

Diphetošo tše di fetekilwego magareng ga tše dingwe, di fana ka tlhathollo ya mangwe mareo ka Molaong wo, di tiišeletša tlhako ya taolo ya tša maphelo le polokego le go di bapiša le ditlwaedi tše kaonekaone tša boditšhabatšhaba mabapi le polokego meepong.

src_text: The dialogues – which will be anchored on our international icon former President Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela – will start conversations to inculcate the culture of an ethical leadership in Africa.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywaphetošwa wa Molaotheo wa bo-18 wa.

src_text: They will afford young people an opportunity to share their rich cultural heritage.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše phatlalatšo ya Molaokakanywaphetošwa wa 2022 wa bo-18 wa Molaotheo gore setšhaba se fe ditshwayotshwayo tša sona le gape gore Tona ya Toka le Tshokollo ya Bagolegwa, Morena Ronald Lamola kgone go fana ka tsebišo ye nago le dintlha ka botlalo tša diphetošo tšeo di šišinywago Molaotheong..     Molaokakanywa wo fetoša Karolo 6(1) ya Molaotheo wa Rephabliki ya Afrika Borwa wa 1996, wo bolelago gore maleme semmušo 11 Afrika Borwa ke Sepedi, Sesotho, Setswana, siSwati, Tshivenḓa, Xitsonga, Afrikaans, English, isiNdebele, isiXhosa le isiZulu..     Diphetošo tše di tla dira gore Polelo ka Diatla ya Afrika Borwa (SASL) lemogwe bjalo ka polelo ya semmušo ya bo-12 ya naga ye ebile tla iša pele kamogelo ya yona ya setšo le go netefatša ditokelo tša go lekalekana go MaAfrika Borwa ka moka, go sa kgathale bogolofadi bja bona.

src_text: The initiative will also strengthen people-to-people relations amongst the youth of the continent.
tgt_text: Kgoro ya Thuto ya Motheo šetše lemoga SASL bjalo ka polelo ya letswele     Ditiragalo tšeo di Tlago.

src_text: The Department of Women, Youth and Persons with Disabilities will provide details of the programme for the events at later stage.
tgt_text: Beke ya Tšhireletšo ya Bana.

src_text: 2021/22 Annual Performance Monitoring Report on Women Empowerment and Gender Equality, Youth Development and Promotion of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities.
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa tla keteka Beke ya Bosetšhaba ya Tšhireletšo ya Bana go thoma ka la 29 Mopitlo go fihla ka la 4 Phupu 2022 ka fase ga morero wo: “A re šireletšeng Bana nakong ye ya COVID-19 le go fetela pele”..     Mo gare ga beke, šedi ya moswananoši tla lebišwa godimo ga tlhobaboroko ya bosetšhaba ya go ima ga ditšwamahlalagading, yeo hlatlogetšego godimo nakong ya COVID-19 ka ditšwamahlagading bao ba beleilego masea ka..     Kabinete dirile boipiletšo bja mohlakanelwa go tšwa go batswadi, mekgatlo ye lego setšhabeng, dihlopha tša sedumedi le setšhaba ka kakaretšo gore be ngatana ye tee go thuša go fokotša tlhatlogo ya go ima ga ditšwamahlalagading.

src_text: Cabinet received the annual performance monitoring report for the 2021/22 report on the empowerment of women, youth and persons with disabilities.
tgt_text: Foramo ya Bolefase ya Ikonomi (WEF).

src_text: The report tracks the key indicators in the promotion of equity, level of employment and the ownership and participation of these groups in the activities of the departments and the state-owned entities.
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa kgatha tema go WEF gola Davos-Klosters, Switzerland go thoma ka la 22 go fihla ka la 26 Mopitlo 2022, ka fase ga morero wo: “Re šoma mmogo, go bušetša potego sekeng”..     Afrika Borwa hlompha monyetla wa go ba karolo ya tharollo le go nyetlela naga tše dingwe maitemogelo rena foramong ya bolefase.

src_text: The report is compiled against the gender-responsive planning budgeting, monitoring, evaluation and Auditing framework which was adopted by Cabinet in   Bills.
tgt_text: Go ba gona ga naga ya rena kua WEF go bohlokwa go godiša seriti sa rena bjalo ka naga ya dipeeletšo lefaseng ka bophara, ka go nyetlela lefase ka bophara ponelopele ya bokamoso le go bonagatša ditlhabollo tše diswa ka mo nageng.

src_text: Mine Health and Safety Amendment Bill.
tgt_text: Kgwedi ya Baswa.

src_text: Cabinet approved the publication of the Mine Health and Safety Amendment Bill for public comments.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše Lenaneo la Kgwedi ya Baswa la 2022 ka fase ga morero wo: “Tlhohleletšo ya mekgwa ya boiphedišo ya go tšea telele le bopelotelele bja baswa go fihlelela bokamoso bjo kaone”.

src_text: The Bill seeks to improve the health and safety of the mine employees, including the environment in which mining operations take place.
tgt_text: Letšatši la semmušo la Baswa le tla ketekwa gola Kapa Bohlabela..     Letšatši le ke anibesari yabo-46 ya 16 Phupu 1976 ya megwanto ya baswa kgahlanong le go gapeletšwa go ithuta dithuto ka moka ka leleme la Afrikaans..     Ka moya wa Phupu 1976, Kabinete dirile boipiletšo go baswa ba naga ye go kalokana le tlhotlo ya tlhokego ya mešomo yeo golelago godimo basweng ka go kgatha tema mananeong go ba hlabolla go swana le boithutelamošomo le boithutela maitememogelo mošomo.

src_text: The Bill amends the current Mine Health and Safety Act, 1996 (Act 29 of 1996).
tgt_text: Mmušo hlamile mananeo go thekga go thwalwa ga baswa le tlhomo ya mešomo ya lebakanyana.

src_text: The revised amendments provide, among others, clarity on some of the concepts in the Act, strengthen the health and safety regulatory framework and align it with international best practices with regard to safety in the mines..
tgt_text: Dikgwebo le tšona di hlohleletšwa go gokagoketša baswa ba bangwe ba bantši mešomong ka go ba hlolela dibaka tša mešomo..     Lenaneo la baswa la kgwedi ka moka ya Phupu le akaretša ditiragalo ka moka go thoma ka go thakgolwa ga lesolo la baswa la makgoraditsela, go tsebagatšwa ga Lenaneo la Moemedi wa Leswaokgwebo la NYDA le bontši bja go thomišwa ga Ditirelo tša Bosetšhaba tša Baswa go potologa naga ka bophara..     Tona Kantorong ya Mopresidente ya Basadi, Baswa le Bao ba Phelago ka Bogolofadi tlare go se goye kae hlatholla lenaneo ka botlalo.

src_text: The Constitution Eighteenth Amendment Bill of 2022 .
tgt_text: Ditiragalo ka moka tša baswa go letetšwe gore di obamele ditshepedišo tša maphelo tša COVID-.

src_text: Cabinet approved the publication of the Constitution Eighteenth Amendment Bill of 2022 for public comments and that the Minister of Justice and Correctional Services, Mr Ronald Lamola, can give notice with particulars of the proposed amendment to the Constitution..
tgt_text: Samiti ya Dinaga tša go Laolwa ke Magoši.

src_text: The Bill amends Section 6(1) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996, which proclaims that South Africa’s 11 official languages are Sepedi, Sesotho, Setswana, siSwati, Tshivenda, Xitsonga, Afrikaans, English, isiNdebele, isiXhosa and isiZulu..
tgt_text: Mmušo, ka tšhomišano le Setheo sa Bosetšhaba sa Ntlo ya Magoši tla swara Samiti ya Dinaga tša go Laolwa ke Magoši ka Labohlano, 27 le ka Mokibelo, 28 Mopitlo go rerišana ka merero ya go amana le taolo ya naga..     Tše ka moka di akaretša tshepedišo ya go fetišetša dinaga tša go laola ke magošigo tšwa Mmušong goya go beng ba tšona ba maloka maleba lego taba ye bohlokwa go matlafatša batho ba go tšwa dinagamagaeng.

src_text: The amendments will give recognition to the South African Sign Language (SL)as the 12th official language of the country and will advance its cultural acceptance and affirm equal rights for all South Africans, irrespective of their disabilities.
tgt_text: Ditiragalo tša go dira gore batho ba palelwe ke go ba beng ba dinaga ba semmušo mo dinageng tšeo ba dulago go tsona ko magaeng ga sesefatše fela ditokelo tša batho bao tša go bale naga ye lego ya bona eupša fokotša le mabokgoni bona go šomiša yona naga yeo go kaonafatša maphelo bona le maemo bona ditšhelete     Melaetša.

src_text: The Department of Basic Education already recognises the SASL as home language   Upcoming events.
tgt_text: DitebogišoKabinete lebiša ditebogišo tša yona le go lakaletša mahlatse le mahlogonolo go: Mme Leanne Manas, Modiragatši wa Lenaneo la Mesong la SABC la Morning Live, ge amogeditšwe sefoka sa Botswerere bja Bosetšhaba sa go bitšwa Knight of France go tšwa France ka Labobedi, 17 Phupu 2022, ka go kgatha tema ga gagwe go bongwadi, bobegaditaba le magoro mangwe kakaretšo go fapafapana..     Mahloko Kabinete lebiša mahloko yona go malapa le go bagwera ba: Ntate Mpho Moerane (52), Meyaraphethiši wa maloba wa Toropokgolo ya Johannesburg, yo gape bego le mafolofolo mo dipolotiking bophelo bja gagwe ka moka le mohlankedi wa batho ba Johannesburg.

src_text: Child Protection Week.
tgt_text: Pele tlo thwalwa go ba Meyaraphethiši hlanketše setšhaba bjalo ka Leloko la Komiti ya Meyara ya go šoma ka Tikologo le Ditirelo tša Mananeokgoparara.

src_text: South Africa will mark National Child Protection Week from 29 May to 4 June 2022 under the theme: “Let us Protect Children during COVID-19 and Beyond”..   During the week, special attention will be drawn to the national issue of teenage pregnancy, which saw spike during COVID-19 of teenagers giving birth in..
tgt_text: Ngaka Deborah Fraser (56), seopedi sa mmino wa sedumedi yo thopilego difoka tše mmalwa yo malobanyana mo hlomphilwego ka Bongaka bja Filosofi ka Mmino wo Galalelago ka Christian Leadership Academy.Ngaka Namane Magau (70), serutegi sa go hlomphega kudu le leloko leo le hlomphegago la Lekgotla la Babolokedi la Khansele ya Bosetšhaba ya AIDS ya Afrika Borwa.Ntate Mike Schüssler (60), raikonomi wa go tsebega kudu wa Moafrika Borwa yo bego le mmotegi wa intasteri ye ebile le yena bego kgona go botša batho ka se le sela mabapi le seemo sa ikonomi ya Afrika Borwa.Ntate Jamie Bartlett (56), modiragatši wa go ratega kudu, wa go thopa difoka tše mmalwa tša difala tša Afrika Borwa le bodiragatši bja thelebišene, yo bego tsebega kudu ka ditema tšeo di bapetšego bjalo ka Mike O'Reilly go Isidingo le David Genaro go Rhythm City.Kabinete le yona bile le Mopresidente Ramaphosa go lebiša mahloko mmušong le setšhabeng sa United Arab Emirates (UAE) morago ga go hlokagala ga Lešika la ka Bogošing Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan (73), Mopresidente wa UAE      Bao ba Thwetšwego MešomongBatho ka moka bao ba thwetšwego mešomong mangwalo bona dithuto tlo netefatšwa le go tiišeletšwa ka tsela ye maleba.

src_text: Cabinet called for combined effort from parents, civil society, religious groupings and the community at large to help change the rise in teenage pregnancy.
tgt_text: Ntate Bongani Sinenhlanhla Dladla bjalo ka Mohlankediphethišimogolwane wa Lekgotla la Tlhabollo ya Intasteri ya Kago.

src_text: World Economic Forum (WEF).
tgt_text: Ntate Shabeer Hamid Khan bjalo ka Mmalamatlotlopharephare kua Matlotlong Bosetšhaba.

src_text: South Africa is participating in the WEF in Davos-Klosters, Switzerland from 22 to 26 May 2022, under the theme: “Working Together, Restoring Trust”..   South Africa values the opportunity to be part of the solution and share our experiences at the global forum.
tgt_text: Mme Mendoe Ntswahlana bjalo ka Mohlankedimogolwane wa Dithekišetšano kua Matlotlong Bosetšhaba.

src_text: Our nation’s presence at WEF is also critical to growing our reputation as global investment destination, sharing with the world our vision for the future and highlighting new developments within the country.
tgt_text: Kabinete kwanetše go thwalwa ga badiradikgopelo bao ba latelago go tlatša dikgoba tša mešomo tša Lekgotla la Balaodi ba Sekhwama sa Bohlokwa sa Enetši     Ntate Mosimaneotsile Jim Besnaar; (ii)    Mme Unati Nombakuse-Figlan.

src_text: Issues in the Environment.
tgt_text: Ikonomi.

src_text: Economy .
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše dikgatelopele tša moragorago tše kaonafetšego ka magato go rarolla seemo sa naga ye ao nepilego go hlohleletša kgolo ya ikonomi.

src_text: Cabinet has welcomed the recent positive developments in the country’s interventions aimed at stimulating economic growth.
tgt_text: Goya ka dipalopalo tša moragorago tša tlhokego ya mešomo go tšwa go ba Dipalopalo tša Afrika Borwa, tlhokego ya mešomo theogetše fase go tloga go.

src_text: According to the recent unemployment figures from Statistics South Africa, unemployment decreased from.
tgt_text: 3% kotareng ya bone ya 2021 go fihla go.

src_text: 3 per cent in the fourth quarter of 2021 to.
tgt_text: 5% kotareng ya mathomo ya.

src_text: 5 per cent in the first quarter of.
tgt_text: Palo ya batho ka moka bao ba bego ba sa šome nakong ya ge go dirwa dipalopalo theogetše fase kotareng ya bobedi ka go latelana.

src_text: The expanded unemployment rate has declined for second quarter in row.
tgt_text: Mešomo ye mentši bile gona makaleng mešomo ya setšhaba le ya leago, mešomong ya bohlami le ya kgwebišano..     Palomoka ya Letseno la ka Nageng (GDP) kotareng ya mathomo ya 2022 goletše godimo ka.

src_text: The biggest job gains were in community and social services, manufacturing and trade..
tgt_text: 9% gomme tlhatlogo ye bušetša bogolo bja ikonomi ya gaborena go swana le ka nako ya pele naga ye welwa ke leuba.

src_text: The gross domestic product in the first quarter of 2022 grew by.
tgt_text: Mo kotareng ye, lefapha la bohlami be le lona le legolo la go šoma bokaone ikonoming ka tlhatlogo ya tšweletšo ya petroleamo le dikhemikhale, dijo le dino, le tšhipi le metšhene.

src_text: 9% which takes the size of our economy to pre-pandemic levels.
tgt_text: Ditlhatlogo tše di kaonafetšego di tloga di laetša botse gore ikonomi ya gaborena santše tiile maatla le gore magato go swana le Leano la go Agwa Leswa ga Ikonomi le go Bušetšwa Sekeng ga yona le tloga le nale mošito.

src_text: Over the quarter, the manufacturing sector was the economy’s key performer with an increase in the production of petroleum and chemicals, food and beverages, and metals and machinery.
tgt_text: Kabinete dira boipiletšo go mang le mang go thekga dikgwebo tša ka mo nageng le diintasteri ka go reka ditšweletšwa le ditirelo tša go tšwa ka mo nageng..     Kabinete amogetše sephetho ka kemedi ya kelo ya dikoloto ebago S&P Global go sekaseka ponelopele ya Afrika Borwa ya kelo ya dikoloto go tloga maemong go tielela goya maemong go kgahliša.

src_text: These moderate gains show that our economy remains robust and that interventions such as the Economic Reconstruction and Recovery Plan are gaining momentum.
tgt_text: Kemedi ye ya kelo ya dikoloto netefaditše kharensi ya kelo ya dikoloto ya nako ye telele ya dinagadišele le ya ka mo nageng go tlogelwa maemong BB minus le BB ka go latelana.

src_text: Cabinet calls on everyone to support local businesses and industries by buying local products and services.
tgt_text: Seemo seo se Gakalago sa Ditheko.
Leuba la Bolwetši bja Coronavirus (COVID-19) le dithulano tšeo di tšwelago pele lefaseng di bile le seabe se še šoro dithekong tšeo di gaketšego tša bophelo lefaseng ka bophara.

src_text: Cabinet also welcomed the decision by the rating agency S&P Global to revise South Africa's credit rating outlook – from stable to positive.
tgt_text: MaAfrika Borwa le bona ba hlobaetšwa ke ditheko tšeo di nyologelago godimo tša dibešeletšwa, dijo le tše dingwe tše bohlokwa..     Re swanetše go swarišana ka moka ga rena, re thušane le go seketša didirišwa tša rena mo nakong ye ye boima.

src_text: Rating agency also affirmed the long-term foreign and local currency debt ratings at BB minus and BB respectively.
tgt_text: Mmušo le ona leka ka botšohle go imolla mang le mang, kudukudu bahloki.

Panka ya gaborena ya Afrika Borwa ya Resefe ya go šoma gabotsebotse, ya go tielela le ya go ikema gare thuša go šireletša setšhaba sa gaborena kgahlanong le ditlamorago tše mpe tša infleišene ka go thea infleišene gore be ka fase ga kelo ya fasefase; go ba ka fase ga kelo yeo dinaga tše dingwe tše itemogelago yona ka motsotso wo.

src_text: Cost of living  .
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše sephetho sa Matlotlo Bosetšhaba sa go fana ka koketšo ya phokoletšo ya Lebikakaretšo ya Dibešeletšwa (GFL).

src_text: The Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) pandemic and the ongoing global conflict have had severe impact on the cost of living worldwide.
tgt_text: GFL fokoditšwe ka  50 lithareng ka Moranang le ka Mopitlo, ebile phokoletšo ye tla tšwelapele go tloga ka la 1 Phupu go fihla ka la 6 Mosegamanye.

src_text: South Africans too are frustrated by rising prices of fuel, food and essentials..   We all need to pull together, help each other and save our resources in this difficult time.
Government is doing everything in its power to provide relief for everyone, especially the poor.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše sephetho sa Khomišene ya Diphenkgišano go bea leihlo ditheko tša dijo tša motheo, kudukudu peakanyetšo ya gore dikgwebo di swanetše go fahlela ka mabaka go kwagala ge di nyološa ditheko.

src_text: Our well-functioning, strong and independent South African Reserve Bank is helping to shield society from the ravages of inflation by keeping it within narrow target range; well below what many other countries are currently experiencing.
tgt_text: Foramo ya Kgwebo ya Afrika Borwa le Japan.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the decision by National Treasury to grant an extension of the reduction in the General Fuel Levy (GFL).
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše dipoelo tša Foramo ya Kgwebo ya moragorago ya Afrika Borwa le Japan, yeo kwanetšego lenaneo la phišegelo ya mošomo leo le akaretšago tšhomišanommogo godimo ga go hlongwa ga diintasteri tša go šomiša dimatheriale tša tlhago, ditheknolotši tša difatanaga tša mohlagase le haedrotšene ya go mpshafatšega..     Foramo ye kwanetše go swara pontšho ya mebileng ka dikgokagano tša bidio go laetša menyetla ya Afrika Borwa go dikgwebo tša Japan ka bontši, tlhabollo ya mabokgoni ka gare ga intasteri ya naga ye ya difatanaga, magoro ao lego gona mošomo godimo ga dibaka tša bohlami le neelano ya maitemogelo sethekniki.

src_text: The GFL was cut by  50 litre for April and May, and will be further extended from 1 June to 6 July.
tgt_text: Japan ke ye nngwe ya bagwebišani ba bohlokwa kudu ba naga ya gaborena ebile ke yona eteletšego pele dipeeletšo mafapheng mmalwa Afrika Borwa, go thoma ka lefapha la difatanaga go fihla ka metšhenekgoparara yeo gatetšego pele ya tša meepo, le gape go dikgwebo tša temo go fihla ka ditirelo tša ditšhelete.

Kabinete amogetše gape go hlongwa ga Lenaneo la Baromelantle ba Bathobaso ka Kgoro ya Kgwebišano, Intasteri le Diphenkgišano (the dtic), go kgobokantšha mmogo difeme tša go laolwa ke bathobaso tšeo gabjale di romelago ka ntle diphahlo tša go tšweletšwa ka mo nageng ye go ya dikarolong tše dingwe tša lefase.

src_text: Cabinet also welcomed the decision of the Competition Commission to closely monitor prices of essential food items, particularly the provision that businesses should justify their price increases.
tgt_text: Lenaneo le le tla kgontšha go abelanwa ga tshedimošo, maitemogelo le tsebo ya mabokgoni, ebile le putla godimo ga dikatlego tša Lenaneo la Bahlomi ba Dikgwebo ba Bathobaso (BIS)..     Enetši.

src_text: Japan-South Africa Business Forum.
tgt_text: Magato rena go dira gore mo lebakeng le letelele le le tlago re se hlwe re sokodišwa ke mohlagase thušitše kudu ke magato go neelwa Yuniti 4 ya Setiši sa go Fehla Mohlagase sa Kusile gola Mpumalanga.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the outcomes of the recent Japan-South Africa Business Forum, which agreed to an ambitious work programme that includes collaboration on green industrialisation, electric vehicle technologies and green hydrogen..
tgt_text: Magato a bontšha gape maiteko mangwe Eskom go boetša sekeng peakanyo ya mohlagase ka kakaretšo ebile tla tlaleletša kabo ya mohlagase ka mo nageng ka dimekawate (MW) tše dingwe gape tše..     Kabinete lemogile gore go agwa ga diyuniti tša go fehla mohlagase tše nne godimo ga tše tshela go phethagaditšwe protšekeng ya Setiši sa Mohlagase sa Kusile..     Kabinete amogetše magato go tlaleletša mohlagase wo abiwago nageng ye ka go thomiša phehlo ye mpsha ya mohlagase, gomme ona kgonagetše ka baka la sephetho sa go dumelela bafehli ba mohlagase ba go ikema go tšweletša mohlagase.

src_text: The forum also agreed to virtual ‘roadshow’ to highlight South African opportunities to more Japanese businesses, skills development in the local auto industry, work streams on manufacturing opportunities and the exchange of technical experiences.
tgt_text: Mmušo malobanyana mo sanetše kwano ya go reka 150 MW ya mohlagase go tšwa go motšweletši wa mohlagase wa go mpshafatšega bago, Scatec ASA.

src_text: Japan is one of our most important trade partners and leading investor in number of South African sectors, ranging from automobiles to advanced mining machinery, and from agribusiness to financial services.
tgt_text: Lekgotlakeletšo la Matlafatšo yeo Nabilego ya Bathobaso Ikonoming (B-BBEE).

src_text: Cabinet also welcomed the establishment of the Black Exporters Network by the Department of Trade, Industry and Competition (the dtic), to bring together black-owned firms which are currently exporting locally made goods to other parts of the world.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše thwalo ka Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa ya Lekgotlakeletšo le leswa la naga ye la B-BBEE.

src_text: The network will enable the sharing of information, experience and know-how, and it builds on the successes of the Black industrialist Programme..   Energy.
tgt_text: Lekgotla le le hlangwa ke dihlopha tša mafapha go fapafapana go thoma ka dikgwebo, diyunione tša bašomi, mekgatlo yeo thomilwego setšhabeng le dirutegi, bao ka moka ba tlo rwalago maikarabelo go hlahla mmušo go lebeletšwe diphetogo tša ikonomi.

src_text: Our long-term energy security has been given massive boost following the commercial handover of Unit 4 at the Kusile Power Station in Mpumalanga.
tgt_text: Le ge le gore go bile le kgatelopele ye makatšago ya go bušetša morago megopolo ye fošagetšego ya kgethollo ikonoming, go santše go nale mošomo wo montši wo swanetšego go dirwa go rotoša taolo ya bolaodi bja bathobaso, go hlatloša mabokgoni le go nabiša dithekišetšano go nea basadi ba bathobaso le baswa menyetla.

src_text: This handover marks another milestone in Eskom’s efforts to stabilise the power system and will add 800 megawatts (MW) to the power grid..
tgt_text: Mafula.

src_text: Cabinet noted that the construction of four out of the six generation units had been completed at the Kusile Power Station project..
tgt_text: Matsapa ao tšwelago pele mmušo kimollo diprofenseng tšeo di amilwego ke mafula moragorago tliša dipoelo tša go kgotsofatša.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the addition of new generation capacity to the grid, which was made possible by the decision to allow independent power producers to produce electricity.
tgt_text: Mmušo beile pele kabo ya dijo, meetse le madulo bathong bao ba šutišitšwego le go lokiša mananeokgoparara ao senyegilego.

src_text: Government recently signed an agreement to buy 150 MW of capacity from renewable power producer, Scatec ASA.
tgt_text: Mošomo wo gare ya kgatlampana go bušetša sekeng ditirelo tša motheo go swana le meetse, mohlagase, tlhwekišo le go thothwa ga ditlakala.

src_text: Broad-Based Black Economic Empowerment (B-BBEE) Advisory Council.
tgt_text: Tšhelete ya go lekana R189, 217 milione gare ya šomišwa Kaonafatšong ya Lenaneo la Madulo Mekhukhung leo le nepilego go kaonafatša khwalithi ya maphelo bao ba dulago mafelong mekhukhung..     Tšhelete ya tlaleletšo ya go lekana R733, 086 milione abetšwe ka Thušo ya Tšhelete ya Tlhabollo ya Madulo Batho go thuša go direla batho madulo go swarelela nako ye telele le mohlakanelwa..     Kabinete amogetše thekgo ya moya wa botho go tšwa Mmušong wa Qatar ka sebopego sa dijo tša ka dikotikoting, diaparo, ditšenereitha, dihlwekišameetse, dihemiši, ditente le kabo ya didirišwa tša bongaka.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the appointment by President Cyril Ramaphosa of the country’s new B-BBEE Advisory Council.
tgt_text: Neelano ye tla hola badudi ba go feta 4 000 bao ba filwego madulo lebakanyana disenthareng tša tlhokomelo ya setšhaba.

src_text: The council comprises diverse group of people from business, trade unions, community-based organisations and academia, who will be responsible for guiding government on the transformation of the economy.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše gape thekgo ya moya wa botho go tšwa United Arab Emirates (UAE) ka sebogego sa dijo tša ka dikotikoting le meetse go thuša batšwasehlabelo ba mafula moragorago.

src_text: While there has been remarkable progress in reversing apartheid’s distortions on the economy, more work still needs to be done in increasing black management control, upscaling skills development and broadening procurement to give opportunities to black women and the youth.
tgt_text: Go Tsebagatšwa ga Sekhwama sa Tlhabollo ya Leago.

src_text: Floods.
tgt_text: 1    Kabinete amogetše go tsebagatšwa ga Sekhwama sa Mešomo ya Leago ka Koporasi ya Tlhabollo ya Diintasteri (IDC) ka tšhomišano le Kantoro ya Mopresidente le dtic.

src_text: Ongoing government relief efforts in the provinces affected by the recent devastating floods are making significant impact.
tgt_text: Thekgo ye tla fana ka menyetla ya mathomomayo ya mešomo ya baswa ba go fihla 50 000 mo mešomong ye nago le mohola leagong yeo dirwago ke batho go tšwa mafelong mo ba dulago gona.. 2    Thekgo ye akaretša tlhokomelo ya maphelo le ya setšhaba, thekgo ya dijo le ya phepo go swana le mafelo go rekišetša batho ba go hloka madulo dijo, tlhohleletšo ya go bala le go ngwala, mananeo tlhago le phedišo ya phetogo ya klaemete gotee le masolo go thekga baswa.

src_text: Government has prioritised the provision of food, water and shelter for displaced people and the repair of damaged infrastructure.
tgt_text: Sekhwama se se tla thekga batho go tšwa ditšhabeng tše 26 eupša se sekhwama sa go dira poelo ya go swana le ye dirwago ke dikgwebo.

src_text: Extensive work is underway to restore basic services such as water, electricity, sanitation and waste removal.
tgt_text: Bosenyi le Bomenetša.

src_text: About R189, 217 million is being used for the Upgrading of the Informal Settlements Programme aimed at improving the quality of life of informal settlement dwellers.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše go golegwa ga batho ka tee ka tee ka bontši go amana le boradia, go timeletša tšhelete mohlala le bomenetša.

Magareng ga bona go akaretšwa bašomedi ba maloba ba mmušo ba maemo godimo le ba makalakgwebo mmušo, ba bangwe ba bona ba lebane le melato ya go amana le go gatakwa ga Molao wa Taolo ya Ditšhelete tša Mmušo, 1999 (Molao 1 wa 1999).

src_text: An additional R733, 086 million has been allocated through the Human Settlements Development Grant to assist in the creation of sustainable and integrated human settlements..
