tgt_text: Dikgolego tše - tša go akaretša go golegwa ga mohlankedi wa Kgoro ya Merero ya Selegae kua Senthareng ya Kamogelo ya Bafaladi ya Desmond Tutu gola Pretoria yo go gononwago gore amogetše pipamolomo go tšwa go motšwantle – bohlatse bja go laetša botse ntlha ya gore ga go na motho yo lego ka godimo ga letsogo la molao le gore bašomedi ba go hloka potego ga bana bodulo le gatee lefapheng la mmušo..     Kabinete amogetše gape kgatelopele ye fihleletšwego go buša barwarre ba Gupta lego Rajesh le Atul go tšwa mo ba lego go boela ka mo Afrika Borwa go tlo lebana le letsogo la molao.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the humanitarian aid from the State of Qatar in the form of foodstuff, clothing, generators, water purifiers, ventilators, tents and medical supplies.
tgt_text: Se se latela go golegwa ga bona malobanyana gola Dubai kua UAE morago ga gore Lebotho la Boditšhaba la Sephodisa sa Bosenyi (Interpol) le lokolle ditsebišo tša go golegwa ga bona.

src_text: The donation will benefit over 4 000 citizens temporarily housed in community care centres.
tgt_text: Barrwarre ba ba nyakega ka mo Afrika Borwa go amana le tema ye go gononwago gore ba kgathile ya go gogwa ga mmušo ka nko, go akaretšwa le boradia le go timeletša tšhelete mohlala.

src_text: Cabinet also welcomed the humanitarian aid from the United Arab Emirates (UAE) in the form of foodstuff and water to assist victims of the recent floods.
tgt_text: Ditherišano magareng ga mabotho phethagatšo ya molao kua UAE le ka mo Afrika Borwa ka go bušwa ga bona ka mo nageng di gare.

src_text: Launch of Social Development Fund.
tgt_text: Go golegwa ga bona go laetša maikemišetšo mmušo go lwantšha bosenyi le bomenetša ntle le poifo goba sepitša..     Go golegwa ga bona go tloga go laetša gore ditshepedišo le magato semolao šoma gabotse kudu go dira gore babonwamolato ba ikarabele ka magato bona boganka le go netefatša gore ga gona le motho tee yo lego ka godimo ga letsogo la molao..     Kabinete sotše maitekelo bohlaswa go nyatša ikonomi le naga ya gaborena morago ga tshenyo ya ka boomo ya kheibole kua Yuniti 1 ya Setiši sa Mohlagase sa Matla sa Eskom gola Mpumalanga.

src_text: 1  Cabinet welcomed the launch of the Social Employment Fund by the Industrial Development Corporation (IDC) in partnership with the Presidency and the dtic.
tgt_text: Ye ebile tiragalo ya bone ya kgonono ya tshenyo ye lakanwego setišing se sa mohlagase morago ga gore ditiragalo tša go swana le tše di begwe ditišing tše dingwe tše tharo tša mohlagase dibekeng tše mmalwa tša go feta.

src_text: The support will provide bridging employment opportunities for up to 50 000 young persons in socially-useful work being done in local communities.. 2  The support will include  health and community care, food and nutrition support like soup kitchens, promotion of literacy, greening and climate change mitigation programmes as well as  and youth support initiatives.
tgt_text: Dipalopalo tša moragorago tša bosenyi ke seipone sa gore re swanetše go dira tšohle bjalo ka setšhaba go dira gore mo re tšwago gona go bolokege.

src_text: The Fund will support 26 community and not-for-profit enterprises.
tgt_text: Seemo se sa makgonthe seo re lebaganego le sona se re gopotša gore go fediša bosenyi ke maikarabelo setšhaba le gore ka moka ga rena – go akaretšwa maphodisa, baetapele ba dipolotiki, setšhaba, malapa, boradikgwebo, bašomi le mekgatlo ye lego setšhabeng – ka moka re swanela ke go kgatha tema ya rena go lwantšha bosenyi..     Kabinete nale tshepho ya gore ditšhelete tše dingwe tšeo di beilwego ka thoko ke Kantoro ya Tona ya Maphodisa go šomišwa mo ditišing tša maphodisa tša go ba le palo ya godimo ya go begwa ga melato ya dipolao, ya go kata le ya bosenyi bjo bongwe bja dikgaruru di tla thuša go fetola seemo seo le go hlola setšhaba sa go bolokega bathong ka moka.

src_text: Crime and corruption.
tgt_text: Tsebišo ya Seemo sa COVID-.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the arrest of several individuals in connection with fraud, money laundering and corruption.
tgt_text: Kabinete gopoditše motho mang le mang gore COVID-19 ga ya fela le gore kotsi ya diphetelo tše diswa tla nyologela godimo nakong ye ya sehla sa marega.

src_text: These include former high ranking state and parastatal employees, some of whom face charges relating to the contravention of the Public Finance Management Act, 1999 (Act 1 of 1999).
tgt_text: Re swanetše go tšwelapele go latela magato ka moka tlhokomelo gore re ipoloke le go šireletša bao re phelago le bona.

src_text: The arrests – which include that of Home Affairs official at the Desmond Tutu Refugee Reception Centre in Pretoria who allegedly accepted bribe from foreign national – bear testimony to the fact that no one is above the law and that there is no space for dishonest employees in the public sector..
tgt_text: Magato a akaretša go hlapa goba go sanithaesa matsogo kgafetšakgafetša, go apara dimaseke ge re le ka meagong, go šielana sekgala sa go bolokega, go bula mafastere gore go hlabele ke moya le go hlaba meento.

src_text: Cabinet also welcomed the progress being made on the extradition of the Gupta brothers, Rajesh and Atul, back to South Africa.
tgt_text: Samiti ya Kopano ya Afrika (AU).

src_text: This follows their recent arrest at Dubai in the UAE after the International Criminal Police Organisation (Interpol) had issued red notices.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše tsebagatšo, Dikano le maikgafo ao amogetšwego kua Samiting ya Go Se Tlwaelege ya AU ka Matšhošetši le Diphetho tša go thulana le Molaotheo ka mo Afrika yeo bego swaretšwe kua Malabo, Rephabliking ya Equatorial Guinea, ka Mokibelo, 28 Mopitlo..     Baetapele ba Afrika ba lekotše matšhošetši ao tšwelago pele, ba sekasekile magato bjale go rarolla seemo se le go ikgafa go matlafatša tšhireletšego ya mohlakanelwa ya mebušo ye lego maloko samiti ye yeo lebaganego le matšhošetši le dikgaruru tša boganka.

src_text: The brothers are wanted in South Africa in connection with their alleged role in state capture, including fraud and money laundering.
tgt_text: Bolwetši bja Mabora Dikgabo.

src_text: Discussions between law-enforcement agencies in the UAE and South Africa on their extradition are underway.
tgt_text: Kabinete netefaleditše MaAfrika Borwa gore mafapha rena tša maphelo dutše komana go bea seemo leihlo le go thibela bolwetši bja Mabora Dikgabo, morago ga gore bolwetši bjo bo phulege dinageng tše mmalwa tšeo ka setlwaedi bolwetši bjo bo sego gona.

src_text: Their arrest demonstrates government’s determination to fight crime and corruption without fear or favour..
tgt_text: Le ge le gore ga gona diphetelo tšeo di begilwego go fihla gabjale goba tšeo di humanwego ka mo Afrika Borwa, makgotlataolo tša maphelo ka mo nageng tšwela pele go bea seemo leihlo ka hloafalo     Diphetho tša Kabinete.

src_text: These arrests demonstrate that processes and mechanisms are working effectively to hold perpetrators accountable for their heinous actions and ensure that no one is above the law..
tgt_text: Ditherišano tša Setšhaba ka Magato go Swaragana le Bogwebi bjo bo Sego Molaong bja Dikgerekgere tša Tšhipi.

src_text: Cabinet condemned the blatant attempt to undermine our economy and country following the malicious damage to cable at Unit 1 of Eskom's Matla Power Station in Mpumalanga.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše gore ditherišano tša setšhaba di swarwe ka ditšhišinyo tša go fediša go rekišwa ga dikgerekgere tša tšhipi tšeo di humanwego ka tsela ye sego molaong le ditšhipi tšeo di tološitšwego.

src_text: This was the fourth incident of suspected sabotage at power station after similar incidents were reported at three other power stations in the past few weeks.
tgt_text: Bohodu bja dikgerekgere tša tšhipi le dikheibole tša koporo mo mananeokgoparareng mmušo bo šitiša go šoma gabotse ga ikonomi bjalo ka ge bo hlola gore dilo tše di rekišwago disenyegelo tša gona di ye godimo go feta tekano.

src_text: The recent crime statistics are reflection that we must do more as society to make our communities safer.
tgt_text: Tše dingwe tša ditšhitišo tše di akaretša kabo ya mohlagase le ditirelo tša ditimela ka baka la diporo tša ditimela tšeo di sentšwego.

src_text: This reality reminds us that reducing crime is societal responsibility and that all of us – including the police, political leaders, communities, families, business people, workers and civil society – should play our part in fighting crime..
tgt_text: Di hlola disenyegelo tša tlaleletšo tša dinamelwa banameding ka baka la dinamelwa tšeo di šwalalantšwego tša banamedi.

src_text: Cabinet is confident that the additional funds that have been prioritised by the Ministry of Police for the police stations with high number of murders, rapes and other violent crime will help turn the tide and create safer communities for all.
tgt_text: Dikheibole tšeo di sentšwego le tša go lokaloka tša mohlagase di hlola kotsi ya polokego setšhabeng, kudukudu baneng..     Kabinete file tlhahlo ya gore dtic swanetše go etapele ditherišano mo nakong ye šetšego ye kopana, le go humana digopolo go tšwa setšhabeng le go tšwa mafapheng maleba ka magato mohola ao ka phethagatšwago ke mmušo go fediša go senywa ga mananeokgoparara bohlokwa ikonomi.

src_text: Update on COVID-.
tgt_text: Morago ga tshepedišo ye, Kabinete tla bolela ka magato ao dumeletšwego     Ditiragalo tšeo di Tlago.

src_text: Cabinet reminded everyone that COVID-19 has not been eradicated and the risks of new infections will increase during the winter season.
tgt_text: Simposiamo ya Boditšhabatšhaba ya Tšhomišanommogo ya Theknolotši go Reniša Khutšo (PTPS) ya Ditšhabakopano (UN).

src_text: We must continue to take all the necessary precautions to safeguard ourselves and other people.
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa tla swara PTPS ya Boselela kua Khanseleng ya Dinyakišišo tša Mahlale le tša Intasteri gola Pretoria go thoma ka Labobedi, 21 go fihla ka Labohlano, 24 Phupu.

src_text: They include washing or sanitising hands regularly, wearing mask when indoors, keeping safe social distance, opening windows for ventilation and vaccinating.
tgt_text: Go letetšwe gore go tle baemedi ba 300 go tšwa mebušong ya dinaga tše 50 tšeo di lego maloko yona.

src_text: African Union (AU) Summit.
tgt_text: Simposiamo ye kopantšha mmogo mašole ao nago le kgahlego, maphodisa le badudi go tšwa dinageng tšeo Mebušo ya tšona lego maloko UN go šomišana mmogo tirišong ya theknolotši ya sebjalebjale le ye gatetšego pele gotee le mareo ao šomišwago mererong ya sešole ye eteletšwego pele ke UN.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the declaration, pledges and commitments adopted at the AU’s Extraordinary Summit on Terrorism and Unconstitutional Changes in Africa held in Malabo, Republic of Equatorial Guinea, on Saturday, 28 May..   African leaders assessed the persistent threats, evaluated current response mechanisms and committed to strengthening the collective security of member states facing terrorism and violent extremism.
tgt_text: Simposiamo ye tla šomišwa bjalo ka sefala sa go abelana tshedimošo le sa go logišana maano mebušong ye lego maloko UN ebile amega masolong go reniša khutšo ka theknolotši ya moragorago mererong ya sešole ya go reniša moya wa khutšo..     Phenkgišano ya Bosetšhaba ya go Swarwa ka Morago ga Mengwaga ye Mebedi ya Wekšopo ya Bone ya Mabokgoni Afrika Borwa Maemo Bolefase (WSZA).

src_text: Monkeypox disease.
tgt_text: Phenkgišano ya Bosetšhaba ya go Swarwa ka Morago ga Mengwaga ye Mebedi ya WSZA swarelwa Sentharengkgoparara ya Boditšhabatšhaba ya Inkosi Albert Luthuli gola KwaZulu-Natal go thoma ka la 7 go fihla ka la 10 Phupu 2022 ka fase ga morero wo: “Ga go Boelwe Morago ka go Hlatloša Tšweletšo ya Bašomi ba Diatla ba Mengwagalekgolo ya bo21”..     Tiragalo ye šomišwa go hlohleletša mabokgoni go šoma ka diatla bjalo ka mošomo wa makgonthe wo motho ka ikgethelago ona bophelong gotee le go bulela dikgwebišano tšeo di tshephišago le intasteri ye.

src_text: Cabinet assured South Africans that our health authorities are on high alert to monitor and prevent Monkeypox disease, following its outbreak in several non-endemic countries.
tgt_text: Tiragalo ye šomišwa gape go lekola maemo rena boithutelamošomo le tlhabollo ya go šoma ka diatla godimo ga tlhohleletšo ya go šušumetša go tšewa ga mešomo ya bophelo ka moka ya go šoma ka diatla bjalo ka mešomo yeo ka bago kgetho ya mathomo baithuting ba rena     Melaetša.

src_text: Although no positive case has so far been detected or reported in South Africa, health authorities in the country continue to monitor the situation very closely   Cabinet Decision.
tgt_text: Mahloko Kabinete bile le Mopresidente Ramaphosa go lebiša mahloko Lapeng la Bogoši le setšhabeng sa Pušo ya amaMpondo morago ga go hlokofala ga Mohlomphegikgolo Kgoši Zanozuko Tyelovuyo Sigcau     Bao ba Thwetšwego MešomongBatho ka moka bao ba thwetšwego mešomong mangwalo bona thuto tlo tiišeletšwa le go netefatšwa ka tsela ye maleba.

src_text: Public consultation on measures to deal with illegal trading on scrap metal.
tgt_text: Morena Jacob Ganny Mbele bjalo ka Molaodipharephare (DG) Kgorong ya Methopo ya Diminirale le Enetši..     Mme Pumeza Nwabisa Nodada bjalo ka Motlatšamolaodipharephare: Taolo ya Kagodithokgwa Kgorong ya Kagodithokgwa, Boreatlhapi le Tikologo.

src_text: Cabinet approved that public consultations be undertaken on proposals to restrict the trade of illegally obtained scrap and processed metals.
tgt_text: Mme Susan Mafanedza Masapu bjalo ka Moeletšimogolwane wa Melao ya Mmušo wa Kgoro ya Toka le Tlhabollo ya Molaotheo..     Mme Doris Tshepe bjalo ka Mokomišinare wa Khomišene ya Diphenkgišano.

src_text: The theft of scrap metal and copper cable from public infrastructure hinders the performance of the economy by imposing enormous costs.
tgt_text: Ngaka Alex Mahapa bjalo ka Moeletši wa Moswananoši wa Goyagoile go Tona ya Motšwaoswere ya Ditirelo tša Mmušo le Tsamaišo.

src_text: Some of the disruptions include the supply of energy and rail services due to vandalised rail tracks.
tgt_text: Moadbokheiti Rams Ramashia bjalo ka Moeletši wa Moswananoši wa Lebakanyana go Tona ya Motšwaoswere ya Ditirelo tša Mmušo le Tsamaišo.

src_text: ISSUES IN THE ENVIRONMENT.
tgt_text: Phetogo ya Klaemete.

src_text: Climate Change.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše ketelo ya go tla ka mo Afrika Borwa ka Morena Alok Sharma, Mopresidente wa Samiti ya bo-26 ya Phetogo ya Klaemete ya Ditšhabakopano (UN), go thoma ka la 19 go fihla ka la 21 Phupu 2022, gotee le phetleko ya gagwe ya gore Afrika Borwa laeditše boikgafo bja mošito godimo ga diphetogo tša go diriša mohlagase wa go hlweka..     Ka 2021, Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa bile le baetapele ba bangwe ba dinaga go tsebagatša tšhomišanommogo ye bohlokwa le mebušo ya Fora, Germany, United Kingdom le Amerika gotee le Kopano ya Yuropa, go thekga diphetogo tša go se tšee lehlakore tša ikonomi ya khabone ya maemo fase le setšhaba sa go tielela kgahlanong le diphetogo tša klaemete..     Afrika Borwa be šoma ga boima go itokišetša sefala sa diphetogo tša rena goya mohlagaseng wa go hlweka le go thoma go šomiša methopo ya mohlagase wa go hlweka go swana le haedrotšene ya tlhago, dilahlwa, mohlagase wa go fehlwa ka moya, mohlagase wa seetša sa letšatši le mohlagase wa go fehlwa ka meetse, magareng ga mehuta ye mengwe ya go mpshafatšega.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the visit to South Africa by Mr Alok Sharma, President of the 26th United Nations (UN) Climate Change Summit, from 19 to 21 June 2022, and his assessment that South Africa has shown clear commitment to clean energy transition.
tgt_text: Mehutahuta ye tswakanego ya mohlagase hlola tekatekano magareng ga methopo ya mohlagase go netefatša mohlagase wa go botega wa go kgona go fihlelela dinyakwa tša mohlagase tša naga ye tšeo di golelago godimo.

src_text: In 2021, President Cyril Ramaphosa joined other leaders in announcing historic partnership with the governments of France, Germany, United Kingdom and United States, as well as the European Union, to support just transition to low carbon economy and climate resilient society.
tgt_text: Go Hlaba Meento ya Bolwetši bja Coronavirus (COVID-19).

src_text: South Africa has been hard at work in preparing the ground for our clean energy transition and move to clean energy sources such as green hydrogen, biomass, wind power, solar power and hydro-power, among other renewables.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše phuhlamo ye kgolo ya diphetelo tša COVID-19 tšeo di gatišitšwego ka mo Afrika Borwa mo dibekeng tše mmalwa tša go feta ebile hlohleleditše batho ka moka bao ba nago le maswanedi go tšwelapele go entela, ka ge seo se thuša go efoga malwetši šoro, go amogelwa maokelong le go bolawa ke COVID-.

src_text: This so-called energy mix allows for balance between energy sources to ensure reliable power to meet the country’s growing energy needs.
Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) vaccine uptake.
tgt_text: Palo ya go feta seripa ya batho ba bagolo ba MaAfrika Borwa go fihla gabjale ba amogeditšwe selekanyo sa moento wa COVID-19 se ka bago se tee.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the significant drop in COVID-19 infections recorded in South Africa over the past few weeks and encouraged all eligible people to  continue  to vaccinate, which helps to prevent serious illness, hospitalisation and death.
tgt_text: Mmušo ikemišeditše go diriša dikadimo tša tswala ya fase tšeo di sa tšogo dumelelwa ke Panka ya Lefase go reka dilekanyo tša tlaleletšo tša moento wa COVID-19 le go netefatša gore setšhaba se šireletšegile ka fao go lekanego kgahlanong le diphetelo tše dingwe tše ka bago gona.

src_text: Half of all adult South Africans have to date received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose.
tgt_text: Kabinete lebeletše gape merero ya go amana le dikgatelopele tša go laola leuba la COVID-19, kudukudu ka kgatelopele ye fihleletšwego ya go boela sekeng ka botlalo ga ditiragalo tša setlwaedi tša ikonomi maphelong rena.

src_text: Government aims to use the low-interest loan recently approved by the World Bank to purchase additional COVID-19 vaccine doses and ensure that the nation is adequately protected against potential infections.
tgt_text: Tona ya Maphelo, Ngaka Joe Phaahla tla fa tshedimošo ka moka ka botlalo.

src_text: Cabinet also considered matters related to developments on the management of the COVID-19 pandemic, particularly with the progress being made towards full return to normal socio-economic activities.
tgt_text: Letšatši la Bosetšhaba la Baswa.

src_text: The Minister of Health, Dr Joe Phaahla, will provide further details.
tgt_text: Kabinete lebogile MaAfrika Borwa ka moka ge ba tsenetše meketeko ya naga ye ya Letšatši la Bosetšhaba la Baswa ka Labone, 16 Phupu 2022 ka fase ga morero wo: “Go hlohleletša mekgwa ya go iphediša ya go tšea nako ye telele le tielelo ya baswa go fihlelela bokamoso bjo bo kaonafatšego.” Moya wa lethabo le go se boele morago wo laeditšwego ke baswa go ralala setšhaba ka moka ke lona lebakabaka la meketeko le tshepho ya bokamoso bjo bo kaonafetšego.

src_text: National Youth Day  .
tgt_text: Ge Kgwedi ya Bosetšhaba ya Baswa ya mafelelong re ntšheng ka ga tšhwene mo maitekelong rena go netefatša gore baswa ba kgona go ikhweletša mananeo mantši go ba thekga ao tlago ka mmušo le go ba kgontšha go kgatha tema ka mafolofolo ikonoming..     Kgoro ya Ditirelo tša Setšhaba, bjalo ka mongmošomo wa go thwala batho ka bontši arabetše tlhotlo ye ka go kgontšha dialoga tša go se šome go hwetša maitemogelo ka Lenaneo la Dialoga la Boithutelamaitemogelo la Ditirelo tša Setšhaba le la Boithutelamošomo.

src_text: Cabinet thanked all South Africans for joining in the country’s National Youth Day commemorations on Thursday, 16 June 2022 under the theme: “Promoting sustainable livelihood and resilience of young people for better tomorrow.” The spirit of enthusiasm and resilience shown by the youth across our nation is indeed cause for celebration and hope for better tomorrow.
tgt_text: Mmušo phethagatša gape le Sekhwama sa Mešomo Setšhabeng (SEF) ebile tsošološitše masolo tlhomo ya mešomo Ditirelo tša Bosetšhaba tša Baswa (NYS) ao ka bobedi ga ona tlo batametšago baswa ba go lekana 50 000 ka gare ga ditiragalo tša ikonomi.

src_text: As National Youth Month draws to an end, let us intensify our efforts to ensure young people access the many support programmes provided by government and facilitate their active participation in the economy.
tgt_text: Masolo a ka se thuše fela ka go aba maitemogelo mošomo ao tsomegago kudu eupša tla thuša gape le ka go tsošološa mohola wa gore badudi ba kgathe tema ka mafolofolo.

src_text: The Public Service, as the largest employer, has responded to this challenge by enabling unemployed graduates to gain experience through the Public Service Graduate Internship and Learnership Programme.
tgt_text: SEF šomišana le mekgatlo ye sego ya mmušo (di-NGO) mola NYS ngwala fase maina baswa gore be bona ba khumanago mešomo mo ditirelong tša go hola batho setšhabeng go ralala naga ka bophara.

src_text: Government is also implementing the Social Employment Fund (SEF) and revitalised National Youth Service (NYS) job-creation initiatives that will each draw 50 000 young people into the economy.
These initiatives will not only provide much-needed work experience but will also reinforce the value of active citizenship.
tgt_text: Dinamelwa.

src_text: The SEF partners with non-governmental organisations (NGOs) while the NYS enlists young people for services which benefit communities across the country..     Transport .
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše Leano la Magato la Dintlha tše 11 go swaragana le go thibiwa ga ditsela le go goketšwa ga batšwantle bjalo ka baotleladilori.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the 11-point Action Plan to deal with road blockages and recruitment of foreign nationals as truck drivers.
tgt_text: Leano le, la go hlangwa ke Komiti ya Ditona tša ka Nageng (IMC) yeo Šoganago le Mešomo ya Legoro la Difatanaga tša go Rwala Merwalo le ya Ditsela ka moka le bakgathatema ba intasteri ya merwalo le ya ditsela, magareng ga tše dingwe, le go hlohleletša go phethagatšwa ga dinyakwa tša VISA le go obamela melao ya bašomi..     IMC hlametšwe go kalokana le palo ye nyologelago godimo ya go thibiwa ga ditsela le ya megwanto ka baotleladilori ba MaAfrika Borwa bao ba sa kgotsofalago.

src_text: The plan, which was developed by the Road and Freight Inter-Ministerial Committee (IMC) in partnership with the road and freight industry stakeholders, promotes amongst others the enforcement of visa requirements and compliance with labour laws.
tgt_text: Megwanto le go thibiwa ga ditsela ama gampe go sepela ga dinamelwa ka thelelo tšhoša babeeletši ba dinagadišele le gape go ama gampe dilo tše bohlokwahlokwa go swana le ikonomi le magatokamano kabo ya dilo tše bohlokwa tša go šomiša tšona ditsela tšeo di amegilego.

src_text: The IMC was formed to deal with escalating road blockages and protests by disgruntled South African truck drivers.
tgt_text: Tlhaelelo ya Meetse Mmasepaleng wa Metsesetoropo wa Boemakepe bja Nelson Mandela (NMB).

src_text: Protests and road blockages adversely impact mobility, scare foreign investors and most importantly, negatively impact the economy and essential supply chains which use affected corridors.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše magato go tla ka Kgoro ya Meetse le Tlhwekišo (DWS) Mmasepaleng wa Metsesetoropo wa NMB gola Kapa Bodikela go efoga Letšatši la go Hloka Lerothi la Meetse ka ge profense ye lebagane le tlhaelelo ye šoro ya meetse yeo thomilego ka.

src_text: Nelson Mandela Bay (NMB) Metropolitan Municipality water shortages.
tgt_text: DWS šoma le profense go phethagatša magato nakwana magareng le nako ye telele go šogašogana le go fediša ditlamorago tše ka bago gona tša komelelo.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the intervention of the Department of Water and Sanitation (DWS) in the NMB Metropolitan Municipality in the Eastern Cape to avert Day Zero as the province is facing severe water shortages which started in.
tgt_text: Kabinete hlohleleditše gape badudi ba NMB go latela ditaelo tšeo ba di filwego tša go fokoletšwa meetse tšeo ba di filwego ke mebasepala ya fao go netefatša gore meetse ga fele.

src_text: The DWS is working with the province to implement short, medium and long-term measures to address and mitigate the potential impact of the drought.
tgt_text: Ka kakaretšo, tšhomišo ya meetse swanetše go fokotšwa ka dilithara tše 50 milione ka letšatši, go tloga maemong gona bjale dilithara tše 280 milione ka letšatši go theošetšwa fase go dilithara tše 230 milione ka letšatši.

src_text: Cabinet further urged the residents of NMB to adhere to water restrictions imposed by local municipalities to ensure water security.
tgt_text: Bosenyi le bomenetša.

src_text: Overall, water use must be reduced by 50 million litres per day, from the current level of 280 million litres per day down to 230 million litres per day.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše go golegwa malobanyana mo ga mohlankedi wa Kgoro ya Merero ya Selegae wa go šomela kantorong ya Benoni mabapi le go gatiša pasporoto ya bofora go mofaladi wa go tšwa Bangladeshi.

src_text: Crime and corruption  .
tgt_text: Mohlankedi yo, Mme Sibongile Simelane filwe peile ya R5 000 kua Kgorotsheko ya Maseterata ya Benoni ka Labobedi, 21 Phupu.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the recent arrest of Home Affairs official stationed at the Benoni office for issuing fraudulent passport to Bangladeshi national.
tgt_text: Motšwantle yo wa Bangladeshi, Morena Fahim Kazi golegilwe le gare leka go tšwa ka mo nageng ka la 12 Mopitlo 2022 šomiša leina la gagwe la bofora la ‘Lebogang Ndlovu’.

src_text: The official, Ms Sibongile Simelane, was granted R5 000 bail in the Benoni Magistrate's Court on Tuesday, 21 June.
tgt_text: Kgoro ya Merero ya Selegae (DHA) malobanyana mo bušeditše morago mmapadi wa Lithuania, Mohumagatšana Leva Andrejevaite, yo bego leka go šomiša bošaedi melao ya Afrika Borwa ya taolo ya bafaladi ge ihlamela maaka matala gore be nyaka go dira kgopelo ya asaelamo ka baka la ntwa ye kgatlampanago gola Ukraine.

src_text: The Bangladeshi national, Mr Fahim Kazi, was arrested while trying to leave the country on 12 May 2022 under the name, ‘Lebogang Ndlovu’.
tgt_text: Kabinete lebogiša mošomo wo dirwago ke Yuniti ya go Lwantšha Bosenyi ya DHA opela diatla le go hlohleletša MaAfrika Borwa go tšwelapele go bega ditiragalo tša mohuta wo tša bosenyi.

src_text: The Department of Home Affairs (DHA) recently deported Lithuanian actress, Ms Ieva Andrejevaite, who sought to abuse South Africa’s refugee management regime when she fabricated story of wanting to apply for asylum because of the “war in Ukraine”.
tgt_text: Magato ao sego molaong MaAfrika Borwa ba go rekiša dipasa tša bona nale ditlamorago tše mpe kudu tša go fihla kgole godimo ga tšhireletšo ya naga ye le seemo sa ikonomi maphelong.

src_text: Cabinet commends the work being done by the DHA’s Counter Corruption Unit.
tgt_text: Mmušo tla tšwelapele go tšea magato go tiišetšwa letsogo kgahlanong le motho mang goba mang yo amegago ditiragalong tše sego molaong tša go nyatša melao ya rena ya bofaladi, ntle le poifo goba sepitša.

src_text: It applauds and encourages ordinary South Africans to continue to report such criminal acts.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše gape sephetho sa go phara molato le go ahlolelwa ga morutiši wa Durban Mohumagatšana Nomusa Precious Gabuza (37) – yo ahloletšwego kotlo ya mengwaga ye meraro ya go bewa leihlo ke ba tshokollo ya bagolegwa le go golegwa tekano ya mengwaga ye mene, yeo fegilwego ka botlalo lebaka la mengwaga ye meraro kua Kgorotsheko ya Selete ya Umlazi gola KwaZulu-Natal ka baka la go gataka Pušoselegae: Molao wa Dikgetho tša Mebasepala, 2000 (Molao 27 wa 2000).

src_text: The unlawful acts of South Africans who sell their identities have far-reaching negative implications for the country’s security and socio-economic status.
tgt_text: Bjalo ka morutiši sekolong seo se bego se šomišetšwa bjale ka setiši sa dikgetho nakong ya Dikgetho tša Mebasepala ka Diphalane 2021, Mohumagatšana Gabula ipone molato ka go lahlela ka dipaloto tša bofora tše 24 ka lepokisaneng la dikgetho, go akaretšwa tše 12 tša dipaloto tša Dikgetho tša Mebasepala le tše 12 tša dipaloto tša Dikgetho tša Wate.

src_text: Government will continue to deal harshly against anyone involved in illegal acts that undermine our immigration laws, without fear or favour.
tgt_text: Go pharwa molato ga gagwe le kahlolelo ye e filwego di tloga di laetša boikgafo bja Khomišene ya Dikgetho ya Afrika Borwa bja go tsena gare seemo seo ka bonako le go diriša magato taolo ya ditlamorago.

src_text: Cabinet  also welcomed the recent conviction and sentencing of Durban teacher, Ms Nomusa Precious Gabuza (37) – who was sentenced to three years' correctional supervision and four years' imprisonment, wholly suspended for three years, in the Umlazi Regional Court in KwaZulu-Natal – for contravening the Local Government Municipal Electoral Act, 2000 (Act 27 of 2000).
tgt_text: Ye ke kgonthišišo ya go tiišetšwa letsogo ya dipeakanyo tša dikgetho, yeo go tloga kgale bego matlafetše nakong ya ge go be go tsebagatšwa Metšhene ya Sebjalebjale ya go Ngwadiša Bakgethi ya go kgona go thibela bakgethi go bouta gabedi.

src_text: As teacher at the school which was used as voting station during the Municipal Elections in October 2021, Ms Gabuza pleaded guilty for fraudulently casting 24 votes, including 12 for the Municipal Elections and 12 for the Ward Elections.
tgt_text: Kabinete netefaditše gore dikgetho ke motheo wa temokrasi ya gaborena le gore di swanetše go šireletšwa ka fao go ka kgonagalago..     Khonferense ya Ditona ya bo-12 (MC12) ya Setheo sa Dikgwebišano Magareng ga Dinaga tša Lefase (WTO).

src_text: The conviction and sentencing underscore the Electoral Commission of South Africa’s commitment to intervene timeously and apply consequence management.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše dipoelo tša WTO MC12 ye bego swaretšwe kua Geneva, Switzerland go thoma ka la 12 go fihla ka la 17 Phupu 2022, kudukudu sephetho sa gore dinaga tše nago le maloka di ka kgona go fekeetša dilaesense tša maswanedi tšhireletšosemolao ya nako ye rileng ya meento ya COVID-19 go fihla ka ngwaga wa.

src_text: This is also strong affirmation of the electoral systems, which have since been strengthened with the introduction of the Voter Management Device that prevents double voting.
tgt_text: Sephetho sa ge eba go swanetše go oketšwa mekgwa ya go alafa le go phekola COVID-19 se diegišitšwe ka dikgwedi tše tshela.

src_text: Cabinet affirmed that elections are the cornerstone of our democracy and must be protected at all costs..     World Trade Organisation (WTO) 12th Ministerial Conference (MC12).
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa be eteletše pele boipiletšo bja WTO bja go beelathoko maloka botlhami le boikgopolelo ao tlemaganego le meento ya COVID-19 ao tlo netefatšago gore go ba le khumanego ya go lekalekana ya meento le go kgontšha dinaga tša go ba le mabokgoni go itirela meento go dira bjalo.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the outcomes of the WTO MC12 held in Geneva, Switzerland from 12 to 17 June 2022, in particular the decision that eligible countries could override COVID-19 vaccine patents until.
tgt_text: Khonferense ye ikgafetše gape go latela tshepedišo ya go se ute selo le ya go akaretša bohle ya go hlama leswa mediro le mehola ya yona ka moka le go dumelelana go tsenela sekgoboko sa dikwanelo tša dikgwebišano tša go swaragana le magoro go etša maphelo, go thea magomo go diphokoletšo tša boreahlapi, kiletšo ya dikgwebišano ka mokgwa wa elektroniki gotee le tšhireletšego ya dijo     Diphetho tša Kabinete.

src_text: The decision on whether to extend this to COVID-19 therapeutics and diagnostics was delayed for six months.
tgt_text: Kgatelopele Lenaneong la go Fetogela Kgašong ya Titšithale (BDM).

src_text: South Africa had been leading the call for the WTO to waiver intellectual property rights tied to COVID-19 vaccines that will ensure equal access to vaccines and enable countries that have the capability to manufacture vaccines to do so.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše tshedimošetšo ka Lenaneo la BDM le go lemoga kgatelopele ye dirilwego ka go lokelwa ga mapokisana dithelebišene bjalo ka karolo ya go fulara kgašo ya dieriele go fetogela kgašong ya titšithale.

src_text: The conference also committed to an open and inclusive process to reform all its functions and agreed to package of trade deals addressing areas such as health, setting limits on fishing subsidies moratorium on e-commerce trade and food security     CABINET DECISIONS.
tgt_text: Kabinete gateletše gapegape nyakego ya ka pelapela ya go ruma BDM go kgona go bulela tsela maphoto ao nyakegago dikgokagano tša gohle tša motlalanaga, gotee le tshedimošo ye nngwe le theknolotši ya dikgokagano ya go amana le morero wo..     Tona ya Dikgokagano le Theknolotši ya Titšithale Khumbudzo Ntshavheni tla swara kopano ya tshedimošetšo ya babegaditaba gosasa (Labohlano, 24 Phupu) go fana ka tshedimošo ka botlalo.

src_text: Progress on Broadcasting Digital Migration (BDM) Programme.
tgt_text: Pego ya Ngwaga ka Ngwaga ka Seemo sa Bosetšhaba sa Ditokelo tša Bana.

src_text: Cabinet received an update on the BDM Programme and noted the progress made with the installation of set-top boxes as part of migrating from analogue to digital broadcasting.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go phatlalatšwa ga Pego ya Bobedi ya Ngwaga ka Ngwaga ya Bosetšhaba ya Ditokelo tša Bana.

src_text: Cabinet re-emphasised the urgency for concluding the BDM to free up the spectrum needed for mobile broadband, and other information and communications technology related purposes.
tgt_text: Pego ye tsebiša ka seemo sa ditaba ka phethagatšo ya Leano la Magato Bosetšhaba la bana go lebeletšwe nako ya magareng ga 2019-. .

src_text: Communications and Digital Technologies Minister Khumbudzo Ntshavheni will hold media briefing tomorrow (Friday, 24 June) to provide more details.
tgt_text: Pego ye laetša diphenyo tšeo di gatišitšwego mengwageng ya magareng ga 2020- laetša gape le magoro ao santše lego tlhotlo, go akaretšwa le polokego ya bana le dithulano tšeo di tšwetšego pele magareng ga bahloki le bahumi go lebeletšwe bana.

src_text: Annual National Child Rights Status Report.
tgt_text: Pego ye laetša ka fao leuba la COVID-19 le amilego bana ka yona mengwaga ye boletšwego..     Magato go namola seemo ao phethagatšwago ke mmušo nepile go lemoša batho ka moka ka ditokelo tša bana, go ya le ka fao go hlalošitšwego ka gare ga Molaotheo wa Rephabliki ya Afrika Borwa wa.

src_text: Cabinet approved the second Annual National Child Rights Status Report to be published.
tgt_text: Magato a thekga gape le ditlamego tša naga ye godimo ga Dikwano tša UN ka Ditokelo tša Bana (UNCRC) le Tumelelano ya Afrika ka Ditokelo le Boiketlo bja Bana (ACRWC).

src_text: The report provides an update on the implementation of the National Plan of Action for the Children for the 2019-2024 period..
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa ke ye nngwe ya naga ya go saenela kwano go bobedi UNCRC le ACRWC..     Pego ye hlamilwe ka go rerišana pele le dikgoro tša mmušo le palo ye bonagalago ya bakgathatema ba maleba maemong bosetšhaba le profense.

src_text: The report highlights the achievements recorded for the 2020-2021 period.
tgt_text: Pego ye feletšego ka botlalo tla phatlalatšwa websaeteng ya Kgoro ya Tlhabollo ya Leago mo go: www.dsd.gov.za.

src_text: It also highlights areas that remain challenge, including the safety of children and the continued disparities between the poor and the rich in respect of children.
tgt_text: Pego ye Kopantšwego ya Kgafetšakgafetša ya Afrika Borwa ya lekga la boraro go fihla go la boselela yeo hlagišeditšwego UNCRC.

src_text: The report also reflects on how the COVID-19 pandemic impacted on children during this period.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go hlagišetšwa UNCRC Pego ya Kgafetšakgafetša ya boraro go fihla go ya boselela.

src_text: The intervention measures being implemented by government are aimed at realising the rights of children, as outlined in the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of.
tgt_text: Pego ye latela Pego ya bobedi ya Kgafetšakgafetša yeo hlagišeditšwego UNCRC ka..     Pego ye hlamilwe ka go tsamaišana le Kgatišo 44 ya UNCRC, ebile akaretša mebono le ditšhišinyo tšeo di dirilwego go tšwa pegong ya mafelelo.

src_text: They also support the country’s obligations to the UN Conventions on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC) and the African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child (ACRWC).
tgt_text: UNCRC rometše mebono le ditšhišinyo tša yona tša naga ye ka..     Go hlangwa ga pego ye go dirilwe ka go rerišana pele le dikgoro ka moka tšeo di amegago le bakgathatema ka moka go ralala le naga.

src_text: South Africa is signatory to both the UNCRC and ACRWC.
tgt_text: Pego ye feletšego ka botlalo tla dirwa phatlalatša ge šetše hlagišeditšwe UNCRC.

src_text: The report was compiled in consultation with government departments and number of relevant stakeholders at national and provincial levels.
tgt_text: Pego ya Bosetšhaba phethagatšong ya Lenaneothero le Leswa la Metsesetoropo.

src_text: The full report will be posted on the Department of Social Development website: www.dsd.gov.za.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go hlagišwa ga pego ya bosetšhaba ya mathomo ya Afrika Borwa ka phethagatšo ya Lenaneothero le Leswa la Metsesetoropo go Lenaneo la UN la Madulo Batho (UN-Habitat).

src_text: South Africa’s Combined third to sixth Periodic Report to the UNCRC.
tgt_text: UN-Habitat amogetše Lenaneothero la yona le Leswa la Metsesetoropo kua Khonfereseng ya yona ka Dintlo le Tlhabollo ye Swarelelago ya Metsesetoropo ka Diphalane.

src_text: Cabinet approved the tabling of the third to the sixth Periodic Report to the UNCRC.
tgt_text: Mebušo ye lego maloko lenaneo le go be bo letetšwe gore romele dipego ka boithaopo tša gore mošomo tlela kae.

src_text: This report follows the second Periodic Report that was tabled to the UNCRC in..
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa thekgile go amogelwa ga Lenaneothero le Leswa la Metsesetoropo le go le phethagatša ka morago ga gore le amogelwe ka go šomiša Tlhako ya naga ye ya Mohlakanelwa ya Tlhabollo ya Metsesetoropo (IUDF).

src_text: The report has been compiled in accordance with Article 44 of the UNCRC, and also covers the observations and recommendations made from the last report.
tgt_text: Nepo ya IUDF ke go hlahla go hlabollwa ga madulo metsesetoropo go akaretša batho ka moka go tielela le go phelega..     Pego ye ya kgatelopele ya mošomo hlamilwe ka go rerišana pele le didiko tša mmušo tša bosetšhaba, tša profense le tša selegae gotee le di-NGO tše maleba.

src_text: The UNCRC sent its observations and recommendations for the country in..
tgt_text: Leanopeakanyo la Mohlakanelwa la Tlhabollo ya Baswa (IYDS).

src_text: The compilation was done in consultation with all relevant departments and stakeholders across the country.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go phethagatšwa ga IYDS.

src_text: The full report will be made public once it has been tabled to the UNCRC.
tgt_text: Leanopeakanyo le le kgontšha Pholisi ya Bosetšhaba ya Baswa ya 2020 go fihla ka.

src_text: National report on implementing the New Urban Agenda.
tgt_text: Yona hlatholla magato, diprotšeke le mananeo ao tlo dirwago ke bakgathatema ba go fapafapana go tšwa dihlophaneng tša baswa swaragana gape le ka go fokotša go ipušeletša gantši ga magato mmušo le go fa tlhahlo ya ka fao mekgatlo ye lego setšhabeng le lefapha la praebete ka thekgago baswa gore ba ka ikhweletša bjang menyetla ya mešomo.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission of South Africa’s first national report on the Implementation of the New Urban Agenda to the UN Human Settlements Programme (UN-Habitat).
tgt_text: Ge go be go hlangwa leanopeakanyo le, mafapha go fapafapana setšhaba amegile go lona go fa dikgopolo le go ntšha sa bona sa mafahleng.

src_text: The UN-Habitat adopted its New Urban Agenda at its Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development in October.
tgt_text: Sengwalwa sa Makgoraditsela ka Pabalelo le Tšhomišano ye Swarelelago ya Diphedi tša go Fapafapana tša Afrika Borwa.

src_text: Member states were expected to submit progress reports voluntarily.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše seakanywa sa Mokgoraditsela ka Pabalelo le Tšhomišo ye Swarelelago ya Diphedi tša go Fapafapana tša Afrika Borwa gore setšhaba se fe ditshwayotshwayo tša sona.

src_text: South Africa supported the adoption of the New Urban Agenda and subsequently implemented it through the country’s Integrated Urban Development Framework (IUDF).
tgt_text: Diphedi tša go fapafapana tša Afrika Borwa di fana ka motheo wo bohlokwa wa go kgontšha kgolo ya ikonomi le tlhabollo, ebile wona motheo wo tloga le bohlokwa kudu go lebeletšwe mekgwa yeo batho ba iphedišago ka yona..     Sengwalwa se sa makgoraditsela ke sona se kgontšhago ditšhišinyo tšeo di dirilwego ke Sehlopha sa Maemo Godimodimo sa Ditsebi tšeo di thwetšwego ka 2019 go fetleka dipholisi tša rena tša bjale, melao le ditlwaedi ka merero ya go amana kudu le diphedi tše tša mohuta wa moswananoši..     Pego ye šišintše gore go hlangwe pholisi ye akaretšago tšohle ka pabalelo le tšhomišo ye swareleago ya diphedi tša go fapafapana tša naga ye.

src_text: The IUDF aims to guide the development of inclusive, resilient and liveable urban settlements.
tgt_text: Pholisi ye tla phethagatšwa go ralala didiko ka moka tša mmušo.

src_text: The progress report was compiled in consultation with national, provincial and local spheres of government, and relevant NGOs.
tgt_text: Pabalelo tloga le bohlokwa lesolong la naga ye la go akgofiša kgolo ya ikonomi le tlhomo ya mešomo.

src_text: Integrated Youth Development Strategy (IYDS).
tgt_text: Leanopeakanyo la Nama ya Diphoofolo tša Lešoka.

src_text: Cabinet approved the IYDS for implementation.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go phatlalatšwa ga seakanywa sa Leanopeakanyo la Nama ya Diphoofolo tša Lešoka gore setšhaba se fe ditshwayotshwayo tša sona.

src_text: The strategy gives effect to the National Youth Policy 2020-.
tgt_text: Leanopeakanyo le le šeditše go botsefatša le go fetoša gabotse intasteri ya nama ya diphoofolo tša lešoka.

src_text: It outlines the actions, projects and programmes to be undertaken by various stakeholders from youth formations.
tgt_text: Le šetšane gape le go kgatha tema tšhireletšegong ya dijo ka mokgwa wo swarelelago.

src_text: It also deals with minimising the duplication of government interventions and guides how civil society and the private sector can support young people from accessing opportunities.
tgt_text: Intasteri ya nama ya diphoofolo tša lešoka ka boati ke intasteri ya go se lefišwe metšhelo ya go šoma thokwana le noši.

src_text: The compilation of the strategy involved diverse inputs from various sectors of society.
tgt_text: Leanopeakanyo le le šišintšwego le fana ka leano la phethagatšo leo le tla botsefatšago le go matlafatša intasteri ye bjalo ka bobedi moabi wa tšhireletšego ya dijo le lefapha la kgolo ya ikonomi leo le tla thušago go hloma menyetla ya mešomo     Melaokakanywa.

src_text: Draft White Paper on Conservation and Sustainable Use of South Africa’s Biodiversity.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywaphetošwa ka Kakaretšo wa 2022 wa Merero ya Setšo.

src_text: Cabinet approved the draft White Paper on Conservation and Sustainable Use of South Africa’s Biodiversity for public comments.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go hlagišwa Palamenteng ga Molaokakanywaphetošwa wa 2022 wa Merero ya Setšo gore Palamente go sekaseke goya pele.

src_text: South Africa's biodiversity provides an important basis for economic growth and development, and is critical to people’s livelihoods..
tgt_text: Diphetošo tše di šetšane le go fetleka Molao wa Setšo le wa Boetapele bja maKhoi-San, 2019 (Molao 3 wa 2019), wo tsentšwego tirišong ka la 1 Moranang.

src_text: This White Paper gives effect to the recommendations made by the High-Level Panel of Experts appointed in 2019 to review our current policies, legislation and practices on matters relating to iconic species.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywaphethošwa wa 2022 wa Tšhireletšo ya Temokrasi ya Molaotheo Kgahlanong le Ditiragalo tša Matšhošetši le tše dingwe tša go amana le tšona.

src_text: The report recommended the development of an overarching policy on conservation and sustainable use of the country’s biodiversity.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go hlagišwa Palamenteng ga Molaokakanywaphetošwa wa 2022 ka Tšhireletšo ya Temokrasi ya Molaotheo Kgahlanong le Matšhošetši le tše dingwe tša go amana le ona gore Palamente go sekaseke goyapele.

src_text: The policy will be implemented across all spheres of government.
tgt_text: Ge šetše amogetšwe, Molaokakanywa wo tla fetoša Molao wa bjale wa Tšhireletšo ya Temokrasi ya Molaotheo Kgahlanong le Matšhošetši le Ditiragalo tša go Amana le ona, 2004 (Molao 33 wa 2004).

src_text: Conservation is important for the country’s drive to accelerate economic growth and job creation.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywa wo fetile pele ditherišanong tšeo di tseneletšego tša setšhaba morago ga gore dumelelwe ke Kabinete ka Mopitlo.

src_text: Game Meat Strategy.
tgt_text: Diphetošo tše di šetšane le go bea madulong didirišwa tšeo di tšweleditšwego ka nageng ye tša go lwantšha matšhošetši gotee le magato lefaseng ka bophara ao hlomilwego.

src_text: Cabinet approved the publication of the draft Game Meat Strategy for public comments.
tgt_text: Diphetošo tše di šogašogane gape le ditemana tšeo go tšeerwego sephetho ke Kgorotsheko ya Molaotheo sa gore ga di gate ka mošito tee le Molaotheo.

src_text: The strategy seeks to formalise and transform the game meat industry.
tgt_text: Bjalo ka ye nngwe ya naga ye lego leloko la Khansele ya UN ya Tšhireletšego, Afrika Borwa tlamegile goya ka mohola wa yona go batametša kgauswi melao ya boditšhabatšhaba yeo šetšanego le go maatlafatša magato le go lwantšha matšhošetši lefaseng ka bophara     Ditiragalo tše di Tlago.

src_text: It also seeks to contribute towards food security in sustainable manner.
tgt_text: Samiti ya bo-14 ya Brazil, Russia, India, China le Afrika Borwa (BRICS).

src_text: The game meat industry is predominately an informal industry that operates in fragmented manner.
tgt_text: Mopresidente Ramaphosa tla eta pele go kgatha tema ga Afrika Borwa Samiting ya bo-14 ya go swarwa ka dikgokagano tša bidio ya Baetapele ba BRICS yeo swerwego ke Rephabliki ya Bohle ya China go thoma ka Labone, 23 go fihla ka Labohlano, 24 Phupu.

src_text: The proposed strategy provides an implementation plan that will formalise and strengthen the sector as both provider of food security and an economic growth sector that can help create job opportunities     BILLS.
Traditional Affairs General Amendment Bill of.
tgt_text: Maloko rena BRICS ba tšwelapele go hola naga ye.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the Traditional Affairs General Amendment Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processing.
tgt_text: Ngwageng wa go feta, diromelwantle tša go feta 17% tša Afrika Borwa di be di nepišitšwe dinageng tše dingwe tša BRICS, le gona palomoka ya go feta 29% ya ditšwantle tša rena di be di tšwa go tšona dinaga tše.

src_text: The amendments seek to revise the Traditional and Khoi-San Leadership Act, 2019 (Act 3 of 2019), which came into effect on 1 April.
tgt_text: Boleng bja theko ya kgwebišano ye bo tšwelapele go golela godimo, ka palomoka ya dikgwebišano tša Afrika Borwa le dinaga tše dingwe tša BRICS batamela R702 bilione ka 2021, morago ga gore golele godimo go tloga go R487 bilione ka.

src_text: Protection of Constitutional Democracy Against Terrorist and Related Activities Amendment Bill of.
Cabinet approved the submission of the Protection of Constitutional Democracy Against Terrorist and Related Activities Amendment Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processing.
tgt_text: Tšhomišanommogo gare ga dinaga tše lego maloko BRICS magorong go fapafapana go swana le maphelo le dikgwebišanong tše kaonafetšego godišitše intasteri ya ka mo nageng, le go hola dinaga ka moka tše lego maloko BRICS.

src_text: Once adopted, the Bill will amend the current Protection of Constitutional Democracy Against Terrorist and Related Activities Act, 2004 (Act 33 of 2004).
tgt_text: Dipeeletšo tša rena diprotšekeng tša tlhabollo ya mananeokgoparara le matsapa go fokotša go raragana ga magatotshepedišo mmušo ge go dirwa kgwebo di nepile go oketša diromelwantle go bagwebišani ba rena ba BRICS.

src_text: The Bill went through an extensive public consultation process after it was approved by Cabinet in May.
tgt_text: Sekolo sa Marega sa Tshepedišo ya Ikonomi Mmušong.

src_text: The amendments seek to align the country’s domestic instruments of fighting terrorism with the global measures that have been put in place.
tgt_text: Sekolotlhahlo sa Bosetšhaba sa Mmušo (NSG) se tla be se swere Lenaneo la sona la Boraro la Balaodiphethiši ba tša Dipolotiki gola Johannesburg go thoma ka la 27 Phupu go fihla ka la 1 Mosegamanye.

src_text: They have also addressed the clauses that were deemed unconstitutional by the Constitutional Court.
tgt_text: Thuto ye go yona go tla tla Ditona go tšwa Côte d'Ivoire; Borwa bja Sudan le Afrika Borwa gotee le Balaodipharephare ba go tšwa Lesotho, Zambia, DRC, Tanzania le Ghana.

src_text: As signatory to the UN Security Council, South Africa is duty-bound to domesticate the international laws that seek to strengthen measures to combat global terrorism     UPCOMING EVENTS.
tgt_text: Dimeyara tša Afrika Borwa, gotee le maloko dikomiti tša meyara le makgotlaphethiši le bona ba tla ba gona..     Go letetšwe gore baetapelephethiši ba sepolotiki go tšwa dinageng tša go fapafapana ba ngwathelane dikgopolo le tšeo ba ithutilego go tšwa go tšona maemong go fapafapana ditiragalo ao ba itemogetšego ona mešomong ya bona ya tšatši ka tšatši.

src_text: 14th Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa (BRICS) Summit.
tgt_text: NSG hlamile lenaneo la ngwaga ka ngwaga go maloko lekgotlakhuduthamaga ka 2020, bjalo ka karolo ya thekgo ya lona ya boikgafo bja mmušo bja go hlola mmušo wo kgonago.

src_text: President Ramaphosa will lead South Africa’s participation in the virtual 14th BRICS Leaders’ Summit hosted by the People’s Republic of China from Thursday, 23 to Friday, 24 June.
tgt_text: Lenaneo le, magareng ga tše dingwe, le šetšane le go tlabela lekgotlakhuduthamaga ka tsebo mo didikong tše tharo tša mmušo ka boetapele bjo bjo kaonafetšego le mabokgoni go bea leihlo mošomo wo dirilwego gore go kgonagale go lekolaleswa ditlhotlo tša pušo tšeo di šitišago go akaretšwa ga bohle le kgolo yeo swarelelago ya ikonomi.
Letšatši la Boditšhabatšhaba la Nelson Mandela.

src_text: Our BRICS membership   continues to benefit the country.
tgt_text: Letšatši la Boditšhabatšhaba la Nelson Mandela la lenyaga ka Mošupologo, 18 Mosegamanye le tla ketekelwa ka fase ga morero wa lefase ka bophara wo latelago: “Dira se se kgonago, ka seo nago le sona, kae goba kae mo lego gona”.

src_text: Last year over 17 percent of South Africa’s exports were destined to other BRICS countries, and over 29 percent of our total imports came from these countries.
tgt_text: Bjo ke boipiletšo bjo bo kwalakwaditšwego gore batho ba thekge le go kgatha tema lesolong le ka go logišana maano magato ao swarelelago nako ye telele go ba le ditlamorago tša go tšea telele.

src_text: The value of this trade continues to grow, with total South African trade with other BRICS countries reaching R702 billion in 2021, up from R487 billion in.
tgt_text: Ye nngwe ya magato mohuta wo ke Dipoledišano tša Baswa tša Nelson Mandela le Lenaneo la Boetapele bja Potego leo le lebeletšego kudu merero ye diragalago gona bjale ya go ama baswa ka mo Afrika Borwa le go potologa lefase ka bophara.
Sehla sa Metšhelo.

src_text: Collaboration within BRICS members in various areas such as health and enhanced trade has grown our local industry, and benefited all BRICS members.
tgt_text: Sehla sa go faela metšhelo ya 2022 se tla bulwa go thoma ka la 1 Mosegamanye go fihla ka la 24 Diphalane.

src_text: Our investment in infrastructure development projects and efforts to reduce red tape when doing business aim to increase exports to our BRICS partners.
tgt_text: Balefametšhelo ba hlohleletšwa go faela bohlatse bja bona bja tefo ya metšhelo mo go eFiling (www.sarsefiling.co.za) goba mo go MobiApp, elego sedirišwa sa Ditirelo tša Metšhelo tša Afrika Borwa (SARS)..     Ngwaga wo SARS tla tšwelapele ka go sekaseka balefametšhelo ka tee ka tee ka mokgwa wa go itiriša ka noši lego mokgwa wa go lefiša metšhelo ya letseno wo tlabetšwego pele ga nako go thuša go nolofatša tshepedišo ye ya go romela bohlatse bja tefo ya metšhelo.

src_text: Economic Governance Winter School.
tgt_text: Ka 2021 balefametšhelo ba go feta dimilione tše tharo ba sekasekilwe ka ona mokgwa wo wa go itiriša ka noši.

src_text: The National School of Government (NSG) will host its third Economic Governance Winter School Programme for Political Executives in Johannesburg from 27 June to 1 July.
tgt_text: Thomelo ya bonako le ye nepagetšego ya bohlatse bja metšhelo ga netefatše fela gore balefametšhelo ba dula ba latela molao eupša thuša mmušo go abela MaAfrika Borwa ditirelo tšeo ba di hlokago kudu     Melaetša.

src_text: It will be attended by Ministers from Côte d'Ivoire; South Sudan and South Africa; and Directors-General from Lesotho, Zambia, Democratic Republic of Congo, Tanzania and Ghana.
tgt_text: DitebogišoKabinete lebišitše ditebogišo tša yona le go lakaletša bao ba latelago mahlogonolo: Moahlodi Owen Lloyd Rogers morago ga gore thwalwe malobanyana mo bjalo ka Moahlodi wa Kgorotsheko ya Molaotheo ya Afrika Borwa.Kabinete bile le Mopresidente Ramaphosa go lakaletša Mopresidente wa peleng Thabo Mbeki Letšatši le Lethabo la Matswalo Mengwaga ye 80 leo le ketekilego ka la 18 Phupu.

src_text: South African mayors, as well as members of mayoral committees and executive councils, will also attend..
tgt_text: Morena Mbeki ke wo mongwe wa go bonelapele bokamoso bjo bjo gadimago bja šebešebe bja MaAfrika Borwa ka moka     Bao ba Thwetšwego MešomongBatho ka moka bao ba thwetšwego mešomong mangwalo bona thuto tlo tiišetšwa le go netefatšwa ka tsela ye maleba.

src_text: The political executives from different countries are expected to share ideas and lessons from different scenarios that they experience in their day-to-day work.
tgt_text: Balaodi bao sego ba Lekgotlaphethiši ba Lekgotlataolo la Afrika Borwa la Diphofo     Ntate Ernest Khosa     Mme Bulelwa Koyana     Ntate Surendra Sooklal; led.

src_text: The NSG designed the annual programme for members of the executive in 2020, as part of its support to government’s commitment to build capable state.
tgt_text: Mme Rejoice Edith Phewa.

src_text: It seeks to, among other things, equip executives within the three spheres of government with enhanced leadership and oversight capabilities to be able to re-examine governance challenges that constrain inclusivity and sustainable economic growth.
tgt_text: Maloko Kantoro ya Kutullo ya Dikadimo tša Magae le Kutullo ya Dipeelo     Mme Kenosi Pearl Louisa Selane (Modulasetulo)     Mme Catharina Maria Van der Sandt     Ntate Errol Vincent Magerman     Moadbokheiti Mandla Dludlu     Morena Matsobane Gabriel Mello     Mme Palesa Mawasha     Mme Penelope Anne Beck-Paxton     Mme Sphiwe Dorris Mayinga     Mme Tshifhiwa Victor Mphigalale; lej.

src_text: Issues in the Environment.
tgt_text: Tsebišo ka Seemo sa Bolwetši bja Coronavirus (COVID-19).

src_text: Update on the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19).
tgt_text: Kabinete lebogišitše batho ka moka mo Afrika Borwa ge ba tšeere sephetho sa go hlaba meento le go latela ditshepedišo ka moka tša COVID-19  tšeo pheletšo ya tšona kgontšhitšego naga ye go efoga palo ye hlatlogelago godimo ya diphetelo tše diswa ka nako ya leuba la bohlano la bolwetši bjo..

src_text: Cabinet commended all people in South Africa who chose to vaccinate and observe all COVID-19 protocols that resulted in the country averting rising numbers of new cases during the fifth wave of the pandemic..
tgt_text: Le ge go le bjalo, ga se ra swanela go iketla kudu ka ge COVID-19 santše sale gona.

src_text: However, we must not be complacent as COVID-19 is still in our midst.
tgt_text: Le ge le gore malobanyana mo naga fedišitše dinyakwa tša kgapeletšo tša go apara dimaseke mafelong bohle, batho ba go ba le malwetši mangwe le bao ba sa ntšego ba lwala ba hlohleletšwa go tšwelapele go apara dimaseke.

src_text: Although the country recently scrapped the compulsory wearing of masks in public, people with comorbidities and those who are ill are encouraged to continue wearing mask.
tgt_text: Re swanetše go tšwelapele go hlapa matsogo rena goba go sanithaesa, le gape go šielana sekgala le go netefatša gore go hlabela moya ka tsela ye maleba..  Meento santše le mokgwa wa go itšhireletša malwetšing wo hlatsetšwego ka sesaentshe kgahlanong le COVID-19 ebile Kabinete hlohleletša batho ka moka bao ba sa kago ba hlaba meento go ya go hlaba meento ya bona ya go tsošeletša mafelong kgauswi le bona go hlaba meento ntle le tefo..  Mabora dikgabo.

src_text: We must also continue to wash or sanitise our hands, and observe social distancing and proper ventilation.
tgt_text: Kabinete sedimošitšwe ka seemo sa moragorago seo se gatetšego pele mabapi le go phatlalala ga Mabora Dikgabo ka mo nageng morago ga kgonthišišo ye lokolotšwego ya moragorago ya gore go na le motho wa bobedi yo nago le bolwetši bjo ka mo nageng.
Batho bao ba fetetšwego ba ipeetše thoko ka magaeng bona ebile lesolo la go lota mehlala ya batho bao ba ka bego ba kgokagane le bona le gare le kgatlampana go ba humana.

src_text: Vaccination remains the scientifically proven defence against COVID-19 and Cabinet encourages all unvaccinated people to vaccinate without delay and vaccinated people to get their booster shots at their nearest vaccination sites, for free..  Monkeypox.
Cabinet was updated on the latest developments in the spread of Monkeypox disease in the country following the recent confirmation of second case in the country.
tgt_text: Kgoro ya Maphelo le Setheo sa Bosetšhaba sa Malwetši ao Fetelanago se šomišana mmogo le Mokgatlo wa Lefase wa tša Maphelo go lekola kotsi ya diphetelo tša ka mo nageng ka go sepedišana le Melao ya Boditšhabatšhaba ya Maphelo..   Baerase ye ya Mabora Dikgabo ga phatlalale bonolo ebile phetelo ya gona gantši diragala morago ga go kgomana go swana le go atlana, go kgwathakgwathana goba go swaraswara ditho tša mmele tša go ba le dišo tša motho wa go swarwa ke mabora dikgabo.

src_text: The affected persons are isolating at home and contact tracing is being conducted to detect others who may have been exposed..
tgt_text: Batho bao ba se nago dika tša mabora dikgabo ga go kgonagale gore ba fetetše ba bangwe ka baerase ye..  Kabinete eleditše batho bao ba itemogelago dika tša letadi, dika tša go tlwaelega tša go swana le tša mokhohlane, le menyabidi ya mmala wo mohubitšwana go bega ditiragalo tše dikliniking tša maphelo tša kgauswi le bona gore bolwetši bjo bo humanwe ka bonako le go phekolwa..  Masetlapelo Thabeneng ya East London.

src_text: The Department of Health and the National Institute for Communicable Diseases are collaborating with the World Health Organisation to assess the risk for local transmission in line with the International Health Regulations..
tgt_text: Masetlapelo go tšhabiša namana tša mmele kua Thabeneng ya Enyobeni gola East London Profenseng ya Kapa Bohlabela ka la 26 Phupu 2022 ao tšeerego maphelo batšwamahlalaging ba 21 tšhošitše kudu batho ka moka ka nageng.

src_text: The monkeypox virus is not easily spread and usually only occurs after close contact such as kissing, cuddling or touching parts of the body with monkeypox lesions.
tgt_text: Go tloga go le boima kudu go gopola ka tlalelo ya malapa bao ba lobilego bana ba bona ka mokgwa wo wo sehlogo..  Kabinete lebišitše melaetša ya yona ya mahloko go malapa ao lobilego bao ba phelago le bona le go leboga motho mang le mang ka thekgo ya bona ya moya wa botho go malapa ao llelago metswalle ya bona mo nakong ye ye boima..  Go hlobaetša gore bana ba bannyane ba mengwaga ya go lekana 13 ba ile ba dumelelwa go tsena lefelong leo le go gamola madila.

src_text: People without monkeypox symptoms cannot spread the virus to others..
tgt_text: Re dira boipiletšo bathong ka moka setšhabeng go kgatha tema ya bona go dira gore bana ba dule ba bolokegile ka dinako tšohle..  Bana ba mengwaga ya ka fase ga ye 18 ga ba dumelelwe go tsena ka dipareng, ka dithebeneng, le ka mabenkeleng go rekiša madila.

src_text: Cabinet advised people who experience symptoms of fever, general flu-like signs, followed by blister-like rash to report to their nearest healthcare facility for early detection and treatment..  East London tavern tragedy.
tgt_text: Bagwebi ba madila bao go ka humanwago ba gataka ye mengwe ya melao ye ba swanetše go pharwa ka bosenyi le go tšeelwa dilaesense tša bona tša go rekiša madila..  Dipoelo go tšwa Samiting ya Baetapele ba Seboka sa Dinaga tše Šupa (G7).

src_text: The devastating tragedy at the Enyobeni Tavern in East London in the Eastern Cape on Sunday, 26 June 2022 that claimed the lives of 21 teenagers, has shattered our entire country.
tgt_text: Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa kgathile tema Samiting ya Baetapele ba Seboka sa Dinaga tše Šupa (G7) yeo bego swaretšwe kua Bavaria, Germany ka Mošupologo, 27 Phupu.

src_text: It is hard to imagine the anguish of families who lost their children in such tragic manner..
tgt_text: Mopresidente – yo kgathilego tema dikopanong tša mošomo fao go tšona go ahlaahlilwego merero ya klaemete, mohlagase, maphelo le tšhireletšego ya dijo lefaseng ka bophara – be memilwe ke moswarakopano ye, Mokhanseliri Olaf Scholz..  G7 ke foramo ya sepolotiki ya magareng ga didiko tša mmušo ya go hlangwa ke Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, United Kingdom le Amerika  Diphetho tša Kabinete.

src_text: Cabinet expressed its condolences to the families who lost their loved ones and thanked everyone for their humanitarian support to the grieving families during this difficult time..
tgt_text: Seakanywa sa Melao ya Lefapha la Semolao (Seakanywa sa LSC).

src_text: It is concerning that children as young as 13 were allowed to enter the venue and consume alcohol.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletšwe go phatlalatšwa ga Seakanywa sa LSC gore setšhaba se fe ditshwayotshwayo tša sona.

src_text: We call on communities to play their part in keeping our children safe at all times..  Children under the age of 18 are not allowed to enter taverns, shebeens, pubs and bottle stores.
tgt_text: Dinepo tša melao ye ke go kgontšha diphetogo ka lefapheng la semolao go fihlelela tekatekano ya batho goya le ka dipalopalo tša ka mo nageng.

src_text: Liquor traders who are found to be contravening any of these laws must be criminally charged and have their operating licences revoked.
tgt_text: Melao ye tla netefatša gape le gore go ba le setheo seo se tla tšweletšago baabaditirelo bao ba hlahlilwego gabotse le ba bokgoni ditirelong tša semolao.

Go hlangwa ga Seakanywa se sa LSC go lekotšwe ke Khansele ya Phethagatšo ya Semolao bago setheo sa mmušo seo se hlamilwego goya ka Karolo 4 ya Molao wa Phethagatšo ya Semolao, 2014 (Molao 28 wa 2014) le go hlahlwa ke Molao wa Matlafatšo ya Ikonomi ya Bathobaso yeo Nabilego (B-BBEE), 2013 (Molao 46 wa 2013).

src_text: Outcomes from the Group of Seven (G7) Leaders’ Summit.
tgt_text: Molao wa B-BBEE wa 2013 bolela ka gore Tona ya Dikgwebišano, Diintasteri le Diphenkgišano tla lokolla ditlhathollo tša phethagatšo ye maleba matlafatšong ya ikonomi ya bathobaso mo mafapheng go ikgetha.

src_text: President Cyril Ramaphosa participated in the G7 Leaders’ Summit which took place in Bavaria, Germany on Monday, 27 June.
tgt_text: Maloko profešene ya semolao ka motsotso wo ga ba na melao ya lefapha le ya go ba hlahla go kalokana le go fetafetana le go se lekalekane profešeneng ya semolao.

src_text: The President – who participated in working sessions where climate, energy, health, global food security and gender equality issues were discussed – was invited by the host, Chancellor Olaf Scholz..
tgt_text: Seakanywa sa LSC se tlo phatlalatšwa ka gare ga Kuranta ya Mmušo mo matšatšing 60 go dumelela setšhaba go fa ditshwayotshwayo tša sona..  Dipego tša Kgatelopele ya Mošomo tša go Lokollwa Gabedi mo Ngwageng.

src_text: The G7 is an intergovernmental political forum consisting of Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom and the United States  Cabinet Decisions.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše dipego tša kgatelopele ya mošomo tša go lokollwa gabedi mo ngwageng tša go thoma ka Diphalane 2021 go fihla ka Hlakola.

src_text: Draft Legal Sector Code (Draft LSC).
tgt_text: Dipego tše di bopa karolo ya Tlhako ye Logetšwego Maano ya Paka ya Magareng (MTSF) ya 2019-.

src_text: Cabinet approved the publication of the Draft LSC for public comment.
tgt_text: MTSF ya 2019-2024 ke leano la phethagatšo le tlhako ya go lekola mošomo ya go fihlelela Leanotlhabollo la Bosetšhaba: dinyakwa tše beilwego pele tša Ponelopele ya 2030 go basepediši ba lekga la boselela la mmušo.

src_text: The objectives of these codes are to facilitate the transformation of the legal sector to achieve representation as per the country’s demographics.
tgt_text: Dipego tše di be di šetšane le ditlapele tše šupa tša mmušo lego (1) Diphetogo tša ikonomi le tlhomo ya mešomo; (2) Thuto, mabokgoni le tša maphelo; (3) Go kopantšha mmogo meputso ya leago ka ditirelo tša go botega le tše hlwahlwa tša motheo; (4) Go momaganywa ga mafelo, madulo batho le pušoselegae; (5) Phedišano setšhabeng le setšhaba sa go bolokega; (6) Mmušo wa bokgoni, wa potego le wo gatelago pele; le (7) Afrika le lefase le kaonafetšego, le magato go amana le go rarolla seemo basepediši ba mmušo ba lekga la boselela..  Kabinete amogetše magoro mošomo wo gatetšego pele godimo ga dinepo tšeo di theilwego tša paka ye re lego ka gare ga yona.

src_text: The code will also ensure the development of the body that will produce well-trained and competent providers of legal services.
tgt_text: Kabinete lemogile gape le magoro ao nyakago magato gore go tle go fedišwe go nanya ga seemo seo se amilwego gampe ke leuba la COVID-.

src_text: The development of the Draft LSC was overseen by the Legal Practice Council statutory body established in terms of Section 4 of the Legal Practice Act, 2014 (Act 28 of 2014) and guided by the Broad-Based Black Economic Empowerment Act (B-BBEE), 2013 (Act 46 of 2013).
The B-BBEE Act of 2013 provides for the Minister of Trade, Industry and Competition to issue codes of good practice on black economic empowerment in the specific sectors.
tgt_text: Ditona di tlo swara ditshedimošetšo tša babegaditaba mo dibekeng tše tlago go hlatholla dipego tša bona ka go latelana ga tšona le go hlalošiša magoro ao go ona mošomo swanetšego go tiišeletšwa letsogo  Ditiragalo tšeo di Tlago.

src_text: Members of the legal profession currently do not have sector code to guide them in addressing the imbalances and inequalities in the legal profession.
tgt_text: Khonferense ya Bahlomi ba Diinstasteri ba Bathobaso le ya Baromela ka Ntle ga Naga (BIEC).

src_text: The Draft LSC will be published in the Government Gazette for 60 days to allow for public comments..  Biannual performance progress reports.
tgt_text: Khonferense ya Pulamadibogo ya BIEC tla swarelwa Sentharengkgoparara ya Boditšhabatšhaba ya Sandton gola Johannesburg ka Laboraro, 20 Mosegamanye.

src_text: Cabinet approved the biannual performance progress reports for the period covering October 2021 to March.
The reports form part of the Medium Term Strategic Framework (MTSF) 2019-.
tgt_text: Khonferense ye latela tsebagatšo ya mathomong ngwaga wo ya Tšhomišanommogo ya Diromelwantle tša Bahlomi ba Diintasteri ba Bathobaso ka mmušo, yeo thekgago bahlomi ba diintasteri ba bathobaso go kgona go tsenelela mebarakeng ye meswa, le go kgona go fihlelela thekgo ya ditšhelete ya diromelwantle le mekgwa ya go bapaletša ba bangwe  Melaetša.

src_text: The MTSF 2019-2024 is the implementation plan and monitoring framework for achieving the National Development Plan: Vision 2030 priorities for the sixth administration of government.
tgt_text: DitebogišoKabinete lebiša ditebogišo tša yona le go lakaletša bao ba latelago mahlogonolo: Springboks, ka phenyo ya yona ya go thabiša kudu ya motsotso wa mafelelo kgahlanong le Wales nakong ya phenkgišano ya mathomo godimo ga diteko tše tharo tša dipapadi Lepatlelong la Loftus Versveld gola Pretoria ka Mokibelo, 2 Mosegamanye.

src_text: The reports focused on the seven priorities of government, namely (1) Economic transformation and job creation; (2) Education, skills and health; (3) Consolidating the social wage through reliable and quality basic services; (4) Spatial integration, human settlements and local government; (5) Social cohesion and safe communities; (6) capable, ethical and developmental state; and (7) better Africa and world, and related interventions of the sixth administration..
tgt_text: Banyana Banyana, ka phenyo ya yona ya go nweša dino tše pedi go ye tee papading ya pulamadibogo ya Mogopo wa Basadi wa Ditšhaba tša Afrika kgahlanong le Nigeria yeo bego bapalelwa gola Morocco, ka Mošupologo, 4 Mosegamanye  Bao ba Thwetšwego MešomongBatho ka moka bao ba thwetšwego mešomong mangwalo bona thuto tlo tiišetšwa le go netefatšwa ka tsela ye maleba.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed areas of progress on the determined targets for the period under review.
tgt_text: Ngaka Nyameko Barney Pityana bjalo ka Modulasetulo wa Khomišene ya Bosetšhaba ya Lotto..     Moadbokheiti Rory Voller bjalo ka Mokomišinare wa Khomišene ya Dikhamphani le ya Tsebo ya Kgopolo.

src_text: Energy.
tgt_text: Mohlagase.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the interventions introduced by government to address the country’s energy crisis.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogela ditsenogare tšeo di tsebišitšwego ke mmušo go šogana le mathata mohlagase ka nageng.

src_text: The far-reaching measures pave the way to reduce load-shedding, transform the electricity sector and achieve long-term energy security.
tgt_text: Magato bohlokwa ao tšerwego kgora tsela ya go fokotša go kgaotšwa ga mohlagase, le go fetoša lekala la mohlagase le go fihlelela tšhireletšo ya mohlagase ya nako ye telele.

src_text: In supporting the energy grid and helping our country through its constrained electricity supply, we need to reduce our nation’s energy consumption by 600 megawatts over the next three months..
tgt_text: Mo go thekgeng kabo ya mohlagase le go thuša naga ya rena ka kabo ya mohlagase yeo imelwago, re nyaka go fokotša tšhomišo ya mohlagase nageng ya rena ka dimekawate tše 600 mo dikgweding tše tharo tše di latelago.

src_text: Households can play their part in conserving energy by switching off all non-essential lighting and high-energy appliances during peak demand times.
tgt_text: Malapa ka kgatha tema ya wona mo go bolokeng mohlagase ka go tima didirišwa tšeo di sego bohlokwa le tšeo di šomišago mohlagase wo montši mo dinakong tšeo tšhomišo lego godimo.

src_text: Businesses are encouraged to adopt more energy-efficient production technology and participate in initiatives to reduce electricity demand..  Operation Vulindlela.
tgt_text: Dikgwebo di hlohleletšwa go šomiša theknolotši ya tšweletšo ya mohlagase ya mohola gape ye ntši le go kgatha tema mo mananeong go fokotša tšhomišo ye ntši ya mohlagase..     Operation Vulindlela.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the progress made under Operation Vulindlela to clear bottlenecks across the energy, telecommunications, and water and tourism sectors to revive the economy.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogela tšwelopele yeo dirilwego ka fase ga Operation Vulindlela go fediša dititelego tše di lebanego le mohlagase, dikgokagano tša megala, meetse le lekala la boeti go tsošološa ekonomi.

src_text: Nine out of the 26 structural reforms have been achieved, with 11 reforms making good progress.
tgt_text: Dimpshafatšo tša meago tše senyane go tše 26 di feditšwe, mola go na le tšwelopele ya dimpshafatšo tše.

src_text: Successes include increasing the licensing threshold for embedded generation, the corporatisation of the Transnet National Ports Authority, release of the revised critical skills list and the implementation of the e-Visa system in 14 countries, including major new tourist markets such as China, India, Kenya and Nigeria..  Gender-based violence and femicide (GBVF).
tgt_text: Dikatlego di akaretša go thoma ga dilaesense go tšweletšo ye tiilego, go fetošetša ga Taolo ya Maemakepe Setšhaba Transnet, tokollo ya mabokgoni bohlokwa ao lekotšwego lefsa le phethagatšo ya lenaneo la e-Visa mo dinageng tše 14, go akaretša mebaraka ya boeti ye mefsa ye megolo go swana le China, India, Kenya le Nigeria..     Dikgaruru le Dipolao tšeo di Hlolwago ke Bong (GBVF).

src_text: Cabinet expressed outrage at the recent brutal rape of eight women in Krugersdorp in Gauteng.
tgt_text: Kabinete tšweleditše pefelo mo go katweng go go šoro ga basadi ba seswai mo Krugersdorp ka Gauteng.

src_text: These vile acts and abuse against women undermine our social fabric.
tgt_text: Ditiro tše tše dimpe le tlhorišo kgahlanong le basadi di nyatša mokgwa wa rena wa leago.

src_text: Cabinet further commended the South African Police Service for their swift arrest of number of suspects in connection with the heinous crime..
tgt_text: Kabinete retile gape Tirelo ya Maphodisa Afrika Borwa ka go swara babelaelwa ba mmalwa malebana le bosenyi bjo bošoro..     Kabinete ipiletša go ditšhaba go šoma le maphodisa le makala mangwe phethagatšo ya molao ka go abelana ka tshedimošo goba go bega mešongwana ya go belaetša.

src_text: Cabinet appealed to communities to work with law-enforcement agencies by sharing any information or reporting suspicious activities.
tgt_text: Ge re šoma mmogo, re ka dira gore ditšhaba tša rena di bolokege go basadi le bana.

src_text: Working together, we can make our communities safer for women and children..  Every South African has duty to act against perpetrators of violence within the ambit of the law.
tgt_text: Moafrika Borwa yo mongwe le yo mongwe na le mošomo wa go ba kgahlanong le basenyi ba dikgaruru ka karolong ya molao.

src_text: Report all GBVF-related incidents to local police station or call the toll-free Crime Stop number: 0860 01 0111, the National GBVF Command Centre: 0800 428 428 or Stop Gender Violence Helpline: 0800 150.  .
tgt_text: Bega ditiragalo ka moka tša GBV setišing sa kgauswi sa maphodisa goba leletša nomoro ya Crime Stop: 08600 10111, Senthara ya Taolo ya Setšhaba: 0800 428 428 goba Mogala wa go Emiša Dikgaruru tša Bong: 0800.

src_text: Women’s Month.
tgt_text: Kgwedi ya Basadi.

src_text: The annual Women’s Month in August pays tribute to women who participated in the liberation struggle and all women in our society..
tgt_text: Kgwedi ya Basadi ya ngwaga le ngwaga ka Phato hlompha basadi bao ba kgathilego tema ntweng ya tokologo le basadi ka moka mo setšhabeng.

src_text: This year’s Women Month is being celebrated under the theme: “Women’s Socio-Economic Rights and Empowerment: Building Back Better for Women’s Improved Resilience”..
tgt_text: Kgwedi ya Basadi ya ngwaga wo ketekwa ka fase ga morero: “Ditokelo tša Basadi tša Ekonomi ya Leago: Go Aga Lefsa Bokaone go Matlafala ga Basadi moo go Kaonafetšego”..     Basadi ba go feta 20 000 bao ba gwantetšego Union Buildings ka Pretoria ka la 9 Phato 1956 ba kgathile tema go kgonthiša gore tekatekano ya bong le matlafatšo di dule di le bohlokwa ka temokrasing ya Afrika Borwa.

src_text: The over 20 000 women who marched to the Union Buildings in Pretoria on 9 August 1956 contributed to ensuring that gender equality and empowerment remains key priority in democratic South Africa.
tgt_text: Dikgato tša bona tša bogale di hlohleleditše basadi ka kakaretšo go tšea maemo bona ao ba swanetšego ka Palamenteng, mmušong le setšhabeng, gomme re dira dikaonafatšo tše ga nnyane ga nnyane go tloga mola re hwetšago tokologo ka.

src_text: Their brave actions inspired women in general to take their rightful place in Parliament, government and civil society, and we are constantly building on these advances since gaining freedom in.
tgt_text: Segopotšo sa Marikana.
Ka Labobedi, 16 Phato 2022, mmušo kopane le naga ka moka go gopola masetlapelo ao diragetšego ka Marikana Leboa Bodikela ka.

src_text: Marikana commemoration.
tgt_text: Bohloko bjoo bo kwelwego ke bašomi, malapa bona le naga ka bophara bo tla dula bo le gona mo historing ya rena.

src_text: On Tuesday, 16 August 2022, government joined the rest of the country in remembering the tragedy that unfolded at Marikana in North West in.
tgt_text: Lenaneo la Mpshafatšo la Marikana le phethagaditšwe go aga lefsa le go hlola tikologo ya go dumelela go kaonafatša maphelo setšhaba sa Marikana.

src_text: The pain felt by the workers, their families and the nation at large would forever be entrenched in our history..
tgt_text: Ngwaga wa go feta mmušo lefile R176 milione go lliša malapa batšwasehlabelo gomme melato ye sa šetšego ye lego dikgorotshekong go letetšwe gore phethwe mafelelong .

src_text: The Marikana Renewal Programme has been implemented to rebuild and create an enabling environment to improve the lives of the Marikana community.
tgt_text: Dintlo tše di mpshafaditšwego goba tšeo di agilwego lefsa di filwe bahlologadi ba Marikana gomme tše dingwe di tla phethwa ngwaga wo.

src_text: Last year government paid R176 million in compensation to the families of the victims and the remaining cases under litigation are expected to be finalised by the end of August number of renovated or newly acquired houses have been handed to the Marikana widows and others will be completed this year R700-million housing project will see mineworkers being provided with decent housing.
tgt_text: Protšeke ya dintlo ya R700 milione dira gore go bonwe bašomi ba moepong ba fiwa dintlo tša seriti.

src_text: Critical social infrastructure is being provided to improve the living conditions of mining communities.
tgt_text: Go filwe infrastraktšha ya leago ye bohlokwa go kaonafatša maemo go phela ditšhaba tša moepong.
Imbizo ya Mopresidente ya ka Gauteng ka Mmotlolo wa Tlhabollo ya Dilete (DDM).

src_text: District Development Model (DDM) Presidential Imbizo in Gauteng.
tgt_text: Go latela katlego ya Izimbizo tša Mopresidente tše tharo tšeo di swerwego ka Leboa Bodikela, Freistata le Mpumalanga ka tsela yeo, Mmasepala wa Selete wa Sedibeng ka Gauteng swere karolo ya bone ka Labohlano, 12 Phato..     Ka fase ga morero: “Akaretša batho ka moka”, Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa etile pele sehlopha sa bahlenkedi ba maemo godimo go tšwa go mebušo ya bosetšhaba, ya profense le ya selegae.

src_text: Following the success of the previous three DDM Presidential Izimbizo hosted in North West, Free State and Mpumalanga respectively, the Sedibeng District Municipality in Gauteng hosted the fourth instalment on Friday, 12 August..
tgt_text: Maafrika Borwa ka mekgatlo le makala bona ba beakantšwe gore ba šome mmogo kgahlanong le magato ao golago bohloki le mathata ao hlotšego maemo ao hlotlago ekonomi.

src_text: Under the theme: “Leave no one behind”, President Cyril Ramaphosa led the delegation of senior officials from the national, provincial and local governments.
tgt_text: Selete sa Sedibeng se na le tšwelopele mo phethagatšong ya Vaal River Special Economic Zone (SEZ), yeo lego bohlokwa go kaonafatšeng selete, profense le naga.

src_text: South Africans in their various formations and sectors were mobilised to act together against rising levels of poverty and destitution caused by the challenging economic conditions..
