tgt_text: Vaal River SEZ beakanya go swara makala bohlokwa a latelago: Vaal River Smart City; Hapo ya Tlhabollo ya Green Hydrogen; hapo ya khabisi; agro-logistiki, aerotropolisi; aetrome, sefofane sa merwalo le lekala la tšweletšo ya tšhipi ye matlafaditšwego.

src_text: The Sedibeng District has made progress in operationalising the Vaal River Special Economic Zone (SEZ), which holds potential for the reindustrialisation of the region, province and country.
tgt_text: Samiti ya Lekala la Leago ya Mopresidente.

src_text: The Vaal River SEZ plans to host the following critical sectors: The new Vaal River Smart City; Green Hydrogen Innovation Hub; cannabis hub; agro-logistics; aerotropolis; aerodrome; air freight and the revitalised steel manufacturing sector.
tgt_text: Samiti ya Lekala la Leago ya Mopresidente yeo swerwego ka Ekurhuleni, Gauteng go tloga ka la 4 go fihla ka la 5 Phato 2022 ka fase ga morero “Go godiša Tirišano ya Leago go kgontšha go Kgatha Tema go Ekonomi ya Leago mo Ditšhabeng” kopantše bakgathatema go tšwa dileteng go šoma le mmušo go šogana le ditlhohlo tša ekonomi ya leago le go beakanya methopo ya ditšhaba tša leago, gare ga dinepo tše dingwe..     Samiti lebeletše dipego tša dipoledišano go tšwa go diprofense tše 9 ka ditlhohlo tša tšona, tšeo di akaretšago thekgo ya ditšhelete, ditaba tša taolo, phetogo ya lekala la leago ka kgopolo ya go godiša tirišano ya go šogana le ditlhohlo tšeo di lebanego le bohloki, go se lekalekane le tlhokego ya mešomo.

Kabinete ipiletša go mekgatlo ya selegae le badudi go kgatha tema ya bona ka mafolofolo go kgonthiša gore re aga bokamoso bjo bokaone, bjalo ka ge go beakantšwe go Leano la Tlhabollo la Setšhaba: Pono ya     Diphetho tša Kabinete.

src_text: Presidential Social Sector Summit.
tgt_text: Leanolegolo la Diintasteri tša Boithomelo le Setšo.

src_text: The Presidential Social Sector Summit held in Ekurhuleni, Gauteng from 4 to 5 August 2022 under the theme: “Fostering Social Cohesion to Enable Socio-Economic Participation in Communities”, brought together stakeholders from different constituencies to work with government to address socio-economic challenges and mobilise resources for civil society, among other objectives..
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše gore leanolegolo la Diintasteri tša Boithomelo le Setšo le phethagatšwe.

src_text: The summit considered dialogue reports from the nine provinces on their challenges, which included access to funding, regulatory issues, transformation of the social sector with view to fostering state-civil society partnership to address challenges related to poverty, inequality and unemployment..
tgt_text: Leanolegolo le nepiša bokgabo bja pono; tiroatla le moakanyetšo; bobegaditaba bja go bonwa le go kwa le bja kgokaganyo, ditirelo tša moakanyetšo le tša bokgabo; phethagatšo le keteko, go akaretša mmino, phatlalatšo le bobegaditaba bja kgatišo.

src_text: Cabinet called on civil-society organisations and citizens to play their active part in ensuring that we build better tomorrow, as envisioned in the National Development Plan: Vision  Cabinet Decisions.
tgt_text: Leanolegolo le tla tsena ka bogare mo makaleng go aga lekala la kaonafatšo ya boithomelo leo le tla lemogwago lefaseng ka moka le go phadišana mo lefelong.

src_text: Cultural and Creative Industries Masterplan.
tgt_text: Le tla šoma intastering ya boithomelo ya Afrika Borwa la kgona go fihlelela mebaraka ya gae le ya boditšhabatšhaba..     Tlhako ye Mpshafaditšwego ya Ditšhelete tša Dikadimo go Mebasepala ka moka le Ditšhelete tša Merero ya Ditšhoganetšo.

src_text: Cabinet approved the Cultural and Creative Industries Masterplan for implementation.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše dimpshafatšo go Tlhako ye Mpshafaditšwego ya Ditšhelete tša Dikadimo go Mebasepala ka moka le Ditšhelete tša Merero ya Ditšhoganetšo.

src_text: The masterplan focuses on visual arts; crafts and design; audio-visual and interactive media; design and creative services; performance and celebration, including music, publishing and printed media..
tgt_text: Dimpshafatšo di go karolo ya kadimo ya tlhako ye.

src_text: The masterplan will intervene in these sectors towards building transformed creative innovative sector that will be globally recognised and competitive in the space.
tgt_text: Gare ga dimpshafatšo tšeo di akantšwego go thoma paka ya go adima ya nako ye telele go sepelelana le nako ya mohola ya tše dingwe tša dithoto tšeo di thekgilwego ka ditšhelete.

src_text: It will work towards the South African creative industry being able to access the local and international markets..
tgt_text: Dimpshafatšo di hlakiša mohola wa diinstitušene tša ditšhelete tša tlhabollo mo sekgobeng sa kadimo sa mebasepala.

src_text: Updated Policy Framework for Municipal Borrowing and Financial Emergencies.
tgt_text: Karolo ya 230 ya Molaotheo wa Repabliki ya Afrika Borwa ya 1996 matlafatša mebasepala go kgoboketša dikadimo tša matlotlo bona goba ditshenyagelo tša gonabjale.

src_text: Cabinet approved the amendments to the current Policy Framework for Municipal Borrowing and Financial Emergencies.
tgt_text: Tlhako ya kgale dumeletšwe ke Kabinete ka 2000 go hlahla Kgaolo ya 6 le 13 ya Molao wa Ditšhelete wa Mebasepala, wa 2003 (Molao wa 2003).

src_text: The amendments are mainly on the borrowing section of this framework.
tgt_text: Dimpshafatšo tše di dumeletšwego di nyaka go hlohleletša baadimiši ba bantši mo mebasepaleng go hlokomela melao ya motheo yeo hlohleletšago go adima ga mebasepala..     Tšhupamabaka ye Lokolotšwego Pele ga Nako ya Phatlalatšo ya Dipalopalo tša Bosenyi tšeo di Begilwego tša Kotara ya Ngwaga wa Ditšhelete wa 2022/.

src_text: Amongst the amendments   proposed introducing longer-term borrowing period to match the useful lifespan of some of the assets being financed.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Financial Matters Amendments Bill,.
tgt_text: Molao wo mpshafaditšwego wa diphenšene tla kgontšha balekane go lemoga dikgahlego tša bona tša diphenšene ka bjako ge ba hlalana.

src_text: The Bill proposes the amendment to seven Acts, namely (1) Associated Institutions Pension Fund Act, 1963 (Act 41 of 1963); (2) Military Pension Act,1976 (Act 84 of 1976); (3) Government Employees Pension Law of 1996; (4) Financial and Fiscal Commission Act,1997 (Act 99 of 1997); (5) Land and Agricultural Development Bank Act, 2002 (Act 15 of 2002); (6) Audit Profession Act 2005 (Act 26 of 2005) and  the (7) Auditing Profession Amendment Act 2021 (Act 5 of 2021).
tgt_text: Go tlaleletša go hlaloša mošomo wa Tona ya Matlotlo le go hlakiša, dimpshafatšo di fetoša gape maatla komiti ya phethagatšo moo motlhakiši amogelago molato.

src_text: The proposed amendments include, under the Military Pension Act of 1996, the inclusion of life partners to the benefits retrospectively from 27 April.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywa phatlaladitšwe gore setšhaba se swayeswaye ka Dibokwane.

src_text: The pension laws amendments will enable spouses to realise their pension interest immediately on dissolution of the marriage.
In addition to clarifying the role of the Minister of Finance and on the auditing, the amendments also adjust the powers of the enforcement committee where an auditor admits guilt.

src_text: The Bill is an omnibus Bill that amends the current Acts namely  Financial Intelligence Centre Act, 2001 (Act 38 of 2001); (ii) Nonprofit Organisation Act, 1997 (Act 71 of 1997); (iii) Trust Property Control Act, 1988 (Act 57 of 1988); (iv) Companies Act, 2008 (Act 71 of 2008) and  Financial Sector Regulations Act, 2017( Act 9 of 2017).

src_text: The amendments respond to the deficiencies identified during the peer review of the country conducted by the Financial Action Task Force (FATF).

src_text: The mutual evaluation report made 40 recommendations that would assist in getting South Africa to be aligned with international measures of combating money laundering and financing of terrorism..  South Africa was found to be lacking in 20 areas.
This Bill addresses about 14 of the areas identified.

tgt_text: Dipalopalo tšeo di phatlaladitšwego ka Dinyakišišong tša Bašomi tša Kotara ye Nngwe le ye Nngwe ke Dipalopalo tša Afrika Borwa di bontšha gore mešomo ye mentši bile gona ka go Ditirelo tša Setšhaba le tša Leago (276 000), ka lekaleng la Kgwebo (169 000), la Ditšhelete (128 000) le lekaleng la Kago (104 000).

src_text: The figures published in the Quarterly Labour Force Survey by Statistics South Africa show that the biggest job gains were recorded in Community and Social Services (276 000), Trade (169 000), Finance (128 000) and Construction (104 000)..
tgt_text: Palomoka ya batho bao ba thwetšwego eme go 15, 6 milione mo kotareng ya bobedi ya 2022, gomme palo ya batho bao ba sa šomego oketšegile ka batho ba 132 000 gomme ya fihla dimilione tše seswai mo kotareng ya bobedi ya 2022 ge go bapetšwa le kotara ya go feta.

src_text: The total number of employed persons stood at 15, 6 million in the second quarter of 2022, and the number of unemployed persons increased by 132 000 to 8, 0 million in the second quarter of 2022 compared to the previous quarter.
tgt_text: Dipoelo tše tša go kgahliša gape tša go kwagala di bontšha gore maitapišo ao kopanetšwego mmušo le badirišani ba wona ba leago go godiša ekonomi le go hlola mešomo yeo hlokegago thoma go tšweletša dipoelo tše dibotse.

src_text: These modest yet impressive gains show that the concerted efforts by government and its social partners to grow the economy and create much-needed jobs are beginning to bear fruit..
tgt_text: Se ke bohlatse bja gore ge ka moka re šoma mmogo ka go kopanya bokgoni bja rena, re ka fenya ditlhohlo tšeo di lebanego le ekonomi ya rena.

src_text: This is testament to the fact that if we all work together by harnessing our collective strengths, we can overcome the challenges facing our economy..
tgt_text: Kabinete kwešiša matshwenyego maAfrika Borwa ge ba palelwa ke go phela gabotse ka lebaka la bophelo bja go bitša tšhelete ye ntši le palo ya godimo ya go hloka mošomo.

src_text: Cabinet understands the frustrations of South Africans as they struggle to go about their daily lives owing to the cost of living and high unemployment rate.
tgt_text: Bjalo ka mmušo wo hlokomelago batho ba wona, re dula re tiile le go ikgafa go šoma mmogo le badirišani ba rena ba leago go aga bokamoso bjo bokaone bja yo mongwe le yo mongwe.

src_text: As caring government, we remain determined and committed to working together with our social partners to build better tomorrow for everyone.
tgt_text: Mmušo dula ikgafile go thekga dikgwebo tša gae ka go reka dithoto le go šomiša ditirelo tša tšona.

src_text: Government remains committed to supporting local businesses by buying local goods and services.

src_text: Cabinet condemned the destruction of infrastructure by Tongaat residents in KwaZulu-Natal during protest over access to water.
tgt_text: Kabinete ipeletša gore batho ba iše matswalo fase gape ba be le kgotlelelo ka ge mošomo tšwela pele go lokiša Tongaat Water Treatment Works..  Kabinete kwešiša matshwenyego badudi bao ba swanelago ke go šomiša ditanka tša meetse nako ye telele go tloga mola go bago le mafula pejana mo ngwageng wo.

src_text: Cabinet called for calm and patience as work is underway to restore the Tongaat Water Treatment Works.
tgt_text: Le ge go le bjalo, dikgaruru le tlhakahlakano ga se tharollo, gomme go senywa ga infrastraktšha ya setšhaba go kweša setšhaba seo se dulago moo bohloko.
Molao wo Mpshafaditšwego wa Mananeo Mebasepala ya Mmušo wa Selegae wa.

src_text: Cabinet understands the frustrations of residents who have had to use water tankers for an extended period since the flooding earlier this year.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogela go saenelwa go ba molao ga Molao wo Mpshafaditšwego wa Mananeo Mebasepala ya Mmušo wa Selegae, wa 2022 (Molao wa 3 wa 2022) ke Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa.

src_text: However, violence and anarchy are not solution, and the destruction of public infrastructure only hurts local communities.
tgt_text: Maikemišetšo molao ke go kaonafatša bokgoni le maemo maitshwaro mmušo wa selegae.

src_text: Local Government Municipal Systems Amendment Act of.
tgt_text: Mmušo bopa karolo ya maitapišo go dira gore Tirelo ya Setšhaba be ya profešene le go kgonthiša go swarelela ga kabo ya ditirelo go batho, bjalo ka tokelo ya motheo yeo šireleditšwego ka go Molaotheo wa Repabliki ya Afrika Borwa wa..  Molao hlaloša ditshepetšo tšeo di swanetšwego go latelwa mo go thwaleng ga bahlankedi ba mmasepala maemong godimo.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the signed into law the Local Government Municipal Systems Amendment Act, 2022 (Act 3 of 2022) by President Cyril Ramaphosa.
tgt_text: Bjale ga sa dumela gore bahlenkedibagolo ba mmušo ba sware gape maemo godimo mo mekgatlong ya dipolotiki.

src_text: The Act aims to improve the capacity and ethical standards of local government.
tgt_text: Se sengwe gape ke gore ge molao wo tsene tirišong, diposo tša bolaodi bja mmasepala tšeo di se tlatšwago di swanetše go kwalakwatšwa nageng ka bophara go goka batho ba bantši bao ba nago le maswanedi.

src_text: The law forms part of government’s efforts to professionalise the Public Service and ensure the sustainable provision of services to the people, as basic right enshrined in the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of..
tgt_text: Kabinete tshepa gore diphetogo tše di tla kgonthiša gore bao ba thwetšwego goba ba kgethilwego mo maemong ba tla kgona go phethagatša ditshepišo tša bona gore re fihlelele bophelo bjo bobotse go batho ka moka.

src_text: The Act specifies the processes to be followed for senior position appointments.
tgt_text: Bosenyi.

src_text: It now prevents senior public officials from holding political office in political parties.
tgt_text: Kabinete retile bahlenkedi ba metšhelo ba Tirelo ya Metšhelo ya Afrika Borwa ka go thopa seokobatši sa crystal meth seo ge se rekiša ka bago R236 milione mo Boemafofaneng bja Boditšhabatšhaba bja OR Tambo ka Lamorena, 28 Phato.

src_text: Also with this Act in place, vacant municipal manager posts are expected to be advertised nationally to attract wide pool of suitable candidates..
tgt_text: Go thopša ga seokobatši go tla romela temošo ye maatla go dihlopha tša basenyi gore matseno le matšo maemafofane rena šireleditšwe gabotse gomme bahlankedi ba rena ba šoma ka maatla go fediša bosenyi bofe goba bofe  Diphetho tša Kabinete.

src_text: Cabinet is confident that these changes will ensure that those who are appointed or elected into these positions will be able to deliver on their promises so that we can achieve better life for all.
tgt_text: Pego ya Khansele ya Thuto ya Godimo (CHE) ya Nyakišišo ya Megolo ya Batlatšabakhanseliri ba Diyunibesithi le Baolaodibagolophethiši ka Afrika Borwa.

src_text: Crime.
tgt_text: Kabinete tsebišitšwe ka dipoelo tša nyakišišo ya CHE yeo dumeletšwego ka 2020 ke Tona ya Thuto ya Godimo, Saense le Kaonafatšo, Ngaka Blade Nzimande, go lekola magato megolo le mekgwa ya go phela ya bahlenkediphethiši ba yunibesithi mo nakong ya mengwaga ye 15 go tloga ka 2005 go fihla ka..  Dinyakišišo be le tša go utolla go swarelela, kgonagalo le kaonafatšo ya diyunibesithi goba lekala la thuto ya godimo ka mo nageng.

src_text: Cabinet commended the South African Revenue Service’s customs officials for seizing 785 kg of crystal meth with street value of R236 million at the OR Tambo International Airport on Sunday, 28 August.
tgt_text: Pego ye akaretša dikutollo tša motheo gammogo le maele tukišo ao akantšwego.

src_text: The drug bust will send clear warning to criminal syndicates that our ports of entry and exit are well protected and our officers are working hard to stamp out any criminality   Cabinet decisions.
tgt_text: Maele akanya, gare ga tše dingwe, tshepetšo ya ditefo ya go se khutiše selo yeo matlafaditšego.

src_text: Report of the Council on Higher Education (CHE) Enquiry into the Remuneration of University Vice Chancellors and Senior Executive Managers in South Africa.
tgt_text: Go beakanya mokgatlo wa taolo wa ka ntle wa go ikema go lebelela tshepetšo ya go tšea sephetho sa megolo akanya gape go matlafatša mananeo tekolo ya phethagatšo mo diinstitušeneng.

src_text: Cabinet was briefed on the outcomes of the CHE enquiry that was commissioned in 2020 by the Minister of Higher Education, Science and Innovation, Dr Blade Nzimande, to examine the remuneration levels and trends of the university executives over the 15-year period from 2005 to..
tgt_text: Dinyakišišo di lebeletše gape bogolo bja go fapana bja diinstitušene gape dirile gape papetšo ya boditšhabatšhaba.

src_text: The investigation was to establish the sustainability, viability and development of the universities or higher education sector in the country.
tgt_text: Go letetšwe gore Tona ya Thuto ya Godimo, Saense le Kaonafatšo boledišane ka pego ye le boetapele bja yunibesithi bjalo ka magato go matlafatša diinstitušene tše tša thuto.

src_text: This report outlines the key findings together with proposed remedial recommendations..
tgt_text: Pego tla re ka morago ya phatlalatšwa wepsaeteng ya Kgoro ya Thuto ya Godimo le Tlhahlo: www.dhet.gov.za.

src_text: The recommendations propose, amongst others strengthened and more transparent remuneration process.
tgt_text: Phetošo ye Potlakišitšwego ya Bokgoni bja Dinyakišišo le Go ruta mo Lekaleng la Thuto ya Godimo.

src_text: The setting up of an external and independent oversight structure to oversee the decision-making process of remunerations.
tgt_text: Kabinete thekgile maele dinyakišišo tše pedi tšeo di dirilwego go eletša ka magato ao swanetšwego go tšewa go potlakiša go bokgoni bja phetošo ya dinyakišišo le go ruta mo diinstitušeneng tša thuto ya godimo.

src_text: It also proposes the strengthening of the performance evaluation systems in the institutions.
tgt_text: Pego ya mathomo dirilwe ke Sehlophatšhomo sa Ditona seo se nyakišišago mapheko ao thibelago kalatšo, go swarelela le tšwelopele ya dirutegi tša maAfrika Borwa bathobaso.

src_text: The study has also taken into account the various sizes of these institutions and it also did international benchmarking.
tgt_text: Pego ya bobedi – yeo dirilwego ke Kgoro ya Saense le Kaonafatšo le Setheo sa Dinyakišišo sa Setšhaba – Mokgatlo wa Diyunibesithi wa Afrika Borwa, mokgatlo wo mogolo wa go emela diyunibesithi tše 26 ka mo nageng.

src_text: The Minister of Higher Education, Science and Innovation is expected to discuss this report with the university leadership as measure to strengthen these academic institutions.
tgt_text: Dipego tše ka moka di akanya mekgwa ya go tsena gare go potlakiša phetogo mo dikarolong tše dikgolo tše hlano lego tatelano ya dialogadigolwane; go kgatha tema ga bašomi; setšo le tirišo ya institušene; pholisi le mekgwa, le methopo ye mennyane.

src_text: The report will thereafter be published in the Department of Higher Education and Training’s website: www.dhet.gov.za.
tgt_text: Tumelelano ya Boditšhabatšhaba ka ga Methopo ya Leabela la Dimela tša Dijo le Temo (Tumelelano).

src_text: Accelerated Transformation of the Research and Teaching Capacity in the Higher Education Sector.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go išwa ga Tumelelano ya Palamente gore hwetšagale.

src_text: Cabinet supported the recommendations of the two studies that were commissioned to advise on the measures to be put in place so as to accelerate the transformation of research and teaching capacity in the institutions of higher learning.
tgt_text: Se se tla kgontšha Afrika Borwa go ba karolo ya mekgatlo ya Tumelelano, yeo hlahlago maloko dinaga go šireletša le go kgonthiša tšhomišo ya go swarelela ya methopo ya leabela la dimela tša dijo le temo.

src_text: The first report was done by the Ministerial Task Team which investigated the blockages that prevent the recruitment, retention and progression of black South African academics.
tgt_text: Go fihlelela Tumelelano ye go tla matlafatša boikgafo bja naga mo go bolokeng le go swareleleng tšhomišo ya methopo ya leabela la dimela, le go fa thekgo go ditšhaba tša magaeng.

src_text: The second report – commissioned by the Department of Science and Innovation and the National Research Foundation – was done by Universities South Africa, the umbrella body representative of the 26 public universities in the country.
tgt_text: Tlhako ya Phetogo ye Botse ya Afrika Borwa.

src_text: Both these reports proposes intervention strategies to accelerate transformation in five broad areas, namely in postgraduate pineline; staff participation; institutional culture and practice; policy and the strategy, and limited resources.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše gore Tlhako ya Phetogo ye Botse ya Afrika Borwa phethagatšwe.
Tlhako tšweletša pono ya go abelana ya Afrika Borwa ya go kwagala, ya klaemete ye maatla hlaloša melao le dikarolo tša pholisi go fihlelela se.

src_text: International Treaty on Plant Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture (the Treaty).
tgt_text: Tlhako ya phetogo tla huetša mang le mang ka Afrika Borwa, gomme ya fa sebaka sa go šogana le go se lekalekane ga kgale le go hlola ekonomi ye holago batho ka moka.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the Treaty to Parliament for accession.
tgt_text: Khomišene ya Klaemete ya Mopresidente dirile mokgwa wa poledišano wo mogolo le badirišani ba leago gomme ya amogela thekgo ye kgolo ya tlhako.

src_text: This will enable South Africa to form part of the parties to this Treaty, which guides the member countries in conserving and ensuring the sustainable usage of the plant genetic resources for food and agriculture.
tgt_text: Kabinete kgonthišitše gore phetogo go tloga go ekonomi ye se nago khapone ka 2050 swanetše go thekga maikemišetšo tlhabollo ya setšhaba, go akaretša mešomo ye mekaone go batho ka moka, kakaretšo ya leago le go fedišwa ga bohloki.

src_text: Acceding to this Treaty will also strengthen the country’s commitment towards conservation and sustainable use of plant genetic resources, and provide support to rural communities.
tgt_text: Kabinete ipiletša go badirišani ka moka ba leago go thekga le go amogela tlhako ye.

src_text: Just Transition Framework for South Africa.
tgt_text: Leano la phethagatšo leo le tletšego la tlhako le tla dirwa, gomme le tla kopanywa le peakanyo ya mmušo le lenaneo la tekanyetšo.

src_text: Cabinet approved the Just Transition Framework for implementation.
tgt_text: Karata ya Laesense ya go Otlela ye Mpsha ya Afrika Borwa.

src_text: The framework presents shared vision for an equitable, climate-resilient South Africa.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše gore Karata ya Laesense ya go Otlela ya gonabjale tšeelwe legato ke ye mpsha ya go ba le dibopego tša go bolokega kudu.

src_text: It defines the principles and policy areas to achieve this.
tgt_text: Karata ye šomišwago gonabjale thomile go šomišwa go tloga ka.

src_text: The transition framework will impact everyone in South Africa, and provides an opportunity to address historical inequities and creates an economy that benefits all.
tgt_text: Theknolotši fetogile gomme go bitša tšhelete ye ntši go hlokomela dikarata tše.

src_text: The Presidential Climate Commission conducted an extensive consultation process with social partners and received broad support for the framework.
tgt_text: Karata ye mpsha ye tla šomišwago tla dira gore laesense ya naga ya rena ya go otlela sepelelane le Theknolotši ya Boditšhaba ya go Obamela Tshedimošo ya Boitsebišo bja Motho mo Laesenseng ya go Otlela (ISO18013).

src_text: Cabinet affirmed that the shift to net-zero carbon economy by 2050 must support national development aspirations, including decent work for all, social inclusion and the eradication of poverty.
tgt_text: Pholisi ya Lenaneo la Mešomo ya Setšhaba ye Katološitšwego (EPWP).

src_text: Cabinet has called on all social partners to rally behind and embrace this framework detailed implementation plan for the framework will be developed, and it will be integrated into the government planning and budgeting system.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go phatlalatšwa ka kuranteng ya setšhaba Pholisi ya EPWP ye akantšwego gore setšhaba se swayeswaye.

src_text: New South African Driving Licence Card.
tgt_text: EPWP ke ye nngwe ya mananeo motheo mmušo ao maikemišetšo lego go fa kimollo go bohloki le letseno ka go hlola dibaka tša mešomo ya nakwana, kudu go bafsa le basadi.

src_text: Cabinet approved the replacement of the current Driving Licence Card to one with more secure design features..
tgt_text: Pholisi ye mpsha ye akantšwego tla matlafatša lenaneo gomme ya hlaloša dikarolo tša go swana le megolo, mmotlolo wa thekgo ya ditšhelete le tšhireletšo ya leago, ya nyalantšha EPWP le ditirišo tša mešomo tše diswa tla godiša ditirišano gare ga mmušo le lekala la praebete mo go kgonthišeng gore EPWP kgatha tema kudu mo go hloleng mešomo ya seriti le go fokotša bohloki.

src_text: The current system has been in operation since.
tgt_text: Pholisi tla godiša gape kaonafatšo mo go phethagatšeng ga mananeo mešomo ya setšhaba go phatlalala le naga.

src_text: The technology has since evolved and it is becoming expensive to maintain the current infrastructure.
tgt_text: Dimpshafatšo tša Mohlwaela wa Khoine ya Desimale ya Bone ya Afrika Borwa.

src_text: The new proposed card will make the country’s driving licence compatible with the International Information Technology Personal Identification Compliant Driving Licence (ISO18013).
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše sebopego, moakanyetšo le kgoboketšo ya Mohlwaela wa Khoine ya Desimale ya Bone ya Afrika Borwa dumeletše lenaneo la go šielana la ngwaga le ngwaga la tšhomišo ya dipolelo tša semmušo mo go mohlwaela wa khoine ya desimale ya bone.

src_text: Expanded Public Works Programme (EPWP) Policy.
tgt_text: Lentšu “Afrika Borwa” le tla tsenywa ka lehlakoreng le lengwe la dikhoine gomme la gatišwa ka dipolelo ka moka tša semmušo.

src_text: Cabinet approved the gazetting of the draft EPWP Policy for public consultation.
tgt_text: Dipolelo tše tharo di tla šomišwa go khoine ya R5; dipolelo tše pedi go dikhoine tša R2; 50c, 20c le 10c gomme R1 tla ba ka polelo tee.

src_text: The EPWP is one of government's key programmes aimed at providing poverty and income relief by creating temporary work opportunities, particularly for youth and women..
tgt_text: Dipolelo tše ka moka di tla šomišwa ka go šielana mo mengwageng ye.

src_text: The draft new policy will strengthen the programme and provide clarity on aspects such as wages, funding model and social protection, and also align the EPWP with modern labour practices.
tgt_text: Pholisi ya 2022 ye Kopantšwego ya Taolo ya Boleng bja Meetse ye Akanywago.

src_text: It will promote partnerships between government and the private sector toward ensuring the EPWP contributes massively towards the creation of decent work and alleviation of poverty.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go phatlalatšwa ka kuranteng ya mmušo ga Pholisi ya IWQM ye Akanywago gore setšhaba se swayeswaye.

src_text: The policy will also promote innovation in the implementation of public works programmes across the country..
tgt_text: Pholisi ye akantšwego tla ema legato la Pholisi ya WQM ya kgale ya 1991 le mokgwa wa yona wo beakantšwego ka..  Pholisi hlaloša sehlopha sa melao yeo dirago motheo wa taolo ya boleng bja meetse sepelelana le melao ka moka ye lebanego le meetse le maikgafo ka moka lefase naga go maemo le pabalelo ya meetse bjalo ka mothopo wo hlokegago.

src_text: Amendments to the Fourth Decimal Coin Series of South Africa.
tgt_text: Pholisi ya Mehuta ya Boipoeletšo bja Radio ya Moloko wa go Latela ye Akanywago.

src_text: Cabinet has approved the dimension, design and compilation of the year 2023 Fourth Decimal Coin Series of South Africa.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše go phatlalatšwa ga Pholisi ya Mehuta ya Boipoeletšo bja Radio ya Moloko wa go Latela ye Akanywago gore setšhaba se swayeswaye.

src_text: It approved the annual rotational system of the usage of the official languages on the fourth decimal coin series.
tgt_text: Boipoeletšo bja Radio ke mothopo wa tlhago wo monnyane woo lego bohlokwa go kgolo ya ekonomi ya titšitale ya Afrika Borwa le infrastraktšha ya kgokagano.

src_text: The word “South Africa” will be inserted on the one side of the coins and printed in all the official languages.
tgt_text: Pholisi ye akantšwego ikemišeditše go thekga go abelwa ga mehuta ya  dilaesense tša go fihlelela megala ya go thetha ya go se šute, dilaesense tša kgašo, tša mananeokgoparara dikgokagano tša difofane le tša dikepe; tša dinyakišišo le tlhabollo; tša mananeokgoparara go šomišwa ke setšhaba, le diintasteri tše dingwe tša maleba.

src_text: Three languages will be used in the R5 coin; two languages R2; 50c, 20c and 10c coins and the R1 will be in one language.
tgt_text: Pholisi nyaka gape go godiša tekatekano le kabo ya go kwagala go kgatha tema mo phetošong ya lekala le phihlelelo ya kgokagano ya titšitale le mo go dikarolo tša kgole tša naga.

src_text: All these languages will be used on an annual rotational basis over the next 10 years.
tgt_text: Kgopelo ya Afrika Borwa ya Khansele ya Mokgatlo wa Kgokagano ya Boditšhabatšhaba (ITU) le Boto ya Melawana ya Radio.

src_text: Draft Integrated Water Quality Management (IWQM) Policy of.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše kgopelo ya Morena Mandla Samuel Mchunu go Boto ya Melawana ya Radio ya ITU (Selete sa .

src_text: Cabinet approved the gazetting of the Draft IWQM Policy for public consultation.
tgt_text: Morena Mchunu gonabjale ke leloko la boto akanyeditšwe go kgethwa gape mo Khanseleng ya ITU go kotara ya 2023 go fihla ka..  Dikgetho di tla swarwa nakong ya Khonferense ya Baemedi ba ITU yeo tla swarwago Bucharest, Romania go tloga ka la 26 Lewedi go fihla ka la 14 Diphalane.

src_text: The proposed policy will replace the outdated WQM Policy of 1991 and its strategy that was put in place in.
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa dula ikgafile go dinepo le maikemišetšo ITU go kgokaganya karoganyo ya titšitale le go kgokaganya batho ka moka ba lefase  Ditiragalo tše di Tlago.
Kgwedi ya Bohwa.

src_text: The policy outlines set of principles that will form the basis for water quality management.
tgt_text: Kgwedi ya Bohwa ya Lewedi ngwaga wo tla ketekwa ka fase ga morero: “Go keteka Bohwa bja Solomon Linda le Mmino wa Setšo wa Afrika Borwa”.

src_text: It provides an alignment to all the relevant water-related legislation and the country’s global commitments to the provision and conservation of water as scarce resource.
tgt_text: Kabinete hlohleletša maAfrika Borwa ka moka go šomiša Kgwedi ya Bohwa go keteka bohwa bja rena bja setšo bja go huma le phapano yeo nago le maatla go kopanya setšhaba.

src_text: Draft Next Generation Radio Frequency Spectrum Policy.
tgt_text: Ka moka re swanetše go ikgafa go šoma mmogo go fediša dikarologanyo le go hloka toka ga nako ya go feta le go godiša temogo ya go ikgantšha ka go ba maAfrika Borwa  Melaetša.

src_text: Cabinet approved the publication of the draft Next Generation Radio Frequency Spectrum Policy for public comment.
tgt_text: DitebogišoKabinete lebogiša le go lakaletša tše dibotse go:Bathopasefoka ka moka, bathopa dimetale le baphadišani bao ba kgathilego tema mo Lebelong la Comrades, leo le tsebegago bjalo ka “Lebelo la Batho la go Phala ka Moka, ka Lamorena, 28 Phato.

src_text: Radio frequency spectrum is finite natural resource that is vital to the growth of South Africa’s digital economy and communication infrastructure.
tgt_text: Lebelo la banna le thopilwe ke Tete Dijane (Diiri tše 5, metsotso ye 30, metsotswana ye 38) go tšwa Mahikeng ka Leboa Bodikela mola mokitimi wa Russia Alexandra Morozova thopile lebelo la basadi (Diiri tše 6, metsotso ye 17, metsotswana ye 47).

src_text: The proposed policy intends to support the spectrum allocation and licensing for fixed mobile; broadcasting; aeronautical and marine; research and development; community access, and other relevant industries.
tgt_text: MahlokoKabinete romela melaetša ya mahloko go:Mama Rita Alice Ndzanga (88), molwelatokologo wa kgale yoo bego le moamogedi wa Sefoka sa Setšhaba sa Luthile ka 2004 ka “go kgatha tema ga gagwe mo go lweleng tokologo ya ditokelo tša bašomi le temogo go go se kgetholle ka mmala, ka bong, le Afrika Borwa ye lokologilego ya toka”.Bahlenkedi ba Ditirelo tša Maphodisa Afrika Borwa (SAPS) ba bahlano bao bego le banamedi ba sefofane sa SAPS seo se welego Boemafofaneng bja Rand, Germiston ka Labobedi, 30 Phato.

src_text: The policy also seeks to promote equity and fair allocation to contribute towards the transformation of the sector and accessibility of digital connectivity even in outlying parts of the country.
tgt_text: SAPS nyakišiša seo se hlotšego go wa ga sona.

src_text: South Africa’s Candidature for the International Telecommunication Union ( ITU) Council and Radio Regulations Board.
tgt_text: Kabinete lakaletša mofofiši yoo gobetšego kudu gore fole ka pela  Bao ba Thwetšwego Mešomong.

src_text: Cabinet approved South Africa’s candidature of Mr Mandla Samuel Mchunu to the ITU Radio Regulations Board (Region .
tgt_text: Batho ka moka bao ba thwetšwego mešomong mangwalo bona dithuto tla tiišetšwa le go netefatšwa ka maleba  Mohumagadi Gugulethu Abigail Thimane bjalo ka Motlatšamolaodimogophethiši (DDG):Tekolo ya Lekala la Mmušo le Tlhabollo ya Bokgoni ka go Kgoro ya Peakanyo, Tekodišišo le Tshekatsheko ya Phethagatšo ya Mošomo  Mohumagadi Kwena Komape bjalo ka DDG: Tlhabollo ya Ekonomi, Kgwebo le Papatšo ka go Kgoro ya Temo, Peakanyoleswa ya Naga le Tlhabollo ya Dinagamagae  Ngaka Bongani Elias Sithole bjalo ka DDG: Senthara ya Taolo ya Masetlapelo Setšhaba mo Kgorong ya Pušotirišano.

src_text: Issues in the Environment.
tgt_text: Mohlagase.

src_text: Energy.
tgt_text: Tona ya Dikgwebo tša Mmušo Pravin Gordhana begetše kabinete ka bokgoni bja Eskom bja go fokotša go kgaotšwa ga mohlagase ga nako le nako gape filwe pego ya seo se šetšwego se dirilwe go tšwa Komiting ya Semmušo ya Komiti ya Mathata Mohlagase ya Setšhaba.

src_text: Cabinet was briefed by Public Enterprises Minister Pravin Gordhan on the capacity of Eskom to mitigate the intermittent load-shedding and also received progress report from the Technical Committee of the National Energy Crisis Committee.
tgt_text: Go tla dirwa ditsebišo tše dingwe go latela go phethwa ga dipoledišano tša go tsenelela tša dipego tše.

Kabinete tšweleditše manyami ka tšhitišo le mathata ao hlolwago ke go kgaolwa ga mohlagase go dikgwebo le magae, kudu di direga ka nako yeo mmušo swaraganego le ditsenogare tšeo di tsebišitšwego ke Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa ka Mosegamanye.

src_text: Further announcements will be made following the conclusion of the intensive deliberations of these reports.
tgt_text: Peeletšo.

src_text: Cabinet expressed regret at the disruption and inconvenience caused by load-shedding to businesses and households, particularly happening at the time when government is engaged with the interventions announced by the President in July.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogela go thakgolwa ga Lefelo le lefsa la Tšweletšo la Sandvik Khomanani ka Kempton Park, leo bego le karolo ya peeletšo ya R350 milione yeo tshepišitšwego mo Khonferenseng ya bone ya Dipeeletšo ya Afrika Borwa (SAIC) yeo bego swerwe Senthareng ya Dikopano ya Sandton ka Johannesburg ka la 24 Hlakola..  Mothopo wo mofsa wa dikwere metara tše 62 000 kopanya ditshepetšo tšeo di thomilwego pele mo mafelong go fapana mahlano gomme di akaretša bašomi bao ka bago ba.

Ke ye nngwe ya methopo ye megolo go feta ka moka ya Sandvik gape ya maemo godimo lefaseng ka moka, gomme na le bokgoni bja go tšweletša metšhene ya go laiša ya ka fase ga mabu ya go ba le ditšweletšwa tša Afrika Borwa tša 60%.

src_text: Investment.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogela gape ketelo ya tekolo ya Mopresidente Ramaphosa ka KwaZulu-Natal nakong ya thakgolo ya mothopo wa tšweletšo wa Hesto Harnesses ka Stanger, KwaDukuza ka la 13 Lewedi.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the launch of the new Sandvik Khomanani Manufacturing Site in Kempton Park, which was part of the R350-million investment pledged at the fourth South Africa Investment Conference (SAIC) held at the Sandton Convention Centre in Johannesburg on 24 March..
tgt_text: Mothopo wo ke wo mongwe wa diprotšeke tša dipeeletšo tša tšhelete tše hlano tšeo di dirago karolo ya boikgafo bja  4 bilione bja Metair Investments Limited go thekga katološo le go dira Ford Ranger ye mpsha ya gae.

src_text: The new 62 000 square-metre facility consolidates operations previously undertaken at five separate sites and accommodates about 550 employees.
tgt_text: Mopresidente tsenetše gape go bulwa ga mpshafatšo le katološo ya protšeke ya Sappi Saiccor Mill ye bitšago R7,7 bilione ka Umkomaas, yeo maikemišetšo yona lego go godiša bokgoni le katlego ya lefase ya khamphani mola ka go le lengwe hlola dibaka tša mošomo tša nako ye kopana le nako ye telele.

src_text: It is one of Sandvik’s biggest and most advanced facilities globally, and has the ability to produce underground loaders with over 60% South African content..
tgt_text: Dipeeletšo tše di dira karolo ya maikano ao dirilwego ke boraintasteri mo SAIC.

src_text: Cabinet further welcomed the oversight visit by President Ramaphosa in KwaZulu-Natal during the launch of the Hesto Harnesses manufacturing facility in Stanger, KwaDukuza on 13 September.
tgt_text: Peeletšo ye nngwe le ye nngwe ye mpsha ka nageng ya rena thuša go kagolefsa le kaonafatšo ya ekonomi ya rena, gomme tšwela pele go akaretša Afrika Borwa bjalo ka nepo ya peeletšo ya kgetho.

src_text: This facility is one of five capital investment projects that form part of R. 4-billion commitment by Metair Investments Limited to support the expansion and localisation of the new Ford Ranger.
tgt_text: Tlhabollo ya infrastraktšha.

src_text: The President also attended the opening of the Sappi Saiccor Mill upgrade and expansion project worth R7,7 billion in Umkomaas, which is aimed at increasing the capacity and global competitiveness of the company while also creating short- and long-term employment opportunities..
tgt_text: Kabinete amogela go bulwa ga karolo ye mpsha ya Tsela ya Manyokenyoke ya Musina ka Limpopo yeo tla dirago gore go be bonolo go batho go sepela ka Musina, gomme ya dumelela gape mešongwana ya kgwebo le ekonomi gare ga Afrika Borwa le dinaga tša Ditšhaba tša Tlhabollo tša Borwa bja Afrika.

src_text: These investments form part of pledges made by industrialists at the SAIC.
tgt_text: Protšeke ya R640 milione hlotše mešomo ye 275 ya go ya go ile ya batho ba gae gomme ya aba dibaka go ditšhaba tša gae le dikgwebo tše dinnyane le tše dikgolo gammogo le dikgwebopotlana (di-SMME).

src_text: Every new investment into our country assists in the reconstruction and recovery of our economy, and continues to profile South Africa as an investment destination of choice.
tgt_text: Go agwa ga Tsela ya Manyokenyoke ya Musina ke karolo ya lenaneo la infrastraktšha ya mmušo, ka ERRP, yeo nyakago go hlola kgolo ya kakaretšo le dibaka tša mešomo go phatlalala le makala le ditšhaba.

src_text: Infrastructure development.
tgt_text: Masetlapelo Jagersfontein.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the opening of the new section of the Musina Ring Road in Limpopo that will make it easier for people to move around Musina, and also allow for increased trade and economic activity between South Africa and the Southern African Development Community countries.
tgt_text: Kabinete rometše melaetša ya mahloko go malapa bao ba lahlegetšwego ke maphelo bona ka morago ga tirigalo ya masetlapelo ya go palega le go tšhologa ga leraga mo moepong wa selegae wo tlogetšwego sa šome ka Jagersfontein ka Freistata mo maseng Lamorena, 11 Lewedi.

src_text: The R640-million project created over 275 full-time jobs for locals and provided opportunities for local communities and small, medium and micro enterprises (SMMEs)..
tgt_text: Masetlapelo tlogetše gape infrastraktšha ya selegae, dithoto tša batho tša go swana le dikoloi le magae mmalwa senyegile kudu.

src_text: The construction of the Musina Ring Road is part of government’s infrastructure programme, through the ERRP, that seeks to create inclusive growth and employment opportunities across various sectors and communities.
tgt_text: Nakong ya ketelo ya gagwe mo lefelong la masetlapelo ka Mošupologo, 12 Lewedi 2022, Mopresidente Ramaphosa lebogile maitapišo go phološa le go hwetša batho le dithoto ao dirilwego mo lefelong la masetlapelo ikanne gape gore mmušo tla fa thekgo yeo hlokegago go badudi bao ba amegilego ba Jagersfontein.

src_text: Jagersfontein disaster.
tgt_text: Kabinete hlohleletšwa ke gore beng ba moepo ba re ba ikemišeditše go aba thušo ye hlokegago le thekgo go mmušo ge ka kgopelwa ke Khansele ya Diminirale ya Afrika Borwa.

src_text: 1 Cabinet expressed its sincere condolences to the families of those who lost their lives after the tailings of an abandoned local mine in Jagersfontein in the Free State burst open and released disastrous mudslide around dawn on Sunday, 11 September.
tgt_text: Intasteri ya meepo dula le mothekgi yo bohlokwa wa ekonomi ka go thwala thwii goba go se thwale thwii, megolo ya kišontle, le peeletšo ya thwii ya dinaga tša ka ntle, gomme kgatha tema ye bohlokwa mo go kaonafatšeng maphelo ditšhaba tša meepong.

src_text: The disaster also left the local infrastructure, personal properties such as vehicles and several homes severely damaged.. 2 During his visit to the disaster area on Monday, 12 September 2022, President Ramaphosa expressed appreciation for the rescue and recovery efforts being undertaken in the area.
tgt_text: Mmušo le mekgatlo ye mengwe yeo sego ya mmušo ba tsene ka bogare ka bjako ka go fa batho bao ba amegilego madulo nakwana tšhoganetšo, thobamatswalo ya kgatelelo ya monagano le letšhogo le dilo tšeo di hlokegago go swana le mapai, materase le diphuthelwana tša dijo.

src_text: He also pledged that government will provide the necessary support to the affected residents of Jagersfontein.
tgt_text: Kabo ya meetse le mohlagase mo lefelong bušeditšwe sekeng.

src_text: Cabinet is encouraged that the owners of the mine have said that they are ready to provide technical assistance and support to the government should it be requested by the Minerals Council South Africa.
tgt_text: Go letetšwe gore dientšenere di dire tekolo ya dibopego tša dintlo, ge lefelo la masetlapelo le hlwekišitšwe.

src_text: 3 The mining industry remains significant contributor to the economy through direct and indirect employment, export earnings, and foreign direct investment, and plays crucial role in improving the lives of people in mining communities.
tgt_text: Kabinete leboga ditirelo tša tšhoganetšo, mekgatlo ya setšhaba ya segae le maloko setšhaba ka tema yeo ba kgathilego ye kgolo le thušo yeo ba filego batšwasehlabelo.

src_text: 4 Government and some non-governmental organisations intervened urgently by providing emergency shelter, trauma counselling and basic provisions such as blankets, mattresses and food parcels.
tgt_text: Ekonomi.

src_text: Water supply and electricity in the area have since been restored.
tgt_text: Kabinete tšweleditše maemo ekonomi ka nageng ka morago ga ge dipalolopalo tša kgauswanyane tša Kgoro ya Dipalopalo ya Afrika Borwa (Stats SA) di bontšha gore palomoka ya tšweletšo ya gae (GDP) ya kotara ya bobedi ya 2022 fokotšegile ka 0,7%.
Dilo tšeo di hueditšego phokotšego ye di akareditše kgaotšo ya mohlagase, ntwa ya Russia le Ukraine, le maemo go phela go bitša tšhelete ye ntši le inflešene.

src_text: 5 Once the disaster site has been cleaned up, technicians are expected to undertake structural assessments of houses.
tgt_text: Ditsenogare tšeo di dirilwego ke Leano la Kaonafatšo le Kagolefsa ya Ekonomi (ERRP) di fokoditše kudu naga go dikhuetšo tša boditšhabatšhaba, gape tša šireletša mešomo le letseno.

src_text: Cabinet thanked emergency services, civil-society organisations and members of the public for their generous contributions and assistance.
tgt_text: Ditsenogare tše maatla tša ekonomi tša mmušo di thoma go tšweletša dipoelo tše dibotse, bjale ka ge go hlatsetšwe ka go dipoelo tša Dinyakišišo tša Bašomi tša Kotara ye nngwe le ye nngwe tša Stats SA, tšeo di bontšhitšego gore go bile le mešomo ye 648 000 mo kotareng ya mathomo le ya bobedi tša  Diphetho tša Kabinete.

src_text: Economy.
tgt_text: Tlhako ya Tlhahlobo le Tekolo (M&E) ya Pholisi ya Bafsa ya Setšhaba (NYP).

src_text: Cabinet deliberated on the state of the economy in the country after Statistics South Africa’s (Stats SA) recent figures showed that the gross domestic product (GDP) for the second quarter of 2022 decreased by 0,7%.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše tlhako ya M&E yeo tla kgontšhago tlhahlobo le kelo ya khuetšo ya dintlha tša bohlokwa tša NYP ya 2020-.

src_text: Factors which influenced this decrease included load-shedding, the Russia-Ukraine conflict, and the high cost of living and inflation.
tgt_text: Tlhako fa ditaetši tša legato la godimo tše hlano tšeo di sepelelanago le dintlha tša bohlokwa tša NYP.

src_text: The interventions made by the Economic Reconstruction and Recovery Plan (ERRP) have largely cushioned the country from the international headwinds, and also protected jobs and livelihoods.
tgt_text: Ditaetši di dirilwe le bakgathatema ba maleba bao ba nago le kgahlego mo tlhabollong le matlafatšong ya bafsa ka mo nageng.

src_text: Government’s strong economic interventions are beginning to bear fruit, as evidenced in Stats SA’s recent Quarterly Labour Force Survey results, which showed that over 648 000 jobs were gained between the first and second quarters of  Cabinet Decisions.
tgt_text: Tshedimošo tla kgoboketšwa ka go aroganywa ka dikarolo go ya ka mengwaga, bong, bogolofadi, sehlopha sa merafe le tikologo ya thutafase ya ditsenogare tše.

src_text: Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Framework for the National Youth Policy (NYP).
tgt_text: Dikgato tše tša go dira ditlhahlobo di tla dirwa ka mafelong ka moka mmušo, ka ditheong ka moka le lekaleng la praebete.

src_text: Cabinet approved the M&E framework that will enable the effective monitoring and impact assessment of the pillars of the NYP 2020-.
tgt_text: Dipego tša tšona di tla dirwa kotareng ye nngwe le ye nngwe gomme tša phatlalatšwa gabedi ka ngwaga.

src_text: The framework provides five high-level indicators which are aligned with the pillars of the NYP.
tgt_text: Tlhako ya Pholisi ya Peakanyo ye Kopantšwego.

src_text: The indicators were developed with the relevant stakeholders who have an interest in the development and empowerment of youth in the country.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše Tlhako ya Pholisi ya Peakanyo ye Kopantšwego ya mmušo, yeo nyakago go šogana le mafokodi peakanyo ya pholisi ao utollotšwego mo lenaneong la peakanyo la gonabjale.

src_text: The data collection will be disaggregated in terms of age, gender, disability, racial grouping and the geographic setting of these interventions..
tgt_text: Ditsenogare tšeo di šišintšwego di tla re gare ga tše dingwe tša šogana le tlhokego ya tlhopo ya peakanyo mo dikarolong tše tharo tša mmušo.

src_text: The monitoring will be done in all spheres of government, entities and the private sector.
tgt_text: Ditsenogare di tla tsebiša mokgwa wa tlhahlobo wo theilwego go bohlatse.

src_text: The reports will be generated quarterly and published twice year..  Policy Framework for Integrated Planning.
tgt_text: Tlhako ya pholisi tsebišitše gape kakanyo ye bonolo ka peakanyo ya nako ye telele go ya magareng le peakanyo ya nako ye kopana go phatlalala le mmušo tla šomela go thoma dimpshafatšo tša melao go kaonafatša kopano le kakanyo mo peakanyong le tlhahlobong ya mmušo.

src_text: Cabinet has approved the Policy Framework for Integrated Planning in government, which seeks to address the identified policy planning gaps in the current planning system.
tgt_text: Tumelelo ya Tumelelano ya go Thongwa ga Mokgatlo wa Dihlare tša Seafrika (AMA).

src_text: The proposed interventions will amongst others deal with the lack of planning alignment within the three spheres of government.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go saenwa ga Tumelelano ya go Thongwa ga AMA le go išwa ga yona Palamenteng go ka dumelelwa.

src_text: The interventions will introduce an evidence-based monitoring mechanism.
tgt_text: Se se tla phetha tumelelano yeo amogelwago ke Kopano ya Tumelelano ya Afrika ka.

src_text: The policy framework also introduces easier predictability with long to medium and short-term planning across government.
tgt_text: Tumelelano thoma semmušo AMA ya kontinente.

src_text: It will work towards introducing legislative reforms to improve coherency and predictability in government planning and monitoring..
tgt_text: Mokgatlo tla laola ditšweletšwa tša dihlare, gomme wa kaonafatša polokego le bokgoni bja ditšweletšwa tša dihlare ka kontinenteng.

src_text: Ratification of the Treaty for the Establishment of the African Medicines Agency (AMA).
tgt_text: Go saenwa le go dumelelwa ga tumelelano ye go tla kaonafatša boikgafo bja Afrika Borwa mo lefaseng le mo kontinenteng mo go matlafatšeng lenaneo la taolo ya kontinente mo go ditšweletšwa tša maphelo.

src_text: Cabinet approved the signing of the Treaty for the Establishment of the AMA and its submission to Parliament for ratification.
tgt_text: Pego ka ga Lenaneo la Tlhohleletšo ya Motšhelo la Phethagatšo ya Dinyakišišo le Tlhabollo (R&D) – 2019/20 le 2020/.

src_text: This will give effect to the treaty that was adopted by the African Union Assembly in.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go išwa ga Lenaneo la tlhohleletšo ya Motšhelo la R&D Palamenteng mo mengwageng ye mebedi ya go feta (2019/20 le 2020/21).

src_text: The treaty formally establishes the AMA for the continent.
tgt_text: Se se sepelelana le karolo ya 11D (17) ya Molao wa Motšhelo wa Letseno, wa 1962 (Molao wa 58 wa 1962), woo nyakago go alwa ga dipego tše ka Palamenteng.

src_text: The agency will regulate medical products, and improve the safety and efficacy of the medical products for the continent.
tgt_text: Lenaneo la tlhohleletšo ya motšhelo le nyaka go hlohleletša dikhamphani tša praebete go beeletša mo go R&D gore go hlohleletšwe kgolo ya ekonomi, le go godiša katlego.

src_text: The signing and ratifying of this treaty will advance South Africa’s global and continental commitment toward strengthening the continental regulatory system on its health products..  Report on the Performance of the Research and Development (R&D) Tax Incentive Programme – 2019/20 and 2020/.
tgt_text: Kabinete thabela gore pego bontšha gore dikhamphani tše difsa di dirile kgopelo ya tlhohleletšo ya motšhelo hlohleletša dikhamphani tše dintši go hwetša setlamo se bjalo ka karolo ya go godiša dipeeletšo tša bona le go hlohleletša kgolo ya ekonomi.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the R&D Tax incentive Programme for the past two years (2019/20 and 2020/21).
tgt_text: Dikhamphani tše nne tša godimo tšeo di hweditšego tlhohleletšo ya motšhelo di ka makaleng tshepetšo ya ditšweletšwa tša temo; kaonafatšo ya meepo; dikhemikhale, dibotsefatši, dihlare le elektrotheknikhale le Theknolotši ya Tshedimošo tšeo Kabinete di dumeletšego bjalo ka dikarolo tše bohlokwa mo Leanong la Katlego ya Pholisi ya Intasteri.

src_text: This is in line with section 11D (17) of the Income Tax Act, 1962 (Act 58 1962), which requires the tabling of these reports in Parliament.
tgt_text: Pego ka botlalo ka hwetšwa mo wepsaeteng ya Kgoro ya Saense le Kaonofatšo: www.dst.gov.za.

src_text: The tax incentive programme seeks to encourage private companies to invest in R&D so as to stimulate investment growth.
tgt_text: Foramo ya Molao wa Dibaka le Kgolo ya Afrika (AGOA) -.

src_text: It enables the advancement of science and innovation towards economic growth, and promotes competitiveness.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go swarwa ga Foramo ya AGOA ka.

src_text: Cabinet is pleased that the report shows that new companies have applied for the tax incentive.
tgt_text: AGOA dumeletšwe ke Amerika (USA) ka 2000 go fa phihlelelo ya go ikgetha ya kgwebo ya go ikema go bontši bja dinaga tša Afrika tša Borwa bja Sahara le mebaraka ya gae ya USA.

src_text: It encourages more companies to access this scheme as part of growing their respective investment and stimulating economic growth.
tgt_text: Dikišontle tša Afrika Borwa ka fase ga AGOA di akaretša dienywa tša go butšwa, dimake, dikoloi, didirišwa, tšhipi, setala le ditšweletšwa tša khemikhale.

src_text: The top-four companies that accessed the tax incentive are in agro-processing; mining beneficiation; chemicals, cosmetics, pharmaceutical and electro-technical and Information Technology sectors that Cabinet endorsed as priority areas in the Industrial Policy Action Plan.
tgt_text: Tšatšikgwedi la nnete le lefelo di sa tlo tsebišwa.

src_text: The full report can be accessed through the Department of Science and Innovation website: www.dst.gov.za..  African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA) Forum –.
tgt_text: Samiti ya Ditona ya Sehlopha sa Ditlhahlobo tša Lefase (GEO) –.

src_text: Cabinet has approved the hosting of the AGOA Forum in.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše gore Afrika Borwa sware Samiti ya Ditona ya GEO ka Motsekapa ka.

src_text: AGOA was enacted by the United States of America (USA) in 2000 to provide unilateral trade preferential access for most of the sub-Saharan African countries and the USA domestic market.
tgt_text: GEO ke mokgatlo wa mebušo ya boditšhabatšhaba woo hlomilwego ka 2003 ka morago ga Samiti ya Lefase ya Tlhabollo ya go Swarelela šoma bjalo ka sefala sa kopano moo dinaga di kgathago tema ka go ithaopa go fihlelela nepo ya go swana ya go aga mananeo GEO.

src_text: South Africa’s exports under AGOA include edible fruits, nuts, vehicles, auto components, iron, steel and chemical products.
tgt_text: Gonabjale GEO na le mebušo ya bosetšhaba ya go feta 113, ye 30 ya yona tšwago ka Afrika gomme mekgatlo ye ka bago 140 kgatha tema, gomme ye 11 ya yona tšwa Afrika.

src_text: The actual date and venue are still to be announced.
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa dutše le leloko la Komitiphethiši go tloga ka 2005 gomme boramahlale ba rena gonabjale ba kgatha tema mananeong dinyakišišo mmalwa ao etilwego pele ke GEO.

src_text: Group on Earth Observations (GEO) Ministerial Summit –.
tgt_text: Kgwedi ya Dinamelwa ya Diphalane (OTM) –.

src_text: Cabinet approved that South Africa hosts the GEO Ministerial Summit in Cape Town in.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go thakgolwa ga lesolo la OTM ka Mokibelo, 1 Diphalane 2022, ka fase ga morero: “Sishov’ingolovane: mmogo re aga infrastraktšha ya dinamelwa yeo agago mešomo ya go swarelela”.

src_text: The GEO is an intergovernmental body set up in 2003 after the 2002 World Summit on Sustainable Development.
tgt_text: OTM ya ngwaga le ngwaga šomišwa go godiša temošo ka dinamelwa bjalo ka dikarolo tše bohlokwa mo kgolong ya ekonomi le tlhabollo ya mahlakore mararo.

src_text: It serves as multilateral platform where countries voluntarily contribute towards common goal of building the GEO systems.
tgt_text: Go tla ba le ditiragalo tše mmalwa go bontšha dikarolo tše mmalwa tša infrastraktšha ya dinamelwa ka go difofane, dikepe, dinamelwa tša bohle le ditsela.

src_text: The GEO currently has more than 113 national governments, 30 of which are from Africa and about 140 participating organisations, with 11 of these from Africa.
tgt_text: Ditiragalo di lemoša gape ka polokego le tšhireletšo ya dinamelwa.

src_text: South Africa has been an active Executive Committee member since 2005 and our scientists are currently participating in number of research initiatives led through the GEO.
tgt_text: Go tla akaretšwa gape bakgathatema go boledišana ka ditlhohlo tša go fapana mo lekaleng la dinamelwa.

src_text: October Transport Month (OTM) –.
tgt_text: Mmušo dula ikgafile mo go kaonafatšeng infrastraktšha ya dinamelwa ya naga, bobedi mo mafelong segae le setoropong, gore go sepetšwe tshepelo ye botse gape ya bokgoni ya dithoto le batho.

src_text: Cabinet approved the launching of the OTM campaign on Saturday, 1 October 2022, under the theme: “Sishov’ingolovane: together building transport infrastructure that builds and sustains livelihoods”.
tgt_text: Kopano ya Lenaneo la Magae la Bodulo bja Batho (UN-HABITAT) la Kopanoditšhaba (UN).

src_text: The annual OTM is used to raise awareness on transport as one of the critical elements in economic growth and spatial development number of activities will take place to showcase the various aspects of transport infrastructure in aviation, maritime, public transport and roads.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go swarwa ga kopano ya maloko UN-HABITAT ka Johannesburg ka la 16 Diphalane..  Kgoro ya Bodulo bja Batho tla sepetša kopano ye ya matšatši mabedi yeo tla tsenelwago ke ditsebi tša dipolotiki, ditsebi le banyakišiši, go akaretša malokomagolo Komiti ya go ya go ile ya Baemedi ba UN-HABITAT bao ba lego Nairobi, Kenya.

src_text: The activities will also raise awareness regarding transport safety and security.
tgt_text: Ditaba tše bohlokwa tšeo go tla bolelwago ka tšona di tla akaretša ditsenogare tša phetogo go badudi ba mekhukhung le metsesetoropo go tlala kudu.

src_text: Stakeholder engagements will also be held to discuss various challenges in the transport sector.
tgt_text: Dipoelo tša dipoledišano tše di tla phethwa mo thakgolong ya Tlhako ya Leano la Katlego la Lefase, yeo tla alwago Kopanong ya UN-HABITAT gore dumelelwe ka  Melaokakanywa.

src_text: Government remains committed to improving the country’s transport infrastructure, both in rural and urban areas, so as to facilitate an effective and efficient movement of goods and people..  United Nations (UN) Human Settlement Programme Habitat (UN-HABITAT) Meeting.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywa wa Khansele ya Setšhaba ya Dikgaruru tša Bong le Dipolao tša Basadi le Bana (GBVF) wa.

src_text: Cabinet has approved the hosting of the meeting of the members of the UN-HABITAT in Johannesburg on 16 and 17 October.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go išwa ga Molaokakanywa wa Khansele ya Setšhaba ya 2021 Palamenteng gore go šoganwe le wona.

Molaokakanywa wo fa tlhako ya molao mo go hlongweng ga mokgatlo wa molao gore go be le tsenogare ye nepišago mo go šoganeng le GBVF dumelela gape go thongwa ga Boto ya Khansele yeo tla fago taolo yeo beakantšwego gomme ya laola phethagatšo ya Leano la Taolo ya Setšhaba ka ga GBVF, leo le dumeletšwego ke Kabinete ka Diphalane 2020 go phethagatšwa.

src_text: The Department of Human Settlements will coordinate this two-day meeting to be attended by political champions, practitioners and researchers, including key members of the Committee of Permanent Representatives of the UN-HABITAT based in Nairobi, Kenya.
tgt_text: Boto tla le kemedi ya 51 go tšwa go setšhaba sa gae le 49% go tšwa mmušong.

src_text: Key issues to be discussed will include seeking transformational interventions for informal settlements and slums..
tgt_text: Molaokakanywa šetše swayaswayilwe ke setšhaba.

src_text: The outcomes of these deliberations will culminate in the launching of the Global Action Plan Framework, which will be tabled in the UN-HABITAT Assembly for endorsement in  Bills.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywa wa Ditšweletšwa tša Motšoko le Didirišwa tša go Kgoga Motšoko tša Elektroniki wa.

src_text: National Council on Gender-Based Violence and Femicide (GBVF) Bill of.
tgt_text: Kabinete dumeletše go išwa palamenteng Ditshwayotshwayo tša Molaokakanywa wa Ditšweletšwa tša Motšoko le Didirišwa tša go Kgoga Motšoko tša Elektroniki wa 2018, tšeo di nyakago go phumola Molao wa gonabjale wa go Laola Ditšweletšwa tša Motšoko, (Molao wa 83 wa 1993) go ya le ka moo mpshafaditšwego ka gona.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the National Council on GBVF Bill of 2021 to Parliament for processing.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywa nyaka go matlafatša magato maphelo setšhaba naga gomme dire gore sepelelane le Tumelelano ya Tlhako ya Mokgatlo wa Maphelo Lefase ka ga Taolo ya Motšoko.

src_text: This Bill provides legislative framework for the establishment of the statutory body to provide focus intervention in dealing with GBVF.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywa šišinya gare ga tše dingwe, gore go se sa folelwa ka gare ga meago le mafelo mangwe ka ntle ga meago; go fedišwa ga thekišo ya sekerete mo metšheneng ya go rekiša, le go thekga taba ya diphuthelwana tša disekerete le maswao temošo.

src_text: It also provides for the establishment of the Board of the Council that will provide strategic leadership and oversee the implementation of the National Strategic Plan on GBVF, which was approved by Cabinet in October 2020 for implementation.
tgt_text: Molaokakanywa fetišitšwe dikgatong tša go tsenelela tša go nyaka maikutlo setšhaba go fapana, go akaretša intasteri ya metšoko mekgatlo ya badudi le dikgoro tša mmušo tša maleba  Ditiragalo tše di Tlago.

src_text: The board will have 51% representation from civil society and 49% from government.
tgt_text: Kopano ya bo 77 ya Kopanokakaretšo ya UN (UNGA77).

src_text: The Bill has already gone through public consultation..  Tobacco Products and Electronic Delivery Systems Control Bill of.
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa kgatha tema ka go UNGA77 yeo lego ka go dikantorokgolo tša UN ka Toropokgolong ya New York ka USA go tloga ka la 27 Lewedi 2022 ka fase ga morero: “Nako ya mathata: Go tšweletša ditharollo go kgokaganya ditlhohlo”.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the Tobacco Products and Electronic Delivery Systems Control Bill of 2018 to Parliament, which seeks to repeal the current Tobacco Products Control Act, 1993 (Act 83 of 1993), as amended.
tgt_text: Go Borwa bja lefase, khuetšo ya ekonomi le ekonomi ya leago ya leuba la Bolwetši bja Coronavirus (COVID-19) bile bothata kudu malebana le tsošološo go Leboa leo le hlabologilego gomme se se nyaka maitapišo ao kopanetšwego go tšwa dinageng ka moka go kgonthiša gore ga go na yoo tlogetšwego morago.

src_text: The Bill also seeks to strengthen the country’s public health measures and align them with the World Health Organisation Framework Convention on Tobacco Control.
tgt_text: Pele ga Ngangišano ya Kakaretšo ya UN, Mongwaledikakaretšo wa UN, Morena António Guterres tla beakanya samiti ka ga “Go fetoša Thuto” le go swara kopano ya maemo godimo yeo nepišago Dinepo tša Tlhabollo ya go Swarelela (di-SDG).

src_text: The Bill proposes, among others, 100% smoke-free indoor and some outdoor areas ban on the sale of cigarettes through vending machines, and strengthens cigarette packaging and warning signage.
tgt_text: Kopano ya di-SDG swanelwa ke go nyakišiša ditsela tšeo go ka tsošološago maatla le go potlakiša phethagatšo.

src_text: The Bill has gone through extensive consultation with various stakeholders, including the tobacco industry, civil-society organisations and relevant government departments  Upcoming Events.
tgt_text: Letšatši la Bohwa.

src_text: 77th Session of the UN General Assembly (UNGA77).
tgt_text: Mopresidente Ramaphosa tla fa polelokgolo mo meketekong ya Letšatši la Bohwa la Setšhaba mo Union Buildings ka Mokibelo, 24 Lewedi.

src_text: South Africa is participating in the UNGA77 taking place at the UN headquarters in New York City in the USA from 20 to 27 September 2022 under the theme: “A watershed moment: Unlocking transformative solutions to interlocking challenges”.
tgt_text: Moletlo tla swarwa ka fase ga morero: “Go keteka Bohwa bja Solomon Linda le Mmino wa Setšo wa Afrika Borwa”.

src_text: For the global South, the economic and socio-economic impact of the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) pandemic has been disproportionate in relation to recovery in the developed North and this requires united effort from all nations to ensure no one is left behind..
tgt_text: Kgwedi ye ya Bohwa nepiša mmino wa setšo wa Afrika Borwa ka nepišo ya mmino wa Isicathamiya le tema yeo ikgathago go dipapadi, bokgabo, setšo le bohwa.

src_text: Preceding the UN General Debate, the UN Secretary-General, Mr António Guterres, will convene summit on “Transforming Education” and host high-level meeting focusing on the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
tgt_text: Morero hlompha matswalo bo 60 go hlokofala ga rammino, seopedi le motšweletši Solomon Popoli Linda (1901-1962), yoo tsebegago gape bjalo ka Solomon Ntsele, yoo tsebegago kudu bjalo ka motšweletši wa koša ya, “Mbube”.

src_text: The SDGs meeting is expected to explore ways in which to regain momentum and accelerate their implementation.
tgt_text: Moletlo wa go Lebana wa Letšatši la Dikepe la.

src_text: Heritage Day.
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa tla be swara Moletlo wa go Lebana wa Letšatši la Dikepe la 2022 ka Durban go tloga ka la 14 Diphalane.

src_text: President Ramaphosa will deliver keynote address at the 2022 National Heritage Day celebrations at the Union Buildings on Saturday, 24 September.
tgt_text: Moletlo tla swarwa nakong ya OTM, woo le wona tla bago karolo ya go godiša tsebo ya lekala la rena la dikepe.

src_text: The event will be held under the theme: “Celebrating the Legacy of Solomon Linda and South Africa’s Indigenous Music”..
tgt_text: Moletlo tla tliša baemedi go tšwa dinageng tša go fapana bao ba tla itemogelang intasteri ya dikepe ya Afrika Borwa.

src_text: This year’s Heritage Month focuses on South Africa’s indigenous music with spotlight on isicathamiya music and its immense contribution to our sport, arts, culture and heritage.
tgt_text: Afrika Borwa bile leloko la Mokgatlo wa Dikepe wa Boditšhabatšhaba go tloga ka 1995, woo lego mokgatlo wa go ikgetha wa UN wa go laola dikepe.

src_text: The theme pays tribute to the 60th anniversary of the passing of musician, singer and composer Solomon Popoli Linda (1909-1962), also known as Solomon Ntsele, who is best known as the composer of the song, “Mbube”.
tgt_text: Kgwedi ya Boeti.

src_text: 2022 World Maritime Day Parallel Event .
tgt_text: Kgwedi ya Boeti ngwaga wo ketekwa ka fase ga morero wa Letšatši la Boeti la Lefase (27 Lewedi) wa “Nagana gape ka Boeti”.

src_text: South Africa will be hosting the 2022 World Maritime Day Parallel Event in Durban from 12 to 14 October.
tgt_text: Boeti bja gae bo bohlokwa kudu mo go tsošološeng lekala la boeti, leo le kgathago tema kudu go GDP ya Afrika Borwa le go hlola mošomo.

src_text: The event will be hosted during the OTM, which will also form part of raising awareness of our maritime sector.
tgt_text: Kabinete thabišwa ke gore lekala la kamogelo ya baeti le begile kgolo ya baeti ka morago ga nako ya COVID-.

src_text: The event will bring delegates from various countries who will experience the South African maritime industry.
tgt_text: Go tšerwe maeto gae  2 milione mo seripeng sa mathomo sa 2022 begile koketšego ya 114% ge go bapetšwa le nako ya go swana ka.

src_text: South Africa has been member of the International Maritime Organization since 1995, which is specialised agency of the UN responsible for regulating shipping..  Tourism Month.
tgt_text: Se se bontšha kaonafalo ya mmaraka ya nako ya go swana ka 2019, yeo bonego maeto ao tšerwego gae  6 milione.

src_text: Tourism Month is this year being celebrated under the theme of World Tourism Day (27 September) of “Rethinking Tourism”.
tgt_text: Bjalo ka karolo ya go keteka Kgwedi ya Boeti, Kabinete hlohleletša maAfrika Borwa go tšea maeto ‘Shortleft’ go ya diprofense tša rena tša go fapana.

src_text: Domestic tourism is critical in the recovery of the tourism sector, which contributes greatly to the South African GDP and job creation.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogela gape sephetho sa Air Belgium go fofiša difofane tša sehla go ya Afrika Borwa, go thoma kgwedi yona ye (Lewedi), seo se tla matlafatšago boeti gomme sa tiišetša maemo rena bjalo ka nepo ya boeti ya kgetho.

src_text: Cabinet is pleased that the hospitality sector has recorded an increase in visitors post the COVID-19 period.
tgt_text: Se tla akaretša difofane tša beke ye nngwe le ye nngwe go ya Motsekapa le Johannesburg  Melaetša.

src_text: The.
tgt_text: DitebogišoKabinete lebogiša le go lakaletša tše dibotse go:Mopresidente William Samoei Ruto wa Repabliki ya Kenya, yoo hlomamišitšwego ka Labobedi, 13 Lewedi 2022, go latela dikgetho tša bosetšhaba tša khutšo tšeo di swerwego ka la 9 Phato.

src_text: 2 million domestic trips taken in the first half of 2022 recorded 114% increase when compared to the same period in.
tgt_text: Motlatšamopresidente David Mabuza tsenetše tlhomamišo legatong la Mopresidente Ramaphosa, le mmušo le batho ba Repabliki ya Afrika Borwa.South African Rugby Union le Toropokgolo ya Motsekapa go swara phadišano ya bo seswai ya Rugby World Cup Sevens gare ga 9 le 11 Lewedi be le lekga la mathomo tiragalo ye ye bohlokwa swarwa ke naga ya Afrika gomme barati ba diketekete bao ba tsenetšego ba ilwe ba thabišwa ka dijo tša rugby le kamogelo ye lemogwago ya Afrika Borwa.

src_text: This showed marked improvement for the same period in 2019, which saw.
tgt_text: MahlokoKabinete romela melaetša ya mahloko go malapa le bagwera ba:Bana ba sekolo ba 18 le batho ba bagolo ba babedi bao ba hlokofetšego mo kotsing ye šoro ka Pongola, KwaZulu-Natal ka Labohlano, 16 Lewedi 2022 ka morago ga go thulana ga lori le bene yeo bego nameditše bana ba sekolo  Bao ba Thwetšwego Mešomong.

src_text: 6 million domestic trips taken.
tgt_text: Batho ka moka bao ba thwetšwego mešomong mangwalo bona dithuto tla tiišetšwa le go netefatšwa ka maleba  Morena Makgothi Samuel Thobakgale bjalo ka Molaodimogolophethiši (DG): Mokhomišinare wa Setšhaba wa Kgoro ya Ditirelo tša Tshokollo  Ngaka Malixole Percival Mahlati bjalo ka Motlatšamolaodimogolophethiši (DDG: lefapheng la go šoma ka merero ya Dikolo tša Maokelo tša Thuto ya Godimo ka moka le ya Tlhabollo ya Bašomi mo Kgorong ya Maphelo  Morena Siyabonga Blessing Mdubeki bjalo ka Mohlahlobimogolophethiši mo Kgorong ya Temo, Tsošološo ya Naga le Tlhabollo ya Dinagamagaed.

src_text: As part of celebrating Tourism Month, Cabinet encourages South Africans to undertake ‘Shotleft’ tours to our various provinces.
tgt_text: Morena Phaswa Phineas Mamogale bjalo ka Mohlankedimogolo wa Ditšhelete mo Kgorong ya Maphelo.

src_text: Issues in the environment.
tgt_text: Tšhireletšego ya Meetse.

src_text: Water security.
tgt_text: Kabinete lebogile MaAfrika Borwa ka moka ge ba obametše taelo ya go fokotšwa ga meetse ye phethagaditšwego dikarolong tše dingwe tša Johannesburg, Tshwane le Ekurhuleni go boetša sekeng maemo matamo.

src_text: Cabinet thanked South Africans for adhering to water restrictions implemented in certain parts of Johannesburg, Tshwane and Ekurhuleni to stabilise the capacity of reservoirs.
tgt_text: Matamo ka mehutahuta ka fase ga kgatelelo ye kgolo kudu ka baka la dithemphereitšha tša go fiša tšhiritšhiri gola Gauteng, ebile nyakego ye golelago godimo ya meetse gapeleditše Rand Water go fokotša ka bontši meetse ao abelwago mebasepala.

src_text: Dams and reservoirs remain under pressure due to high temperatures in Gauteng, and increasing demand forced Rand Water to reduce water supply to municipalities drastically.
tgt_text: Rand Water aba meetse go nwega mantši bathong ba go feta 11 milione go la Gauteng, dikarolong tše dingwe tša Mpumalanga, Freistata le Leboa Bodikela.

src_text: The water utility supplies bulk potable water to more than 11 million people in Gauteng, parts of Mpumalanga, the Free State and North West.
tgt_text: Tšona diphokotšo tše tša go se efogege di nepile go boloka kabo ya meetse ebile di tla dula di le gona go ba go fihlela ge seemo se kaonafala.

src_text: These unavoidable restrictions aim to secure water supply and will remain in place until the situation improves.
tgt_text: Kabinete dirile boipiletšo setšhabeng go tšwelapele go obamela magato phokotšo ya meetse le go kgatha tema ya bona ka go šomiša ka tshwanelo ka ge le sedirišwa sa go hlokwa kudu.

src_text: Cabinet called on the public to continue adhering to the water restrictions and play their part by using this scarce resource sparingly.
tgt_text: Mogwanto wa Transnet.

src_text: Transnet strike.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše kwano ya meputso ya mengwaga ye meraro ye kwanetšwego ke Transnet le Yunione ya Mohlakanelwa ya Bosetšhaba ya Dinamelwa (UNTU), ye tlo dirišwago pakeng ya 1 Moranang 2022 go fihla ka la 31 Hlakola.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the three-year wage deal reached between Transnet and the United National Transport Union (UNTU), which is applicable for the period 1 April 2022 to 31 March.
tgt_text: Khomišene ya Poelano, Bonamodi le Ditherišano namotše kwano ye, gomme magato bona dirile gore boipelaetšo ka maloko UNTU bo fedišwe ka ponyo ya leihlo.

src_text: The Commission for Conciliation, Mediation and Arbitration mediated this deal, which ended the current industrial action by members of UNTU with immediate effect.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše gape sephetho sa go fediša mogwanto ka Yunione ya Dinamelwa ya Afrika Borwa le ya Bašomi.

src_text: Cabinet also welcomed the decision by the South African Transport and Allied Workers Union to call off the strike.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše boikgafo bja Transnet bja go bea šedi godimo ga go fediša ditšhalelomorago tše bilego gona go ralala boemakepe le dipeakanyong tša ditimela nakong ya magato boipelaetšo, ao bilego le seabe se se mpe ikonoming le makaleng ao tshepetšego godimo ga Transnet go aba ditirelo..   Kabinete bontšhitše tebogo ya yona godimo ga thekgo le tšhomišanommogo ye laeditšwego ke dikgwebo ka nako ya mogwanto hlohleletša kamano ye sa felego magareng ga balaodi ba Transnet le bašomi gore khamphani ye le ikonomi ya naga ka bophara di holege.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the commitment by Transnet to focus on clearing backlogs that occurred across the port and rail system during the industrial action, which negatively impacted the economy and sectors that are dependent on its services..
tgt_text: Dikamano tša Afrika Borwa le Saudi Arabia.

src_text: Cabinet expressed its gratitude to the support and cooperation given by business during the strike.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše Ketelo ya Mošomo ye atlegilego ya go ya kua the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia ka Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa ka la 15 le 16 Diphalane.

src_text: It encourages continuous relationship between Transnet management and labour for the benefit of the company and the economy of the country.
tgt_text: Nakong ya keteko ye, dinaga tše ka bobedi di saenetše Dimemorantamo tše 17 tša Kwešišano go magoro go fapafapana go swana le temo, boreatlhapi, meepo, enetši ya go mpšhafatšega, tšhireletšego, dinamelwa le temo ya diphedi le dimela tša ka meetseng.

src_text: South Africa – Saudi Arabia relations.
tgt_text: Dimemorantamo tše dingwe tša kwešišano tšeo di saenetšwego ke tša mabapi le go hlongwa ga Khansele ya Mohlakanelwa ya Dikgwebo, tšhomišano legorong la diintasteri tša sešole le dithekišetšano, tšhomišano ya ditekolonyakišišo tša thutaswika.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the successful Working Visit to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia by President Cyril Ramaphosa on 15 and 16 October.
tgt_text: Mopresidente šomišitše ketelo ye go mema dikgwebo tša Saudi Arabia go iponagatša khonferenseng ya bohlano ya dipeeletšo ya Afrika Borwa ye tlo swarwago ka.

src_text: During the visit, the two countries signed 17 Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) in various fields such as agriculture, fisheries, mining, renewable energy, security, transport and aquaculture.
tgt_text: Saudi Arabia ke mogwebišani wa bobedi wo mogologolo wa Afrika Borwa seleteng sa Bohlabelagare ebile ke mothopo wo mogologolo wa diromelwa ka nageng go tšwa go sona selete se.

src_text: Other MoUs signed are on the establishment of Joint Business Council, cooperation in the field of military industries and procurements, and on geological survey cooperation.
tgt_text: Dikamano tša boditšhabatšhaba magareng ga dinaga tše ka bobedi di bile le ditlamorago tše botse godimo ga ditlwaedi tša kgwebišano le dipeeletšo.

src_text: The President used the visit to invite Saudi Arabia businesses to South Africa’s fifth investment conference that will be held in.
tgt_text: Dipeeletšo tša Mananeokgoparara.

src_text: Saudi Arabia is South Africa’s second largest trading partner in the Middle East and the largest source of imports from the region.
tgt_text: Kabinete amogetše go thongwa ga polante ya tšweletšo ya plastiki ya maemo godimodimo lefaseng ka khampani ya go dira plastiki yeo tšwago pele maemong boditšhabatšhaba, ya go bitšwa ALPLA Group, go la Lanseria kua Gauteng.

src_text: International relations between both countries have resulted in positive effect on trade and investment trends.
tgt_text: Se se tlaleletša maikgafo Mopresidente Ramaphosa go bea sekeng tlhabollo ya mananeokgoparara bjalo ka mokgwa wa go hlohleletša kgolo ya ikonomi le go atiša mešomo..   Dipeeletšo tša boleng bja US$50 milione di kgatha tema ye kgolo godimo ga Leanolegolo la Toropo ya Mabonwa ya Lanseria leo le tlo hlohleletšago seemo seo se tieletšego le tšhomišoleswa le gape go hlola le go šireletša mešomo ye.

src_text: Infrastructure investment.
tgt_text: Godimo ga dipeeletšo tše go akaretšwa le lenaneo la go ithutela mošomo la batsebi ba 36 ba bointšineere bja dikgerekgere le ba tšhomišogape ba ditiro tša ALPLA Group go ralala selete sa Borwa bja Afrika.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the commissioning of state-of-the-art plastics production plant by leading international manufacturer, the ALPLA Group, at Lanseria in Gauteng.
tgt_text: Lenaneo le la boithutelamošomo le tlo thoma ka 2023, ka baithutelamošomo ba mathomo ba 12 ba MaAfrika Borwa ba go tšwa mafelong ka mo nageng.

src_text: This augments President Ramaphosa’s commitment to position infrastructure development as means to stimulate the economy and increase employment..
tgt_text: Meepo ye Sego Molaong.

src_text: The investment worth US$50 million is key contribution to the Lanseria Smart City masterplan that will drive sustainability and recycling as well as create and sustain 350 jobs.
tgt_text: Meepo ye sego molaong kweša setšhaba bohloko le go gobatša ikonomi ya gaborena, ebile dipoelo tša yona ke tobo ya letseno go bobedi mmušo le lefapha la meepo..   Kabinete amogetše go amogwa ga dithunya tšeo di bego di utilwe le go golegwa ga bagononelwa ba 20 ba go amana le meepo ye sego molaong ka nako ya lesolophuruphutšo kua mokoting wa moepo wa Stilfontein go la Leboa Bodikela.

src_text: Included is an apprenticeship programme for 36 mechatronics and recycling technicians for ALPLA Group operations across southern Africa.
tgt_text: Kabinete dira boipiletšo go MaAfrika Borwa go tšwelapele go šomišana le mabotho phethagatšo ya molao go netefatša go atlega ga masolo kamoso twantšho ya bosenyi.

src_text: The apprentice programme will commence in 2023, with the first 12 South African apprentices coming from local communities.
tgt_text: Se se tla romela molaetša wo bogale wa gore bosenyi ga bo thuše ka selo, le gore badirabosenyi ba tlo golegwa le go sekišwa ntle poifo goba go šokelwa..  Enetši.

src_text: Illegal mining.
tgt_text: Eskom saenetše dikwanelo tša go hiriša tša mengwaga ye 30 gotee le babeeletši ba bane ba batšweletši ba go ikema ba mohlagase go aga metšhene ye mefsa ya go fehla enetši ya go hlweka kua ditišing tša mohlagase tša Majuba le Tutuka gola Mpumalanga.

src_text: Illegal mining hurts communities and our economy, and results in loss of revenue for both government and the mining sector..
tgt_text: Khirišo ye ya seripa sa naga tla goketša dipeeletšo tše phopholeditšwego tša go batamela R40 bilione.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the seizure of firearms cache and the arrest of 20 suspects linked to illegal mining during an operation at mineshaft in Stilfontein in North West.
